Logos of major league pickleball teams competing at MILP National Championships 2025, part of DUPR‚Äôs Minor League Pickleball

Atlanta Bouncers
Brooklyn Pickleball Team
Columbus Sliders
Dallas Flash
DC Pickleball Team
Phoenix Flames
St. Louis Shock
Texas Ranchers

‚Äç

Note: Any player who competes in an official Minor League Pickleball event during the 2025 season is eligible to play at Nationals, as long as they join a team that receives an invitation.

‚Äç

With registration opening in August 2025, there's still plenty of time to play, earn points, and climb the National DUPR Leaderboard. Those who qualify will receive an official invitation to register and compete for a shot at the national title.

‚Äç

From Rec Play to Pro¬†

‚Äç

Many of today‚Äôs top professional players ‚Äî including Jack Munro, Connor Garnett, and Kate Fahey ‚Äî got their start in Minor League Pickleball. With divisions spanning from DUPR 12 to DUPR 22, Nationals is where rising talent proves they‚Äôre ready for the next level.

‚Äç

New for 2025:

‚Äç

Gendered 3v3 Divisions for men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs teams
An Open Division with no rating cap¬† ‚Äî anyone can compete regardless of their¬† DUPR
Adjusted team aggregate caps exclusively for Nationals to maintain fair, competitive play

‚Äç

MiLP DUPR Divisions for the 2025 National Championship

‚Äç

Divisions include:

‚Äç

‚Äç

‚Äç

The division aggregate maximum ending in .900 only applies for Nationals. The regular aggregate maximum ending in .300 will stay in effect for all other Minor League Pickleball events.

‚Äç

MiLP v3 National Championship Divisions

‚Äç

The Dink MiLP v3 National Championship is open to any player who competes in official v3 and/or v4 tournaments during the 2025 season. All players from 2025 MiLP National Championship 4-person mixed teams ‚Äî whether open age or 50+ ‚Äî are eligible to participate. Registration for the v3 Championship will be on a first-come, first-served basis.¬†

‚Äç

‚Äç

Schedule for the 2025 National Championship:¬†

‚Äç

Wednesday, December 3rd:

‚Äç

50+ Divisions Round Robin (12, 14, 16, 18, 20)
DUPR Coach

‚Äç

Thursday, December 4th:

‚Äç

50+ Divisions Playoffs (12, 14, 16, 18, 20)
DUPR Coach

‚Äç

Friday, December 5th:

‚Äç

v3 Tournament (Round Robin and Playoffs)

‚Äç

Saturday, December 6th:

‚Äç

Open Age Divisions Round Robin (12, 14, 16, 18, 20, 22)

‚Äç

Sunday, December 7th:

‚Äç

Open Age Divisions Playoffs (12, 14, 16, 18, 20, 22)

‚Äç

‚Äç

Points & Prize Money¬†

‚Äç

MiLP rewards more than just winning ‚Äî it rewards consistency. Players earn leaderboard points at every event, with 1st place teams receiving 1,000 points (or 2,000 points at Regionals). Points are awarded through 16th place and updated monthly on the National DUPR Leaderboard.

‚Äç

When it comes to prize money at Nationals, there's a lot on the line:

‚Äç

4-person mixed teams (MiLP): Prize money will be awarded to the top three teams in each division.


MiLP v3 divisions: Only first-place teams will receive prize money.

üí° Exact prize amounts for each division and placement will be announced closer to the event.

title: World Team Pickleball Partners with DUPR to Implement Exclusive Rating System Across Events
summary: Learn how World Team Pickleball Combines and DUPR Coach Sessions deliver accurate pickleball ratings and unlock new opportunities for players.
content:
If you've watched high-level pickleball or scrolled through highlight reels, you've probably seen a player leap toward the sideline, slam a volley near the net, and land dramatically outside the court. That move? It's called an Erne.

‚Äç

What Is an Erne?

‚Äç

An Erne is a legal volley hit near the net, outside the non-volley zone (kitchen). It‚Äôs typically executed by jumping over or running around the NVZ. A player can even run through the NVZ‚Äîas long as the player doesn‚Äôt strike the ball until both feet have landed completely outside the zone. You can even volley the ball while in the air, as long as you never touch the NVZ or its lines. This aggressive move allows players to take the ball early and close to the net while staying fully within the rules.

‚Äç

This aggressive shot is named after Erne Perry, a pickleball player who frequently used the move in tournament play.

‚Äç

‚Äç

‚Äç

Why Is the Erne Legal?

‚Äç

According to official pickleball rules, you can't volley a ball while standing inside the non-volley zone (NVZ) ¬†However, you can legally enter the NVZ‚Äîas long as both feet make contact with the ground outside the zone before hitting a volley.

‚Äç

There are a few ways to legally execute an Erne:

‚Äç

Jump over the sideline and land outside the NVZ


Run through the NVZ and land with both feet outside before making contact


Stay airborne and strike the ball before landing, as long as you never touch the NVZ or its lines

‚Äç


‚úÖ The key: if you‚Äôve touched the NVZ then you cannot volley the ball until both feet make contact fully outside the NVZ.

‚Äç
How Does an Erne Work Strategically?

‚Äç

The Erne is a high-risk, high-reward shot. Here‚Äôs why it‚Äôs effective:

‚Äç

Surprises opponents by taking time away
Cuts off dinks or slow cross-court shots near the sideline
Forces weak returns or outright winners

‚Äç

However, if timed wrong, it leaves you out of position and vulnerable. That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs usually used by advanced players rated 4.0 and above.¬†

‚Äç
How to Practice an Erne?

‚Äç

Anticipate the shot: Look for predictable cross-court dinks or pop-ups near the sideline
Position early: Get to the edge of the NVZ before the ball crosses the net
Time your move: Lunge or jump to hit the ball at its peak

‚Äç

Stay legal: If you‚Äôve touched the NVZ, avoid volleying the ball until both feet make contact outside the NVZ.

‚Äç

The Erne is one of the most exciting and bold moves in pickleball. It‚Äôs not easy to pull off, but when done right, it adds pressure, flair, and momentum to your game. Whether you're aiming to climb your DUPR rating or just shake things up in rec play, the Erne is a move worth learning.

‚Äç

‚Äç

title: The Perfect Plan for Mother‚Äôs Day: Play Doubles with Your Mum üéæüíê
summary: Looking for plans to do for Mother‚Äôs Day? Play pickleball doubles with your mom! Find fun pickleball tournaments near you. Events available for all pickleball ratings.
content:
Let‚Äôs discuss one of the most misunderstood (and most broken) pickleball rules. If you want to play smarter and raise your pickleball ratings ‚Äî this one‚Äôs for you.

‚Äç

The Double Bounce Rule is one of the core regulations in pickleball. It states that both teams must allow the ball to bounce once on each side before volleys (hitting the ball in the air without a bounce) are permitted:

‚Äç

The receiving team must let the serve bounce before returning the ball.
The serving team must also let the return bounce before hitting their next shot.

‚Äç

‚Äç

‚Äç

Why Does the Double Bounce Rule Matter?

‚Äç

This rule is crucial for keeping pickleball balanced and strategic. Here‚Äôs why:

‚Äç

Prevents unfair advantage‚ÄîThe serving team doesn‚Äôt immediately dominate by rushing the net.
Encourages longer rallies‚ÄîSince players must play from deeper positions initially, points last longer and are more engaging.
Supports controlled play‚ÄîBeginners and advanced players alike must approach each rally with strategy, rather than sheer power.

‚Äç

How to Use the Double Bounce Rule to Your Advantage

‚Äç

While the rule might seem like a simple requirement, smart players use it strategically to control the game. Here are some pro tips:

‚Äç

Aim deep returns‚ÄîA well-placed return that pushes opponents back makes their next shot harder.
Anticipate the bounce‚ÄîKnowing exactly where the ball will land allows for quicker reaction time.
Set up for strong volleys‚ÄîAfter the initial two bounces, be ready to move up and take control with fast-paced shots.

‚Äç

Common Mistakes Players Make

‚Äç

Even experienced players occasionally slip up on the Double Bounce Rule. Here are a few mistakes to avoid:

‚Äç

Hitting the return before it bounces‚ÄîRemember, you must let the serve bounce before playing your shot.
Rushing the net too soon‚ÄîStay patient! Moving in before the second bounce can leave you out of position.
Misjudging the bounce‚ÄîFailing to read the ball‚Äôs trajectory can lead to weak returns.

‚Äç

The Double Bounce Rule isn‚Äôt just a technical requirement‚Äîit shapes the pace, fairness, and strategy of pickleball. Whether you‚Äôre competing in pickleball tournaments, aiming to improve your pickleball ratings, or just enjoying the sport, mastering this rule will give you an edge.

‚Äç

Want to elevate your game? Find a tournament near you and start practicing how to use the Double Bounce Rule to control rallies and win more points!

‚Äç

title: From Tennis Prodigy to CNC Finalist: Ellie Douglas Shines in Her First DUPR Pickleball Tournament
summary: Ellie Douglas shares her journey from tennis to her first DUPR pickleball tournament, making a surprise run to the CNC finals. A must-read for collegiate pickleball fans!
content:
Mother‚Äôs Day is just around the corner, and if you're like most of us, you‚Äôve probably Googled ‚Äúbest plans to do for Mother‚Äôs Day‚Äù at least once. Flowers and brunch are classics‚Äîbut what if this year, you gave your mom the one thing she really wants: your time?

‚Äç

That‚Äôs right. Studies (and let‚Äôs be honest, your mom‚Äôs hints) make it clear: the best Mother‚Äôs Day gifts are the ones that let you spend quality time together.

‚Äç

And what better way to do that than by stepping onto the pickleball court for a doubles match with your mum?

‚Äç

‚Äç

Why Pickleball? It‚Äôs All About Fun + Bonding

‚Äç

Pickleball is the perfect mix of fun, fitness, and connection. Whether your mom is already a fan of the game or brand new to the sport, it‚Äôs incredibly beginner-friendly‚Äîand a fantastic way to share laughs, get moving, and create memories.

‚Äç

Plus, pickleball is one of the few sports that bridges generations. It‚Äôs not uncommon to see families‚Äîkids, parents, and even grandparents‚Äîsharing the same court.

‚Äç

‚Äç

No Experience? No Problem!

‚Äç

If you or your mom are new to pickleball, don‚Äôt stress. Most pickleball tournaments offer divisions for every DUPR rating and skill level. Whether you‚Äôre total beginners or seasoned players, there‚Äôs a spot for you.

‚Äç

The best part? These tournaments aren‚Äôt just about competition‚Äîthey‚Äôre about community and fun. You‚Äôll meet other players, soak up great vibes, and share something special with your mom that goes way beyond a store-bought gift.

‚Äç

‚Äç

How to Find a Pickleball Tournament Near You

‚Äç

Ready to take your Mother‚Äôs Day plan to the next level? Download the DUPR App and check out local clubs and pickleball organizations near you. Many host pickleball tournaments throughout May, and you can easily find events that match your DUPR pickleball rating.

‚Äç

Not sure where to start? Head over to DUPR to explore upcoming tournaments, get rated, and track your progress. The Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating (DUPR) system makes it easy to find events that fit your level‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre just starting out or aiming for gold.

‚Äç

‚Äç

The Ultimate Gift: Time Together

‚Äç

At the end of the day, it‚Äôs not about winning (although hey, a medal would be nice üòÑ). It‚Äôs about giving your mom the one thing she‚Äôll treasure most: your time and attention.

‚Äç

So this year, skip the crowded brunch spot. Lace up your court shoes, grab a paddle, and team up with your mom for a Mother‚Äôs Day you‚Äôll both remember forever.

‚Äç

P.S. Don‚Äôt forget to snap a photo of your pickleball adventure and tag us at @duprpb ‚Äîwe‚Äôd love to see your Mother‚Äôs Day doubles squad in action!

title: What Is a Round Robin and How to Run It?
summary: Learn what a round robin format is, how it compares to other pickleball tournament types, and why it's ideal for accurate DUPR pickleball ratings.
content:
Mesa, AZ ‚Äì May 8, 2025 ‚Äì Arizona Athletic Grounds is proud to announce its designation as the first official DUPR Assessment Center in Arizona. This milestone is a significant development for the local pickleball community, empowering players at every level, from recreational to competitive, with the ability to receive official DUPR ratings. As the first of its kind in the region, Arizona Athletic Grounds is setting the stage for a stronger, more connected pickleball community through skill parity, common language, and a deeper focus on player development.

‚Äç

The integration of DUPR ratings for all players, from recreational enthusiasts to competitive athletes, is an essential step in the continued growth and evolution of pickleball. DUPR, the Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating, serves as the gold standard and a universally recognized benchmark for assessing skill levels across the sport. With this new designation as a DUPR Assessment Center, Arizona Athletic Grounds is leading the way by ensuring that every player can understand their abilities and connect with others at the right skill level.

‚Äç

‚Äç

Coach-Assigned DUPR ratings are a transformative tool for recreational and community-level players, ensuring that skill parity is maintained across the board. These ratings, assigned by credentialed DUPR Coaches, provide a clear and consistent measure of a player‚Äôs abilities, enabling them to find appropriate competition and avoid mismatched games. This system creates a common language that can be used across clubs, leagues, and tournaments, fostering community growth and player development.

‚Äç

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre excited to announce Arizona Athletic Grounds as a DUPR Assessment Center and to bring Coach-Assigned DUPR ratings to Arizona,‚Äù said Tito Machado, CEO of DUPR. ‚ÄúHaving a rating system for all players, from beginners to advanced, ensures that every game played is as enjoyable and competitive as possible. Our rating system is more than just numbers; it‚Äôs about creating a universally understood framework for the sport. Arizona Athletic Grounds is now in the unique position to offer this tool to the entire region, making pickleball more inclusive and accessible for everyone.‚Äù

‚Äç

Arizona Athletic Grounds is now home to a team of credentialed DUPR Coaches who are responsible for assessing and assigning ratings to players. With the ability to rate non-rated players, these coaches will play a pivotal role in the development of the local pickleball scene. This initiative brings every player into the same community, whether or not they‚Äôve logged a match, and helps establish a shared language of skill levels. Players will know where they belong on the court and where they should play to have the most fun.

‚Äç

‚ÄúDUPR stands as the gold standard in pickleball, creating a unified system that helps players find the right matchups and drives the sport forward,‚Äù said Katie Nimitz, President of My Journey Pickleball. ‚ÄúArizona Athletic Grounds is home to one of the most active and passionate pickleball communities of Mesa, AZ and across the country. With this designation and the leadership of credentialed DUPR Coaches, they are uniquely positioned to bring non-rated players into the fold, strengthen connections on the court, and help keep the sport we love thriving for years to come.‚Äù

‚Äç

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre excited to be leading the charge in growing pickleball in Arizona,‚Äù said Ben Worley, Director of Pickleball at Arizona Athletic Grounds. ‚ÄúWith DUPR ratings now available for all players, we‚Äôre empowering individuals to track their progress and find the right competition for their skill level. This will not only enhance the enjoyment and competitiveness of the game but also ensure that pickleball remains inclusive and accessible for everyone, regardless of where they‚Äôre starting.‚Äù

‚Äç

About Arizona Athletic Grounds

‚Äç

AAG is one of the largest youth-oriented sports and entertainment facilities in North America. The Mesa, Ariz., facility serves millions of visitors per year, providing athletic and special events programming. The website, www.azgrounds.com, and social media, @azgrounds.com, are the landing pages for information. For additional information on rentals, sponsorships, or event programming, please reach out to the AAG team at info@azgrounds.com.

‚Äç

About DUPR

‚Äç

DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) is the premier global pickleball rating system and technology platform, trusted by the world's leading clubs, tournaments, leagues, and players. DUPR's dynamic rating system unifies pickleball across age, gender, and location by analyzing match results to accurately evaluate all players across a 2.000 - 8.000 scale. DUPR is the official pickleball rating of leagues, tournaments, and clubs around the world, including United Pickleball Association (UPA), PPA, Major League Pickleball (MLP), Pickleball.com, Life Time, The Picklr, National Team Pickleball League, National Pickleball League. It also owns and operates Minor League Pickleball and Collegiate Pickleball, two of the biggest amateur leagues in the sport. Players and operators can visit www.dupr.com to sign up and learn more.

‚Äç

About DUPR Coach

‚Äç

DUPR Coach is a program designed to empower pickleball coaches to launch Coach-Assigned DUPR ratings for the 34 million non-rated players worldwide. Powered by MyJourney Pickleball, DUPR Coach helps coaches provide valuable insights into players' skill levels and supports the growth of pickleball through more competitive, enjoyable play. To learn more about the DUPR Coach program, visit www.duprcoach.com/coach-cert.

‚Äç

How to easily run one

üîÑ What Is a Round Robin in Pickleball?

‚Äç

A Round Robin is a tournament format where every player or team plays against every other player or team in their group. Unlike bracket-style tournaments, no one gets eliminated early‚Äîeveryone gets consistent playtime.

‚Äç

This format is perfect for ensuring fairness, building community, and‚Äîwhen connected to DUPR‚Äîproviding high-quality match data that improves the accuracy of pickleball ratings.

Round Robin gives players:

ü§ù Even skill-level exposure


üìà Match history that actually reflects performance over time

title: 2025 US Open Pickleball Championships Recap
summary: Catch the top moments from the 2025 US Open Pickleball Championships. 3,500+ players, 5,600+ matches‚Äîall boosting DUPR pickleball ratings worldwide.
content:
When Jason Perez, Director of Conejo Valley Pickleball in Southern California, traveled to Germany, he didn‚Äôt expect to spark a new chapter in the global pickleball movement. But that‚Äôs exactly what happened‚Äîthanks to a single paddle, a passion for the sport, and DUPR, the world's leading pickleball ratings system.¬†

‚Äç

Playing Under Bridges and Building a Community

‚Äç

In Munich, a German city with no official pickleball courts, local players had been improvising‚Äîchalking lines on concrete, playing in parking lots and even under historic bridges when the river was low.¬†

‚Äç

‚ÄúThey play as much as they can,‚Äù Jason said. ‚ÄúSometimes the police come and kick them out, but they‚Äôre out there whenever possible.‚Äù

‚Äç

Despite the limited infrastructure, the enthusiasm was palpable. Many were tennis players trying to shift their community toward pickleball‚Äîbut lacked an organizational framework.

‚Äç

‚Äç

Enter DUPR: A Global Connection Tool

‚Äç

Jason introduced the group to DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating), which they had only seen from watching pro matches online. Once they understood how DUPR could bring structure and credibility to their local play, everything changed.

‚Äç

The German players wasted no time ‚Äî they approached Jason, asking if they could start a digital club and track their ratings. By the very next day, they had made it happen, launching a DUPR digital pickleball club in Germany within hours.

‚Äç

‚Äç

A Sister Club Across the Atlantic

‚Äç

What started as a casual open play session evolved into an international connection. The new German pickleball club named ‚ÄúPickleball Crew Germany‚Äù and Jason‚Äôs Conejo Valley group now operate as sister clubs, sharing resources, rating guidance, and community support.

‚Äç

‚ÄúIt turns out to be somebody that I would say is a friend‚Äîor friends‚Äîin Germany,‚Äù Jason shared. ‚ÄúThey now have their DUPR club and they‚Äôre asking how we do things. It‚Äôs a fun community.‚Äù

‚Äç

Overcoming Obstacles with Creativity

‚Äç

Without the luxury of dedicated pickleball facilities, the German players have shown remarkable resourcefulness‚Äîrenting gymnasiums, using rubber courts, and even transforming concrete slabs into playable surfaces. Some players discovered pickleball while visiting the U.S., returning with paddles, nets, and a mission to bring the sport home.

‚Äç

Now, they‚Äôre not only playing regularly‚Äîthey‚Äôre hosting tournaments, tracking DUPR ratings, and expanding their reach across nearby cities.

‚Äç

Why This Matters

‚Äç

This story perfectly illustrates how DUPR isn‚Äôt just a pickleball rating system‚Äîit‚Äôs a global community builder. Whether you‚Äôre in California or Cologne, DUPR empowers players and clubs to:

‚Äç

Create verified communities

Track and improve player skill levels

Connect with clubs around the world

Grow the sport locally with global support

‚Äç

Want to Start a DUPR Club?

‚Äç

If you're looking to grow pickleball in your area‚Äîwhether you're in a major metro or chalking lines in a parking lot‚ÄîDUPR is here to help.

‚Äç

Learn more about starting your own DUPR club

Whether you're new to DUPR or just getting more serious about your pickleball game, joining a pickleball digital club or DUPR club is one of the easiest and most impactful ways to connect with players at your level, get consistent matches, and start tracking your progress more accurately.

‚Äç

Unlike casual open play, DUPR Clubs offer structured environments where matches count toward your pickleball ratings and club leaders can help facilitate fair, competitive play. The best part? Joining a DUPR Club is quick, free, and only takes a few steps.

‚Äç

Here‚Äôs how to do it:

‚Äç

1. Create (or Find) Your DUPR Profile

‚Äç

First, go to mydupr.com and search for your name. If you've ever played in a DUPR-rated event or tournament, there's a good chance your profile already exists.

‚Äç

If you find a profile with your name: Use DUPR's Contact Form to claim it.
If not: Click "Sign Up" to create a new DUPR account.

‚Äç

Make sure to complete your profile with your full name, city, state, country, and any other basic info to help clubs and players find you.

‚Äç

2. Search for a DUPR Club

‚Äç

Once you're logged in, navigate to the left-hand menu and click "Clubs".¬†

‚Äç

If you know the name of a club, simply enter it in the search bar. You can also browse clubs in your area or check out clubs that host DUPR-rated events near you.

‚Äç

3. Request to Join the Club

‚Äç

Once you find the club you‚Äôre looking for, click into its profile page. You‚Äôll see a "Join" button near the top.¬†

‚Äç

As a member of a DUPR digital club, you can:¬†

‚Äç

Participate in club matches and DUPR-rated sessions ‚úÖ¬†
Read player leaderboards ‚úÖ¬†
Find out about club events, challenges, and team formats ‚úÖ¬†

‚Äç

Why Join a DUPR Club?

‚Äç

Play with purpose: Your games will count toward your DUPR rating and help you track real progress.
Get fairer matches: Clubs group players by skill level, so you‚Äôre playing people close to your rating.
Find community: DUPR Clubs are built around connection, competition, and growth. Whether you're in it for fun or focused improvement, there‚Äôs a club that fits.

‚Äç

Ready to Find Your Club?

‚Äç

Join a club that fits your game, your goals, and your schedule. Your pickleball journey just got a whole lot better.

‚Äç

‚Üí Log in to DUPR and Join a Club Today

title: DUPR Powers Malaysia‚Äôs Alliance Bank KL Open Pickleball Championship 2025
summary: Discover how DUPR is powering Malaysia's largest pickleball tournament and driving growth in Asia. Learn how DUPR pickleball ratings shape competitive play worldwide.
content:
DUPR Named Official Rating System of Italy‚Äôs FITP ‚Äî One of Europe‚Äôs fastest-growing pickleball communities gets a global standard

‚Äç

Rome, Italy ‚Äî April 23, 2025 ‚Äî DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) is proud to announce its official partnership with the Federazione Italiana Tennis e Padel (FITP), making DUPR the exclusive rating system for all sanctioned pickleball activity in Italy.

‚Äç

This is a major milestone for DUPR and the global growth of pickleball. Italy has quickly become one of the most exciting pickleball markets in Europe ‚Äî with thousands of new players, clubs forming every month, and serious momentum behind national and international competition.

‚Äç

‚ÄúItaly is not just growing in numbers ‚Äî it‚Äôs growing with ambition,‚Äù said Mortada Stitou, Vice-President of Commercial at DUPR. ‚ÄúFITP‚Äôs leadership is building a true ecosystem, and we‚Äôre honored they chose DUPR as the foundation. This gives every Italian player access to the same trusted, global rating used by pros and amateurs around the world.‚Äù

‚Äç

With this partnership, all FITP-sanctioned events and clubs will use DUPR to track player progress and seed matches. Italian players can now see how they stack up on a worldwide scale ‚Äî with real-time updates, match history, and cross-border comparability.

‚Äç

‚ÄúWe believe that fair and transparent competition is essential to the sport,‚Äù said a spokesperson for FITP. ‚ÄúDUPR brings exactly that ‚Äî a reliable rating, easy to use, and trusted internationally. This is a big step forward for the Italian pickleball community.‚Äù
Why It Matters
Italy is a gateway to broader European adoption.
DUPR helps standardize competition ahead of future international events.
It brings player development, tournament planning, and talent scouting onto one platform.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve seen what happens when a country fully adopts DUPR ‚Äî tournaments get better, players level up faster, and clubs thrive,‚Äù said Stitou. ‚ÄúItaly is next.‚Äù

‚Äç

About DUPR

DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) is the premier global pickleball rating system and technology platform, trusted by the world's leading clubs, tournaments, leagues, and players. DUPR's dynamic rating system unifies pickleball across age, gender, and location by analyzing match results to accurately evaluate all players across a 2.000 - 8.000 scale. DUPR is the official pickleball rating of leagues, tournaments and clubs around the world, including United Pickleball Association (UPA), PPA, Major League Pickleball (MLP), Pickleball.com, Life Time, The Picklr, National Team Pickleball League, National Pickleball League. It also owns and operates Minor League Pickleball and Collegiate Pickleball, two of the biggest amateur leagues in the sport. Players and operators can visit www.dupr.com to sign up and learn more.

‚Äç

About FITP

The Federazione Italiana Tennis e Padel is Italy‚Äôs governing body for tennis, padel, and pickleball. It organizes national competitions, oversees player development, and promotes the growth of racket sports throughout Italy.¬†

‚Äç

This Friday, April 25, the Alliance Bank KL Open Pickleball Championship 2025 kicks off at the iconic Pickle Social Club in Kuala Lumpur, the country‚Äôs pickleball epicenter. ‚Äç

Malaysia's Pickleball Boom

3rd in the world for total number of DUPR users


2nd fastest-growing country globally.


Kuala Lumpur ranks #1 in fastest-growing DUPR cities worldwide


Over 400 DUPR clubs active across the country

‚Äç

‚ÄúDUPR coming up with the pickleball rating was a great way for people to play on their level and aspire to go further‚Äù said Samuel Siew, tournament organizer. ‚ÄúIt has been a constant conversation among pickleball players asking each other ‚Äòwhat's your DUPR?‚Äô or¬† ‚Äòhey I'm 4.0 or 3.5‚Äô¬† and I think it's a great way to sort of help the community to find their own bubble, to find their own groups to play and improve and it just sets that whole road map for a player or aspiring player.‚Äù

‚Äç

Why It Matters

The Alliance Bank KL Open isn‚Äôt just another tournament. It represents a deeper shift:

‚Äç

Players from 13 different countries are flying in to compete


Malaysia‚Äôs Youth & Sports Minister will attend the opening ceremony


The event will run 12+ hours per day across three jam-packed days


A Pickleball Summit will run concurrently, bringing together facility owners and sports leaders to discuss the business of the game

‚Äç


From local matches to international reach, DUPR is helping players unlock fair, competitive matches through accurate pickleball ratings, whether they‚Äôre entering an intermediate bracket or chasing a pro dream.

‚Äç

‚ÄúOur player with the highest DUPR rating playing this tournament is Colin Wong. Colin is number #1 in Malaysia with a DUPR of 5.1, definitely a player to watch.‚Äù

‚Äç

‚Äç

‚Äç

‚Äç

What‚Äôs Next for Malaysia?

‚Äç

Malaysia is building a community-driven model of growth.

‚Äç

‚ÄúThe reason this tournament filled up so fast?‚Äù Samuel smiled. ‚ÄúThe community and the social part of it and that's the power of sports; you don't need to speak the same language or share the same religion. Through pickleball you connect with one another, you meet new friends, you become a little bit more competitive and you are more excited to play sports to get active.‚Äù¬†

‚Äç

DUPR is proud to power the growth of pickleball‚Äîin Malaysia, in Southeast Asia, and around the world. This is just the beginning.

‚Äç

Whether you're in Malaysia or watching from afar, keep an eye on the action: Download the DUPR app to track the tournament results.

‚Äç

Your Game. Your Pickleball Rating. Your Journey.

summary: The 2025 Collegiate National Championship made history being the largest collegiate pickleball tournament ever! With 600+ players from 64 schools, rising stars emerged, UT claimed the title, and college teams now head to MLP to face the pros.
content:
If you're serious about improving your DUPR pickleball rating and taking your pickleball game to the next level, you need a structured training plan that focuses on skill development, consistency, and strategy. Whether you're new to the game or looking to sharpen your skills, this guide will provide an easy-to-follow, realistic 4-week training plan to help you boost your pickleball ratings and become a more confident player.

‚Äç

4-Week Pickleball Training Plan

‚Äç

Improving your pickleball skills requires structured practice and competitive play. This 4-week training plan is designed to help amateur players build consistency, refine their shots, and develop a stronger overall game.

¬†

Each week introduces progressive training goals to challenge you while keeping improvements realistic and achievable.

‚Äç

‚úÖ Week 1: Build Consistency ‚Üí Focus on hitting a set number of shots in a row without mistakes.
‚Äç

‚úÖ Week 2: Introduce Spin & Direction ‚Üí Start adding topspin, slice, or variation in placement.
‚Äç

‚úÖ Week 3: Increase Difficulty & Precision ‚Üí Target specific areas of the court.
‚Äç

‚úÖ Week 4: Develop Full Control ‚Üí Spin, depth, and angles should now be intentional.

‚Äç

While training is essential, don‚Äôt forget that playing matches is the key to boosting your DUPR rating. The DUPR app allows you to track your rating and find DUPR-affiliated tournaments to compete against players at your level.¬†

‚Äç

The more you play, the more accurate your rating becomes, making it fair for everyone. Every player has a chance to improve their rating by overperforming ‚Äî whether you're the favorite or the underdog.

‚Äç

‚Äç

‚Äç

How to Approach the Training Plan

‚Äç

üìå Set a Realistic Goal ‚Äì Your target should challenge you but remain achievable. If 10 reps are too easy, aim for more; if it‚Äôs too tough, adjust accordingly. Consistency is key!

‚Äç

üìå Manage Your Mindset ‚Äì Pickleball is as much mental as it is physical. Stay patient, manage frustration, and focus on playing under pressure.

‚Äç

üìå Enhance Physical Conditioning ‚Äì Work on mobility, coordination, strength, and endurance to improve movement and shot execution.

‚Äç

üìå Practice with Purpose ‚Äì Every shot in training should mimic match scenarios. Hit with intention, not just repetition.

‚Äç

üìå Play More Matches ‚Äì Training helps, but matches determine your rating. Play official DUPR tournaments and focus on scoring as many points as you can while keeping your opponents‚Äô score low. Every point counts!

‚Äç

Beyond the Basics: Key Areas to Focus On

‚Äç

Even though technical and strategic challenges are essential, there are other factors to consider:

‚Äç

1. Physical Conditioning & Strength Training
Improve leg strength for quick lateral movement.
Build core strength to enhance balance and shot control.
Use agility drills to improve footwork and reaction speed.

‚Äç

2. Mobility & Stretching
Always warm up before practice (arm circles, lunges, hip openers).
Stretch post-practice to prevent injuries and increase flexibility.

‚Äç

3. On-Court Movement & Footwork
Work on side-to-side agility to improve baseline and NVZ coverage.
Fast split-step drills to react quicker at the net.
Crossover step drills for efficient recovery between shots.

‚Äç

4. Mental Toughness & Strategic Play

When competing against players of similar skill, your mental toughness can be the deciding factor in securing the "W."

‚Äç

Stay calm under pressure and minimize unforced errors.
Play high-percentage shots and avoid unnecessary risks.
Analyze opponents and adjust your strategy based on their weaknesses.

‚Äç

By following this 4-week training plan, you‚Äôll develop consistency, control, and confidence on the court. But remember, practice alone won‚Äôt boost your DUPR rating ‚Äî you need to compete and perform well in matches. Every point matters!

‚Äç

‚úÖ Track your progress in the DUPR app, available on Google Play and in the Apple Store.

‚Äç

‚úÖ Check the DUPR Events Dashboard for upcoming tournaments.

‚Äç

‚úÖ Focus on playing your best every point ‚Äî scoring more leads to greater rating gains.

‚Äç

The more you play, the more accurate your rating becomes‚Äîand every point helps shape it. So train hard, compete smart, and start leveling up your pickleball game today!

title: Pickleball Tournament Nutrition: What to Eat and When
summary: Fuel smarter before, during, and after matches to improve performance, recover faster, get more wins and keep improving your DUPR pickleball rating every time you compete.
content:
The fourth annual Collegiate National Championship brought the heat to Life Time Peachtree Corners in Atlanta, GA. With over 600 players from 64 schools, it was the largest collegiate pickleball event in history! A $40,000+ prize purse was on the line, and teams showed up ready to battle it out.

‚Äç

The Finals: Texas Showdown

The Championship match featured two Texas titans: Texas Christian University (TCU) with a team DUPR of 20.805 and The University of Texas at Austin (UT) with a team DUPR 20.902.

‚Äç

The final went down like this:

WD: TCU 21‚Äì15

MD: UT 21‚Äì18

MXD 1: UT 21‚Äì18

MXD 2: UT 21‚Äì12

‚Äç

UT took the crown, led by Natalie Liu, Eli Trumeter, Zoeya Kahn, and Jack Munro. This marks their first team tournament victory in program history!

‚Äç

Despite having pro player, Jack Munro on the roster for the 2023 Texas Super Regional, they had never clinched a Super Regional title. At the 2023 Nationals, UT went 1-4 in group play without Jack. Even with him back in the lineup, they fell to Utah Tech in the Round of 16 at the 2024 Nationals. The Universtiy of Texas at Austin and Utah Tech have now faced off in the playoff bracket at back-to-back Nationals‚Äîeach time, the winner of that matchup has gone on to win the National Championship.

‚Äç

In their quarterfinal, semifinal, and final matches, Texas followed the same pattern every time: they lost women‚Äôs doubles, then bounced back to win the next three doubles matches, clinching each victory before a DreamBreaker was needed.

‚Äç

‚Äç

Texas Christian University secured an impressive second-place finish. Newcomer Ellie Douglas, who had never competed in a pickleball tournament before this event, provided the boost TCU needed to reach the championship match. The team has shown strong consistency over the years, reaching the semifinals in 2022, the quarterfinals in 2023, and the Round of 16 in 2024, making this run to the finals a major step forward.

‚Äç

‚Äç

Semifinalists Florida Atlantic University (FAU) and Grand Canyon University (GCU) both showcased the rising depth and competitiveness of the collegiate pickleball scene.

‚Äç

For FAU, it was another heartbreaking loss. Despite entering the bracket as the No. 1 seed by DUPR and f No. 1 team after group play, they fell short once again, losing in the semifinals in a DreamBreaker for the second straight tournament.

‚Äç

GCU, on the other hand, had their best Nationals performance to date. After going 1-2 in group play in 2022, improving to 3-2 in 2023, and suffering a Round of 32 exit in 2024, their run to the semifinals this time around marks a huge leap forward for the program.

‚Äç

‚Äç

FAU also took home $2,500.

‚Äç

Check out the full bracket to see the results of all teams from the tournament.

‚Äç

‚Äç

The Fall of the Blue Bloods

For the past three years, the National Championship was dominated by a trio of powerhouse programs‚ÄîUNC, UVA, and Utah Tech‚Äîoften referred to as the ‚ÄúBlue Bloods‚Äù of college pickleball. But 2025 marked a turning point. None of the three reached the semifinals, and only Utah Tech advanced as far as the quarterfinals.

‚Äç

UNC was knocked out in the Round of 32 by GCU and suffered their first-ever group play loss at Nationals‚Äîalso to GCU. UVA fell to Samford in the Round of 16, while Utah Tech‚Äôs run ended against Texas in the quarters.

‚Äç

College vs. Pros

Because of their top finishes, UT and TCU have officially qualified for the Major League Pickleball (MLP) Mid-Season competition, marking the first time collegiate pickleball teams will go head-to-head with the pros in the Challenger Level bracket.

‚Äç

Get ready to see how college stacks up on the big stage.

‚Äç

All-America Teams & East vs. West Game

For the second year in a row, the Collegiate All-America Teams were announced, honoring the top 24 players across the country selected based on:

‚Äç

DUPR
Tournament Performance
Tournament Participation

‚Äç

Each All-America Team features four players from the East and four from the West, split by the Mississippi River. On Friday night, the 1st Team East and 1st Team West battled in the East vs. West Game and this time, East flipped the script with a dominant 4‚Äì0 sweep after losing by the same margin last year.

‚Äç

‚Äç

Team West: (Left to right) Liam Duffin, Jack Munro, Zoeya Kahn, and Megan Wilcox Morales
Team East: (Left to right starting in the middle) Ava Ignatowich, Ava Cavataio, Ryan Morneau, and Carter Maris

‚Äç

Event Highlights

The atmosphere? Electric. Life Time Peachtree Corners gave us indoor and outdoor courts, championship-caliber vibes, and a full fan experience, especially on Championship court.¬†

‚Äç

Reign Storm was in the house with giveaways, ice-cold clean energy, and a DJ! Osaka brought the style with screenprint-your-own exclusive merch, and Frank Works delivered on-court comfort with their high-performance shoes. Also, a big thanks to our sponsor Six Zero for helping us Go Next Level with their great gear and paddles!

‚Äç

Clinic with the Pro Player, Parris Todd

Hundreds entered. Only 12 were chosen.

‚Äç

Before the tournament even kicked off, a lucky group of students got the opportunity to train with pro player Parris Todd. From technique breakdowns to intense drills, plus a photo op, it was a session they'll never forget.

‚Äç

Stay up to date with all future DUPR Collegiate events and highlights on our website at https://www.dupr.com/collegiate-league and follow along on the @duprpb and @collegiatepickleball instagram.

‚Äç

title: ‚ÄçLa RFET y DUPR: Una Alianza Innovadora para la Clasificaci√≥n Global del Pickleball Espa√±ol Federado
summary: Explora la alianza entre RFET y DUPR que introduce un sistema de clasificaci√≥n de pickleball o "pickleball ratings" en Espa√±a, promoviendo el juego competitivo y la mejora continua de habilidades.
content:
The Hidden Opponent: Poor Nutrition

You may think your pickleball game comes down to skill and strategy in the court‚Äìbut your nutrition can be the deciding factor in your performance. A well-fueled body can sustain energy levels, maintain focus, and enhance recovery, while poor nutrition can lead to low energy and stamina, slower reaction times, and costly errors.

‚Äç

If you're struggling to close out tight matches or finding yourself fatigued late in the day, your diet could be the culprit. In fact, bad nutrition could be the main contributor to a loss, damaging your DUPR pickleball rating and holding you back from reaching your full potential on the court.

‚Äç

Here‚Äôs a guide to help you implement a strategic approach to nutrition‚Äìbefore, during, and after play so you always compete at your best.¬†

‚Äç

Pre-Match Nutrition: What to Eat Before a Pickleball Match?

Your pre-match meal plays a crucial role in preparing your body for the demands of competition. Eating the right balance of macronutrients will help ensure sustained energy levels and mental sharpness. Proper pre-match nutrition supports glycogen storage, muscle function, and hydration, all of which are critical for peak performance, which may lead to boosting your pickleball ratings.

‚Äç

60-90 Minutes Before Play:
Carbohydrates: 1g/kg of body weight (provides energy for high-intensity movements and sustains endurance by preserving muscle glycogen stores)
Protein: 0.3 - 0.55g/kg of body weight (supports muscle function, reduces muscle breakdown, and promotes neurotransmitter balance for mental sharpness)
Fat & Fiber: Keep minimal to prevent digestive discomfort, as they slow gastric emptying and may lead to bloating or sluggishness
‚ÄçIdeal snacks pre-match:
A banana with Greek yogurt and honey
Oatmeal with a scoop of protein powder and low-fat milk
A turkey wrap with some grapes
Low-fat cottage cheese with pretzels¬†
In-Match Nutrition: Sustaining Energy Levels

During matches, your body continues to burn glycogen, and dehydration can set in quickly, leading to fatigue, slowed reaction time, and decreased cognitive function. Proper in-match nutrition helps sustain your endurance, power, and focus, ensuring you stay sharp until the final point.

‚Äç

What to Eat During A Pickleball Match?

Your goal for between-match nutrition is to maintain energy without causing digestive distress. Stick to easily digestible, familiar foods that won‚Äôt weigh you down but will keep you sharp and ready for your next pickleball tournament:

Hydration: Aim for 4-8 ounces of water or an electrolyte drink every 15-20 minutes to maintain fluid balance and prevent dehydration.
Carbohydrates for Energy: If matches extend beyond 60 minutes, consume 30-60g of carbohydrates per hour to prevent glycogen depletion.
Electrolytes: Replenish sodium, potassium, and magnesium to reduce the risk of muscle cramps and maintain nerve function if sweating profusely.
Quick Digesting Snacks: Stick to easily digestible, low-fiber foods to prevent gastrointestinal discomfort while providing quick energy.

‚ÄçIdeal Snacks Between Matches:

Applesauce packets
Rice cakes with honey
Fresh watermelon or bananas
Energy bars with simple ingredients
A small peanut butter and jelly sandwich
Electrolyte drinks to replenish lost fluids and minerals if sweating profusely

‚Äç

Ignoring in-match nutrition can lead to low energy levels and mental fatigue‚Äîboth of which can cost you critical points that will affect your pickleball ratings, and, ultimately, the match.

‚Äç

Post-Match Recovery: Rebuilding for the Next Challenge

After each match, focus on replenishing energy stores and supporting muscle recovery. Proper recovery nutrition ensures that you maintain a high level of play throughout the tournament, rather than declining in later rounds.

‚Äç

Post-Match Nutrition Guidelines (unless playing back-to-back games):
Carbohydrates: 0.5-1.0g/kg of body weight (replenishes glycogen stores and restores energy levels)
Protein: 0.2-0.3g/kg of body weight (repairs muscle tissue, reduces soreness, and prevents breakdown)
Fluids: Rehydrate with 16-24 ounces of water or an electrolyte beverage per pound of body weight lost during play.

Weigh yourself before and after to estimate fluid loss

‚ÄçIdeal snacks post-match:

A protein smoothie with banana and almond milk
Chocolate milk and a handful of pretzels
A turkey sandwich on whole-grain bread
Low-fat cottage cheese and toast

‚Äç

Optimizing Long-Term Nutrition for Pickleball

Beyond match-day nutrition, your daily intake can have a significant impact on performance, endurance, and recovery. ‚ÄãOptimizing your long-term nutrition is crucial for enhancing pickleball performance, improving your pickleball ratings, supporting recovery, and maintaining overall health. Incorporating evidence-based dietary strategies can help you meet the physical demands of the sport and achieve your performance goals.

‚Äç

‚ÄçCarbohydrate Recommendations for Training Levels:

Low Activity (Recreational Play): 3-5g/kg/day
Moderate Training (1h/day): 5-7g/kg/day
High Training (2-3h/day): 6-10g/kg/day

Protein Intake for Muscle Maintenance and Recovery

General Needs: 1.2-1.6g/kg/day

Hydration for Performance and Everyday Health

Hydration is critical for maintaining endurance, cognitive function, and recovery. Even a slight level of dehydration can impair performance and increase the risk of muscle cramps.

‚ÄçDaily Fluid Recommendations

Men: ~3.7L (15.5 cups) per day
Women: ~2.7L (11.5 cups) per day

‚Äç

Electrolytes, particularly sodium and potassium, should be replenished through sports drinks or salty snacks if you're sweating excessively.

‚Äç

The Bottom Line: Nutrition Wins Matches

If you're serious about improving your DUPR rating and competing at the highest level, your nutrition needs to be a priority in tandem with your training. If you struggle in long matches or fade late in tournaments, optimizing your nutrition before, during, and after play can help you compete at your highest level.

A bad diet can be the reason you lose a match you should have won.¬† By consistently applying proper nutrition strategies, you can enhance your endurance, sharpen cognitive function, and accelerate recovery, giving you the best shot at success every time you step onto the court.

‚ÄçAIM7 app‚Äôs innovative technology allows you to:

Track your workouts with precision
Monitor your intensity levels to understand nutrition needs
Customize fitness and recovery programs based on your fitness level
Track your progress and celebrate your achievements

Take the first step to a healthier, stronger you. Download the AIM7 app today, it‚Äôs FREE, and start your journey to better health and fitness.¬†

‚Äç

title: Trailblazers on a Mission: Utah Tech Prepares to Defend Their Collegiate National Title
summary: Reigning champs Utah Tech gear up for DUPR Collegiate Nationals with focus, chemistry, and grit. Can the Trailblazers go back-to-back in 2025? Follow now!
content:
April 2025 Recap & Nationals - Collegiate Pickleball Tour

‚Äç

We‚Äôve had 19 events give out bids to the 2025 Collegiate National Championship, which is remarkable due to the short duration of the season! Between those 19 events, we‚Äôve had 118 unique schools participate, and 1,895 total players. As we prepare for the largest tournament in collegiate pickleball history, we look back on how the 2025 season went, and what to know for Nationals.

‚Äç

Super Regionals

‚Äç

Georgia Super Regional

270 players from 25 different schools competed in the 3rd largest collegiate pickleball event (to date) in Atlanta, GA on March 1st-2nd. Hundreds of spectators came to watch the competition unfold on Saturday and Sunday. In the Finals, the defending Georgia Super Regional champions (Florida) went up 2-0 in the best of 5 series against UNC. However, UNC took the victory from the jaws of defeat and won the last 3 games to upset Florida.

Champion: UNC
Bid Winners: UCF, UGA, Kennesaw St., UNF¬†
Results Link
Recording Link

‚Äç

Ohio Super Regional

It was a battle for bids in the Midwest, as only 3 of the 11 schools attending had one at the time of the tournament. Ohio State and Wisconsin were the #1 and #2 teams by DUPR going into the tournament, and they met in the finals with Ohio State prevailing. With 150 players, this is the 5th largest DUPR Collegiate super regional. Largest DUPR collegiate super regional not in the states of VA and GA.

Champion: Ohio State
Bid Winners: Ohio State, Wisconsin, Miami (OH), Michigan State
Results Link
Recording Link

‚Äç

New Jersey Super Regional

Virginia Tech won their first Super Regional, and only dropped 1 game the entire tournament! Between Cornell winning a bid, and Princeton winning the challenger bracket, it was a good tournament for Ivy League schools. There was an exciting dreambreaker in the semifinals between Delaware and UNCC to determine who plays Virginia Tech, with Delaware prevailing.

Champion: Virginia Tech
Bid Winners: Delaware, Pitt, UNCC, Cornell
Results Link
Recording Link

‚Äç

Arizona Super Regional

USC dominates, only dropping one game during the tournament, which was in their 3-1 victory over SDSU in the finals. GCU had two teams that lost in the semifinals, spoiling the possibility of an all-GCU finals. USC, GCU, and Arizona State all brought 3 teams to the event, raising the energy level in all of their matches.

Champion: USC
Bid Winners: SDSU, Arizona, Arizona State, Loyola Marymount University
Results Link
Recording Link

‚Äç

2025 Collegiate National Championship

‚Äç

Format

There will be 1st Team, 2nd Team, and Challenger brackets, with the 1st Team Bracket crowing the champion of the 2025 season. It‚Äôll be group play on Friday, with playoffs on Saturday and Sunday.¬†

‚Äç

Schedule

‚Äç

History and Prize Money

This is the 4th annual Collegiate National Championship! Here are the past winners and results:

2022

Champion: UNC
Results Link
Recording Link
2023¬†

Champion: UVA
Results Link
Recording Link
2024

Champion: Utah Tech
Results Link
Recording Link

‚Äç

Over $40,000 will be given out at this event, with $15,000 for the winning team!

‚Äç

You can follow along the action at home with games being livestreamed to the DUPR YouTube channel this weekend. We will also have a prediction bracket contest, stay tuned to the DUPR Instagram account for when that is live on Friday night.¬†

title: Drill with Purpose: Take Your Consistency to the Next Level
summary: Boost your shot consistency with this purposeful 2-on-1 pickleball drill at the non-volley zone. Learn how to simulate real match play, improve communication, and master dinks and speed-ups.
content:
The energy in St. George is different this week‚Äîand for good reason. Utah Tech's pickleball team, the reigning Collegiate National Champions, is gearing up for another shot at glory. As the Trailblazers prepare to defend their title, there‚Äôs one thing that‚Äôs clear: this squad isn‚Äôt just resting on last year‚Äôs success‚Äîthey‚Äôre building on it.

‚Äç

Business as Usual‚ÄîBut With a Championship Mindset

Ask any of the players, and they'll tell you the same thing: the foundation of their success hasn‚Äôt changed much. "We‚Äôre all competitive and goal-driven when it comes to our personal development," one team member shared. "We‚Äôre also really close off the court, and that chemistry shows when we‚Äôre playing and training together."

‚Äç

That tight-knit bond, paired with relentless work ethic, continues to define Utah Tech‚Äôs approach. The team spends countless hours training together, pushing each other, and keeping the standard high‚Äîbecause they know that staying at the top is even harder than getting there.

‚Äç

Fine-Tuning the Formula: Consistency & Composure

Heading into this year‚Äôs tournament, the Trailblazers are sharpening their edge. ‚ÄúConsistency is everything,‚Äù says the team. One key area of focus has been high-percentage shots‚Äîminimizing errors and maximizing scoring opportunities. But it‚Äôs not just physical preparation that matters.

‚Äç

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve also been working on the mental side of things. DUPR Nationals get crazy‚Äîevery school is watching, cheering, sometimes heckling. We‚Äôre training ourselves to stay locked in, stay composed, and block out the noise.‚Äù

‚Äç

Confidence Meets Pressure

Being the defending champs brings a mix of swagger and scrutiny. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre definitely confident‚Äîwe know what we‚Äôre capable of,‚Äù a player admitted. ‚ÄúBut there‚Äôs pressure, too. Everyone wants to see the champs fall. We‚Äôre using that as fuel. We want to go back-to-back.‚Äù

‚Äç

This mix of high confidence and grounded awareness could be exactly what gives the Trailblazers their edge. They know what it takes to win‚Äîand they‚Äôre ready to rise to the occasion once again.

‚Äç

Lessons From the Top

Looking back at last year‚Äôs championship run, the players credit their victory to a few essential ingredients: rock-solid consistency, excellent coaching, team-first mentality, and focused practice sessions that mimic the intensity and unpredictability of tournament play.

‚Äç

That experience gave them more than just a trophy‚Äîit reshaped their mindset. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre determined. We know how to win. And we love to have fun doing it. That balance of competitiveness and joy is what makes us great, both as a team and as individual players.‚Äù

‚Äç

Eyes on the Prize

As the Trailblazers head into this year‚Äôs Collegiate National Championship, one thing is certain: they‚Äôre not just defending a title‚Äîthey‚Äôre chasing another one. So whether you're cheering from the stands or watching from afar, get ready. Utah Tech is coming in hot, and they‚Äôve got every intention of blazing the trail all the way to another championship win.

‚Äç

Make sure to follow all the action from Collegiate Nationals on Instagram at @duprpb and @collegiateickleball for the latest scores, highlights, and behind-the-scenes coverage.

title: Mastering the Lift Dink: Wrist Control and Technique
summary: Learn how to master the link dink shot in pickleball and avoid the common mistake of overusing your wrist. Discover proper technique, hand positioning, and tips for consistent resets.
content:
Looking to build more consistency in your shots? Drilling is key‚Äîbut not just any drilling. Drilling with intention and using realistic setups can elevate your game in ways casual hitting never will. One of the most effective and engaging ways to do this? Three-player drills. Listen to these tips from Pro player Bobbi Oshiro.

‚Äç

Whether you're a seasoned competitor or just getting serious about improving, incorporating multi-player drills will challenge your decision-making, timing, and court awareness.

‚Äç

2-on-1 at the Kitchen Line: A Realistic Challenge

This is one of my favorite drills for developing consistency under pressure. It replicates real-game scenarios and keeps all three players actively working on key skills.

Drill Setup:
Player A is alone on one side of the net at the non-volley zone (NVZ)

Players B and C are on the opposite side, also at the NVZ.


How It Works:
Player A is on offense, looking for moments to speed up the ball‚Äîideally down the line to a specific target.

Players B and C are working together on soft dinks, keeping Player A on the move.

B and C must communicate effectively to determine who takes each ball and adjust positioning as the rally evolves.

Player B focuses on anticipating the speed-up and countering quickly.

Player C is responsible for covering the middle, a crucial zone during fast-paced exchanges.


Why This Drill Works

This isn‚Äôt just about hitting balls back and forth‚Äîit‚Äôs about game-like repetition.

For Player A: It‚Äôs an opportunity to practice patience, pick smart speed-up moments, and work on precision targeting under pressure.

For Players B and C: It builds chemistry, footwork, and communication, all while refining dink control and defensive positioning.



By drilling with three players, you introduce more movement, more strategy, and more realism. And that‚Äôs what translates to better performance in real matches.

‚Äç

Final Tip:

‚ÄçDon‚Äôt just drill to get reps‚Äîdrill with purpose. Pick a focus for each session and push yourself (and your drilling partners) to replicate match situations as closely as possible.

‚Äç

Ready to level up your consistency? Grab two friends, hit the courts, and try this 2-on-1 drill next time you train.

‚Äç

title: Pickleball Rules 90% of Players Get Wrong
summary: Breaking pickleball rules without knowing it? Learn the most misunderstood pickleball rules and how fixing them can improve your DUPR pickleball ratings.
content:

Why We‚Äôre Partnering with The Pickleball Clinic
