title: Pickleball Tournaments & Leagues Explained: Your Guide to Competitive Play
summary: Want to play in pickleball tournaments but don‚Äôt know where to start? Learn about DUPR pickleball ratings, leagues, and tournament formats. Find tournaments near you and get rated today!
content:
You know how 90% of pickleball players think they know the rules? Here‚Äôs the truth: fewer than 5% of recreational players can accurately list and explain all the core rules of pickleball. That means the other 95% are probably breaking a rule every time they play‚Äîand they don‚Äôt even realize it.

‚Äç

But not you. Not after this.

‚Äç

In this guide, we‚Äôll cover every essential pickleball rule‚Äîclear and simple. Plus, we‚Äôll reveal the one rule even advanced players often get wrong (spoiler: it‚Äôs about momentum in the kitchen).

‚Äç

Whether you‚Äôre new to the sport or already climbing the DUPR ratings ladder, understanding the rules is key to playing smarter, avoiding unnecessary faults, and maybe even winning a few extra points each match.

‚Äç

The 7 Most Important Pickleball Rules You Must Know

‚Äç

Let‚Äôs break it down, DUPR-style:

‚Äç

1. The Two-Bounce Rule

‚Äç

Before either team can start volleying (hitting the ball out of the air), the ball must bounce once on each side after the serve. This is one of the most misunderstood but critical rules‚Äîespecially among new players.

‚Äç

2. The Non-Volley Zone (aka The Kitchen)

‚Äç

No volleys allowed while standing in the non-volley zone. But here‚Äôs the part players miss: if your momentum carries you into the kitchen‚Äîeven after a clean volley‚Äîit‚Äôs a fault. We'll break that down later.

‚Äç

3. Serving Rules¬†

‚Äç

Serve underhand with contact equal or below the waist.


One foot must be on the ground behind the baseline at the time of contact - the other foot doesn't have to be on the ground but if it is, it has to be behind the baseline.


Serve diagonally across the court.
Your serve must land BEHIND the kitchen line.


You get only one serve attempt (no let serves ‚Äî this isn‚Äôt tennis).


4. Pickleball Scoring System

‚Äç

Let‚Äôs clear this up once and for all: in pickleball, only the serving team can score. Most games are played to 11 points, and yes‚Äîyou‚Äôve got to win by 2. That‚Äôs the standard across recreational play and official events like DUPR Rating Sessions and RTM (Road to Minors) Tournaments.

‚Äç

But if you‚Äôre stepping into a team-based format like Minor League Pickleball or the DUPR Collegiate Pickleball Tour, buckle up‚Äîthose games are usually rally scoring, go to 21 points, win by 2. The pace is different, strategy shifts, and staying focused for longer rallies becomes even more important.

‚Äç

What Does 4-2-2 Even Mean? The Doubles Scoring System Explained

‚Äç

Doubles pickleball has a scoring system that confuses a lot of players at first‚Äîbut once it clicks, it‚Äôs easy.

The score is always called out in three numbers. Like this:¬†

4-2-2



Here‚Äôs the breakdown:

First number = the serving team‚Äôs score


Second number = the receiver team‚Äôs score


Third number (only for doubles)= the server number (1 or 2)



So if your team is serving 4-2-2, it means:

‚Äç
Your team has 4 points, your opponents have 2, and it‚Äôs the second server‚Äôs turn.

‚Äç

üß† Be aware: At the very start of the game, the first server only gets one chance (so the third number is called out as ‚Äú2‚Äù). After that, both players on each team get a turn to serve at least twice before it‚Äôs a side-out.

‚Äç

5. Line Calls

‚Äç

A ball is in if it touches the line. If there‚Äôs doubt? The benefit goes to your opponent. That‚Äôs not just sportsmanship‚Äîit‚Äôs in the rulebook. When in doubt, don‚Äôt call it out ‚Ä¶

‚Äç

‚Äç

Unless it's a serve landing on the kitchen line. In that case, you can call it out.

‚Äç

6. Double Hits

‚Äç

Legal only if they happen during one continuous motion. If you swing once and the ball hits your paddle twice, no problem. But two distinct hits? Fault.

‚Äç

7. Faults

‚Äç

These include:

Hitting the ball out of bounds
Your serve landing on the kitchen line


Volleys from inside the kitchen


Not adhering to the two-bounce rule


Touching the net or crossing the plane before the ball does. Yep, touching the net is a big no-no. If you, your partner, or your paddle hit the net‚Äîeven by accident‚Äîyou lose the point, no matter where the ball landed.

‚Äç

The Rule Most People Get Wrong: The ‚ÄúMomentum Rule‚Äù in the Kitchen

‚Äç

You hit a volley just outside the kitchen. It lands. You step forward into the kitchen. Legal?

‚Äç

Nope. If your momentum carries you into the kitchen after a volley, even if the ball is long gone, it‚Äôs still a fault. This is one of the most commonly missed (and misunderstood) rules‚Äîeven by experienced players.

‚Äç

FAQs about Pickleball Rules

‚Äç

‚ùì What is the two-bounce rule in pickleball?

Each side must let the ball bounce once before hitting a volley. It applies to the serve and the return only.

‚Äç

‚ùì Can I ever step in the kitchen?

Yes‚Äîbut only if you‚Äôre not volleying. You can hit a dink inside the kitchen, but the ball must bounce first.

‚Äç

‚ùì Do I get a second serve if I fault the first one?

Nope. In pickleball, you only get one serve attempt.

‚Äç

‚ùì Is the line in or out?

If the ball touches the line, it‚Äôs in.

‚Äç

‚ùì Can I hit the ball with both hands?

Yes. Two-handed backhands (or forehands) are 100% legal.

‚Äç

Why Knowing the Rules Can Improve Your Pickleball Rating

‚Äç

Every DUPR match you play is logged and analyzed by our Elo algorithm. That means every point‚Äîevery rule followed or broken‚Äîimpacts your pickleball rating. If you're losing points to faults that could've been avoided, you're literally giving away your rating.

‚Äç

Clean play = cleaner wins = a more accurate DUPR score.

‚Äç

Think of it this way: knowing the rules gives you a competitive edge. It‚Äôs like upgrading your paddle without spending a cent.

‚Äç

Ready to Level Up?

‚Äç

The more you know the rules, the more confident‚Äîand competitive‚Äîyou‚Äôll be. And if you want to keep improving, your next step is signing up for tournaments, outsmarting every other player with your knowledge on the Pickleball Rulebook.¬†

‚Äç

Create your free DUPR account, log your matches, and start climbing. Whether you're a 3.0 player or aiming to be the next Ben Johns (7.41), your journey starts with knowing the game inside and out.

‚Äç

title: University of Pittsburgh Pickleball Club: CNC Sweepstakes Winner
summary: Discover how the University of Pittsburgh Pickleball Club rose to prominence, boosted their pickleball ratings, and earned an all-expenses-paid trip to the DUPR Collegiate National Championship. See why they‚Äôre a team to watch in the world of collegiate pickleball.
content:
Want to start playing pickleball tournaments but don‚Äôt know how?

‚Äç

Here‚Äôs a guide on everything you need to know about the different pickleball tournaments you could be playing based on your skills. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or an advanced player, tournaments and leagues provide the perfect opportunity to test your skills, meet new players, and boost your pickleball rating.

‚Äç

But how do pickleball tournaments and leagues work? How do you find the right event for your skill level? And, what role does DUPR play in it all? The DUPR Events Dashboard is your go-to place for every pickleball tournament and event. With just a few taps, you can browse upcoming competitions, from rating sessions to team-based leagues, and find the perfect match for your skill level. Your pickleball rating automatically updates as you play, ensuring you‚Äôre always placed in the right division for fair and competitive matchups.

‚Äç

Let‚Äôs dive into the world of pickleball tournaments, leagues, and ratings.

‚Äç

Pickleball Tournaments From Beginners to Pros: DUPR Sessions, RTMs & Minor Leagues

‚Äç

DUPR offers a structured competitive environment that allows players of all levels to participate fairly in pickleball tournaments and leagues. What are the different types of pickleball tournaments? The three key components of the featured DUPR amateur tournament series called RTM are:

‚Äç

‚Äç

‚Äç

‚Äç‚Äç

1. DUPR Sessions (Rating Sessions)

‚Äç

Before entering into competitive tournaments, players need an accurate DUPR rating, supported by an up-to-date Reliability Score. DUPR Sessions are two-hour round-robin sessions featuring games to 11 points, with randomly assigned partners or are partnered events where you and your partner sign up together. This allows players to compete in a fair and competitive environment.

‚Äç

The more matches you play, the more precise your rating becomes. Even players who already have a DUPR rating should join these sessions to refine their rating, update their reliability score, and improve their game. Every match boosts your reliability score, feeding the DUPR algorithm the data points it needs to be confident about your skill level. So if you're looking to play more matches, track your progress, and level up your game, DUPR Sessions are the perfect place to start!

‚Äç

These sessions are generally divided into the following DUPR skill levels:

Beginner to 3.000
3.000 - 3.499¬†
3.500 - 3.999¬†
4.000 - 4.499¬†
4.500+¬†

‚Äç

With the flexibility of offering either partnered or no fixed partner options, these rating sessions make for an easy entry point for players looking to participate in match play and establish or improve their DUPR rating and Reliability Score before joining other competitive events. The more matches you play, the more accurate your rating becomes.

‚Äç

Where can I find DUPR rating sessions and How to Register?

Download the DUPR App from the App Store or Google Play.
Create a DUPR Account for FREE and complete your player profile.
Search for DUPR Sessions near you to establish a rating. Each DUPR Rating Level is posted as a separate tournament.
Play Matches‚ÄîYour results will update your DUPR rating automatically.
Check Your Rating anytime through the app and find tournaments that match your skill level.

‚Äç

2. DUPR Road To Minors (RTM) Tournaments

‚Äç

What are RTM tournaments in pickleball? Once you have a DUPR rating, you can enter DUPR Road to Minors (RTM) Tournaments, which are regional team-based competitions.¬†

‚Äç

These events are structured as doubles competitions, featuring men‚Äôs, women‚Äôs, and mixed divisions. Players must have a partner to participate, but partners can change from tournament to tournament, allowing for flexibility in team selection. Unlike traditional team-based rankings, points are accrued individually, meaning your performance in each event directly impacts your standing. There is no minimum or maximum number of RTM tournaments you can enter, making it an excellent opportunity to compete as often as you like. The more tournaments you play‚Äîand win‚Äîthe more points you earn, helping you boost your DUPR ratings and qualify for higher-level competitions.

‚Äç

RTM Tournaments are also divided by level:¬†‚Äç

‚Äç

Beginner to 3.000
3.000 - 3.499¬†
3.500 - 3.999¬†
4.000 - 4.499¬†
4.500+¬†

‚Äç

Winning in RTM tournaments helps players qualify for the RTM Cup, where top players compete for coveted Minor League Pickleball team spots.

‚Äç

‚Äç

‚Äç

3. Minor League Pickleball DUPR Divisions: How DUPR Ratings Determine Your Placement

‚Äç

For players looking to compete in structured team-based leagues, Minor League Pickleball provides the next level of play. The Minor League Pickleball League is structured using DUPR divisions, ensuring competitive and fair matchups based on player ratings. Each division has a maximum aggregate rating, which is the combined DUPR rating of all players on a team. Additionally, to prevent sandbagging, each division has a maximum individual player rating cap, meaning highly skilled players cannot drop down into lower divisions.

‚Äç

Here‚Äôs how the divisions are structured:

‚Äç

DUPR 12 ‚Äì Team‚Äôs total DUPR must be 12.300 or lower

No individual player can have a DUPR higher than 3.600 to play in DUPR 12.
DUPR 14 ‚Äì Team‚Äôs total DUPR must be 14.300 or lower

No individual player can have a DUPR higher than 4.100 to play in DUPR 14.
DUPR 16 ‚Äì Team‚Äôs total DUPR must be 16.300 or lower

No individual player can have a DUPR higher than 4.600 to play in DUPR 16.
DUPR 18 ‚Äì Team‚Äôs total DUPR must be 18.300 or lower

No individual player can have a DUPR higher than 5.100 to play in DUPR 18.¬†
DUPR 20 ‚Äì Team‚Äôs total DUPR must be 20.999 or lower (or 20.300 if DUPR 22 is available in that region)

‚ÄçDUPR 22 ‚Äì Available only in select markets and special events, with a max team aggregate of 22.999.



Teams can be made up of various player combinations as long as their total does not exceed the division limit. For example, a ¬†DUPR 20 team could consist of four players rated 5.00 (5+5+5+5=20) or a mix like 5.50, 4.50, 4.75, and 5.25 (=20).

‚Äç

These division limits ensure that players compete against opponents with similar skill levels, keeping matches fair and exciting. If you're looking to join a Minor League Pickleball team, your DUPR rating will determine which division you can play in.

‚Äç

Players who perform well in Minor League Pickleball Tournaments may qualify for the Minor League Pickleball National Championship.

‚Äç

How to Find Pickleball Tournaments Near You

‚Äç

If you‚Äôre eager to start competing, here‚Äôs how to find the right tournament:

Use the DUPR App for Android or Apple phones‚Äì Search for upcoming tournaments, leagues, and DUPR sessions.
Check Local Clubs ‚Äì Many clubs host sanctioned DUPR tournaments.
Follow DUPR Social Media ‚Äì Stay updated on new events at @duprpb on Instagram.
Ask Other Players ‚Äì Find a Pickleball Facebook group near you. Join a pickleball community and connect with other players.

‚Äç

How to Get Rated Before a Tournament

‚Äç

Before entering a tournament, you need an accurate DUPR rating. You can either sign up for a DUPR Session or manually log your recreational match results. Unlike other rating systems, DUPR offers free accessibility, allowing you to improve your rating from your home club. Ratings update with new match results in real time, thanks to DUPR‚Äôs highly accurate rating algorithm. To track your progress, simply log into the DUPR app and check your rating.

‚Äç

Whether you‚Äôre just starting or looking to climb the ranks, DUPR provides the best structure for fair, competitive pickleball tournaments and leagues. From rating sessions to regional matches and Minor League Pickleball, there‚Äôs an opportunity for everyone to compete at their skill level. Start by getting your DUPR rating, find a tournament near you, and take your game to the next level!

‚Äç

Looking to join your first tournament? Sign up for a DUPR session today!

‚Äç

title: High School Pickleball: How to Talk to Adolescent Players After a Tough Loss
summary: Help your teen bounce back after a tough match in the High School Pickleball Tour. Understand how DUPR pickleball ratings are impacted and help your kid move on.
content:
In Meridian, Idaho, The Flying Pickle has built more than a pickleball club; it‚Äôs created a full ecosystem for players of every level. Between the quality of its facilities, the variety of its programs, and its focus on member experience, it has become a model DUPR Club other facilities are taking note of.¬†

‚Äç

And now, with their franchise model, they are ready to expand nationwide

‚Äç

Adding Value With DUPR+

‚Äç

When The Flying Pickle¬† decided to integrate DUPR+ into its Pro Membership package, it wasn‚Äôt about raising prices or chasing revenue. As Club Director Tristan Belue explains, it was about one thing: adding value for their most dedicated players.

‚Äç

‚ÄúOur goal is to be a one-stop shop for everything pickleball. DUPR+ is just another way we can give more to our members,‚Äù said Tristan Belue, Club Director at The Flying Pickle.¬†

‚Äç

The Flying Pickle‚Äôs Pro Members already enjoy perks like earlier schedule visibility, more concurrent reservations, and access to premium programs. Adding DUPR+ simply made the membership ‚Äúthat much more valuable‚Äù and set the club apart from local competitors.

‚Äç

‚Äç

Every detail is designed to make the club a place people want to spend time, not just a place to play a match.

‚Äç

Programming That Keeps Courts Full

‚Äç

The Flying Pickle‚Äôs success is built on variety and consistency:

‚Äç

Clinics & Drills: From ‚ÄúLearn to Play‚Äù for newcomers to skill-specific drills for advanced players.


Open Plays & King of the Courts: Popular across multiple levels, with 3.5 Open Plays being the most in-demand.


Leagues: Always packed, always logged to DUPR.


Major Events: Including the Flying Pickle Open, which draws over 350 participants from across the country.


Belue‚Äôs approach for other directors: ‚ÄúTest and fail until you find what your members love and then keep doing it.‚Äù

‚Äç

‚Äç

Why Other Clubs Are Watching

‚Äç

The success of The Flying Pickle‚Äôs Meridian location has sparked plans for franchising the model. While expansion details are still being finalized, the approach of combining high-quality facilities, strong community programming, and integrated player tools like DUPR has proven effective in attracting and retaining members.

‚Äç

Interested in franchising with them? Learn more here.

‚Äç

For players, it‚Äôs a one-stop shop for everything pickleball. For club directors, it‚Äôs a case study in how thoughtful facility design and programming can build lasting engagement.

‚Äç

Interested in bringing the same value to your members? To learn how to become a DUPR+ Club, email clubs@mydupr.com.

title: UVA Pickleball and HEAD USA Sign Landmark Multi-Year Partnership
summary: UVA Pickleball has secured a landmark multi-year sponsorship with HEAD USA, marking the largest deal in collegiate pickleball. Learn more about this exciting partnership and its impact on the sport!
content:
A Parent‚Äôs Guide to Building Confidence, Not Pressure

High school pickleball is becoming more competitive every season. With new opportunities to track official pickleball ratings and compete in the High School Pickleball National Pathway, today‚Äôs teen athletes are more motivated‚Äîand more pressured‚Äîthan ever before.

‚Äç

But here‚Äôs the thing: they‚Äôre still kids. They‚Äôre still figuring out how to manage nerves, disappointment, and the very real emotional rollercoaster of competitive sports ‚Äî all while making sure their grades don‚Äôt suffer.

‚Äç

As a parent, coach, or sibling, your words matter more than you might think. One comment can either lift your teen up‚Ä¶ or stick with them in the worst way.

‚Äç

You‚Äôre Not the One Playing‚ÄîAnd That‚Äôs Okay

It‚Äôs easy to have strong opinions when you‚Äôre watching from the sidelines. Maybe they missed a shot they normally make. Maybe they didn‚Äôt seem aggressive enough. Maybe their partner didn‚Äôt play well and it threw them off. We get it‚Äîit‚Äôs frustrating to watch, especially when you care.

‚Äç

But here‚Äôs the truth: there are so many factors in a pickleball match that are invisible‚Äîmental pressure, teammate chemistry, even just a bad day. Reacting as if you were the one competing only adds more stress.

‚Äç

Be mindful of your body language before, during, and after your child‚Äôs pickleball match. Try to stay present‚Äîavoid distractions like checking your phone, shouting from the sidelines, or showing visible frustration or discomfort, like covering your face or turning away.¬†

‚Äç

Your job isn‚Äôt to be a coach (unless you actually are one). Your job is to support, guide, and help your teen learn how to manage both victory and defeat.¬†

‚Äç

‚Äç

Why Tough Losses Matter More Than Wins

Tough losses tend to stick with us longer than big wins‚Äîand there‚Äôs actually a psychological reason for that. Our brains are wired to hold onto negative experiences more than positive ones. It‚Äôs called negativity bias, and it‚Äôs a natural part of how we process emotions. We‚Äôre more likely to replay a loss in our minds than to relive the high of a win.

‚Äç

For high school athletes, this can be especially true. A match that didn‚Äôt go well might feel like it defines their whole season‚Äîor affects how they view themselves as a player.

‚Äç

But here‚Äôs the flip side: because losses tend to stick with us longer, they often become the most valuable learning experiences. What makes the difference is how we respond to them.

‚Äç

Help your teen understand that one tough match doesn‚Äôt erase all their progress‚Äîor their potential. Even the best players have off days, and no single result will define their pickleball rating or future in the sport. Plus, if your child plays in tournaments regularly, their reliability score improves‚Äîmeaning their rating is less likely to swing drastically after one loss.

‚Äç

What matters most isn‚Äôt the outcome‚Äîit‚Äôs how they respond the next time they step on the court.

‚Äç

Should You Say Something‚Ä¶ or Not?

You might be asking:

‚ÄúShould I talk to my kid after the match?‚Äù
‚ÄúWhat if my kid doesn‚Äôt want me to watch him play?‚Äù
‚ÄúWhat if my kid always blames his doubles partner after a loss?‚Äù
‚ÄúHow should I handle it when my kid starts throwing or breaking their pickleball paddle after a tough match?"

‚Äç

There‚Äôs no perfect script, but there are better ways to approach these situations. Start by recognizing that your teen is trying to figure it out just like you are. Be the steady presence they can rely on.

‚Äç

What to Say and What Not to Say

Let‚Äôs walk through a few scenarios and how to respond:

‚Äç

‚Äç

The High School Pickleball National Pathway: Big Dreams Start Here

The High School Pickleball National Championship was designed to give student-athletes across the country a chance to compete at the national level. As they play more sanctioned matches and build their DUPR pickleball ratings, teens are developing real goals, accountability, and a deeper love for the game.

‚Äç

But it‚Äôs not just about the rating. It‚Äôs about helping young players grow into confident, emotionally mature individuals‚Äîwho can win with humility and lose with perspective.

‚Äç

Final Thoughts for Parents

Every high school athlete will experience a tough loss at some point. What matters most is how we, as the adults in their corner, respond.

‚Äç

Be their safe space. Let them feel what they‚Äôre feeling. And remind them that no single match defines who they are‚Äîor where they‚Äôre headed.

‚Äç

Support them, believe in them, and help them see the big picture. Because in the end, it‚Äôs not just about improving pickleball ratings‚Äîit‚Äôs about raising strong, resilient young people.

‚Äç

The most confident athletes aren‚Äôt the ones who‚Äôve never lost‚Äîthey‚Äôre the ones who keep showing up, learning from every mistake, and trusting themselves through every setback.

‚Äç

Every tournament is a chance to grow. Encourage your teen to stay in the game, even when it‚Äôs hard. That‚Äôs how champions‚Äîon and off the court‚Äîare made.

‚Äç

title: DUPR Named Official Rating System of Pickleball Australia
summary: DUPR is now the official rating system of Pickleball Australia, bringing a consistent, data-driven way for players to track progress. This partnership enhances competition in Australian pickleball with globally recognized ratings for all levels.
content:
UVA Pickleball has signed a historic multi-year sponsorship deal with HEAD USA, marking the largest partnership in collegiate pickleball to date.¬†

‚Äç

This agreement‚Äîcovering paddles, shoes, bags, accessories, and key program support‚Äîunderscores both UVA‚Äôs leadership in the sport and HEAD‚Äôs commitment to the growing collegiate scene.

‚Äç

A Partnership Sparked at DUPR Nationals

‚ÄçThis collaboration took shape at the 2023 DUPR Collegiate Nationals, where UVA first connected with HEAD‚Äôs sponsorship team. From an initial shoe sponsorship and tournament support, the relationship has now expanded into a long-term commitment that will provide UVA‚Äôs 24-person tournament team with equipment for all competitions, including the 2025 Nationals in Atlanta.

‚Äç

Elevating Collegiate Pickleball Through DUPR‚Äôs Platform

‚ÄçUVA Pickleball‚Äôs rapid growth is part of a broader movement powered by DUPR‚Äôs national exposure. The team‚Äôs success on and off the court continues to attract major brands to the space. HEAD‚Äôs investment reflects the increasing significance of collegiate pickleball, with UVA leading the charge.

‚Äç

‚ÄúUVA Pickleball is proud to partner with HEAD USA as it continues to push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible for collegiate programs,‚Äù said Conor Burns, Head of Sponsorships. ‚ÄúWith DUPR as the driving force behind the sport‚Äôs growth, this partnership is another step toward a bigger and brighter future for college pickleball.‚Äù¬†¬†
‚ÄúWe are so excited to expand our relationship with UVA Pickleball,‚Äù said Katie Benson, Pickleball Promotions & Partnerships Manager for HEAD USA. ‚ÄúOver the past 2 years we‚Äôve watched this team perform at the highest level of collegiate pickleball while also building an organization that pays just as much attention to building the sport recreationally on campus for the entire student body. The team‚Äôs energy is unmatched and we look forward to chasing this new horizon with them.‚Äù¬†

‚Äç

‚Äç

About UVA Pickleball¬†

The University of Virginia (UVA) Pickleball Team is one of the most competitive and fastest-growing collegiate pickleball programs in the country. With a strong tournament presence and a thriving campus community, UVA Pickleball continues to push the sport forward, setting new standards for collegiate play.

‚Äç

About HEAD

HEAD is a leading global provider of premium, high-performance equipment and apparel for athletes and players, at all levels. HEAD has five divisions: Winter Sports, Racquet Sports, Water Sports, Sportswear and Licensing. Since our launch in 1950, we‚Äôve achieved a reputation for cutting-edge design, engineering excellence and a passion for championing all sport, everywhere. World-class performance demands the very best equipment and that‚Äôs why, at HEAD, our purpose is to give athletes and players at every level, exactly what they need to win. To learn more, visit head.com.

‚Äç

About DUPR

DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) is the premier global pickleball rating system and technology platform, trusted by the world's leading clubs, tournaments, leagues, and players. DUPR's dynamic rating system unifies pickleball across age, gender, and location by analyzing match results to accurately evaluate all players across a 2.000 - 8.000 scale. DUPR is the official pickleball rating of leagues, tournaments and clubs around the world, including United Pickleball Association (UPA), PPA, Major League Pickleball (MLP), Pickleball.com, Life Time, The Picklr, National Team Pickleball League, National Pickleball League. It also owns and operates Minor League Pickleball and Collegiate Pickleball, two of the biggest amateur leagues in the sport. Players and operators can visit www.dupr.com or follow DUPR on Instagram to learn more.

‚Äç

About DUPR Collegiate Pickleball

DUPR Collegiate Pickleball is the leading platform for college programs nationwide, providing structure, rankings, and tournament opportunities for student-athletes. Through high-profile events like DUPR Nationals and conference championships, DUPR is driving the growth of collegiate pickleball and helping teams secure major sponsorships.

title: Pickleball Ratings Explained: How Skill Levels Are Calculated
summary: Discover how DUPR pickleball ratings work and accurately track your skill level. Learn how to get rated, improve your game, and compete at the right level.
content:
Delray Beach, Fl. Mar. 20, 2025 - Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating (DUPR) is now the official rating system of Pickleball Australia (PA), ensuring that all PA sanctioned tournaments, leagues, and events use the most accurate and globally recognized player rating system.

‚Äç

This partnership will bring a new level of consistency and fairness to Australian pickleball, giving players a data-driven, real-time way to track their progress. DUPR‚Äôs advanced algorithm evaluates players based on match results‚Äîregardless of age, gender, or location‚Äîproviding a rating on a universal scale from 2.000 to 8.000.

‚Äç

"Pickleball Australia has been liaising with Tito, Ryan and the DUPR team for some years and we‚Äôre delighted to now formally enter into a monumental partnership with DUPR which will have such a significant, positive impact on pickleball in Australia," said Brendan Lee, Executive Officer of Pickleball Australia. "DUPR has shown that they are the gold standard when it comes to player ratings and this partnership ensures Australian players have access to the most accurate rating system, which will enhance competition and level the playing field."

‚Äç

Through this collaboration, DUPR will be integrated into Australia‚Äôs premier tournaments and leagues, including:
‚úÖ The Australian Pickleball Championships, which drew over 1,200 competitors in 2024; making the APC the second largest pickleball tournament outside of the US.
‚úÖ The Australian Masters Cup, which recently launched with over 1200 participants nationwide aged 50+.
‚úÖA further 100 sanctioned tournaments across Australia under the Pickleball Australia umbrella in 2025.

‚Äç

By equipping tournament directors, clubs, and leagues with the best rating system, DUPR ensures that Australian pickleball continues to grow with a structured, level-based approach to competition.

‚Äç

"DUPR is beyond excited to be the official rating system of Pickleball Australia,‚Äù said Tito Machado, CEO of DUPR. ‚ÄúPickleball Australia has done an incredible job growing the sport, building a thriving competitive scene, and creating opportunities for players at every level. Their commitment to structured, high-quality competition is unmatched, and we‚Äôre honored to support their vision. With DUPR, every Australian player will have access to the most advanced, data-driven rating system in the world‚Äîensuring fair, competitive, and exciting pickleball from local clubs to national championships. We can‚Äôt wait to continue working alongside Pickleball Australia to take the game to even greater heights!"

‚Äç

Get Your DUPR Rating

Players can create a free DUPR profile at www.dupr.com or download the DUPR app to start logging match results. Ensure your profile is linked to Pickleball Australia: click here.

‚Äç

About DUPR

title: DUPR Partners with Cross Club Pickleball League to Elevate Club vs. Club Competition
summary: DUPR teams up with Cross Club Pickleball League (CPL) to bring a dynamic, data-driven rating system to club-based pickleball competitions. This partnership enhances competition, ensures fair matchups, and supports player progression across regions.
content:
Major League Pickleball‚Äôs 2024 Champions, the Dallas Flash, partner with DUPR to Launch ‚ÄúRoad to Minors‚Äù - A Team-Based Opportunity for Amateur Players to Compete and Represent the Flash.

‚Äç

The Road To Minors Tournament Series is the first-ever year-round program dedicated to identifying and developing local talent, creating a pathway for amateurs to play for the Dallas Flash in Minor League Pickleball DUPR-rated Teams, and compete in Road to Minors sponsored tournaments, along with MLP Dallas Event special perks in July 2025.

‚Äç

Dallas, TX ‚Äî March 22, 2025 ‚Äî Major League Pickleball (MLP), the Dallas Flash Pickleball team, and Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating (DUPR) are excited to announce the launch of their highly anticipated Road to Minors (RTM) series for North Texas, kicking off next week on March 22nd through March 23rd, 2025. This series will offer players the opportunity to try-out for a coveted spot on the Dallas Flash team to compete at the Minor League Pickleball Midsouth Regional Showdown June 28th & 29th.

‚Äç

The Road to Minors series will continue in 2025 with an RTM Cup tournament, providing further opportunities for players to qualify and represent their region at The Dink Minor League Pickleball National Championship in December 2025. This multi-stage series promises to be a thrilling journey for aspiring pickleball players, culminating in the chance to compete on the national stage.

‚Äç

In addition to the RTM series, the Dallas Flash will host the highly anticipated MLP Dallas Event from July 23rd to 27th, 2025. This exciting event will feature top pickleball talent from around the world, showcasing the best of Major League Pickleball in the heart of Dallas. All RTM players, as well as competitors at the Minor League Pickleball Midsouth Regional Showdown, will receive special perks to attend the MLP Dallas Event.

‚Äç

‚ÄúWe are excited to continue developing our community engagement and creating pathways for players to develop their pickleball game,‚Äù said Mark Molthan, owner of the Dallas Flash. ‚ÄúThe Road to Minors series is an incredible opportunity for players in Texas and surrounding states to elevate their game and be part of the growing pickleball movement.‚Äù

‚Äç

As the official pickleball rating system of Major League Pickleball and Minor League Pickleball, DUPR plays a pivotal role in identifying and ranking the top emerging talent in the sport. Through the Road to Minors series, DUPR continues its mission to create a seamless competitive pathway for amateurs and aspiring professional players of all ages and at every skill level.

‚Äç

‚ÄúDUPR is committed to expanding the accessibility of competitive pickleball at every level,‚Äù said Caroline Luelf, Director of Minor League Pickleball at DUPR. ‚ÄúBy partnering with Major League Pickleball and the Dallas Flash, we are ensuring that players have the best opportunities to develop their game, compete at a higher level, and ultimately progress through the ranks in a fair and structured way.‚Äù

‚Äç

Registration for the Road to Minors events is now open! Players eager to be part of the action can sign up directly through Pickleball.com. Don‚Äôt miss your chance to compete in this exciting series and take your game to the next level.

‚Äç

For more information on the Road to Minors series, the Minor League Pickleball Midsouth Regional Showdown, and the MLP Dallas Event, please visit Pickleball.com or follow us on social media @roadtominors @officialminorleaguepb @dallasflashpb @duprpb @majorleaguepb for the latest updates.

‚Äç

About Dallas Flash‚Äç

Dallas Flash Pickleball was formed in 2023 by Mark Molthan, Todd Wagner, and Mark Cuban. Mark Molthan is a successful business leader and entrepreneur based in Dallas, known for his expertise in luxury home building and interior design. As the owner and managing director of Dallas Flash Pickleball, Molthan brings with him a wealth of experience in business management and a passion for sports. Molthan sees a unique opportunity to foster and rally the community around Dallas Flash Pickleball.

‚Äç

In 2024, the Dallas Flash achieved a historic milestone by being crowned the inaugural season-long champions of the 2024 Major League Pickleball Season. The No. 3 seed Dallas Flash secured their championship title with a dramatic 2-1 series victory over the No. 1 seed New Jersey 5s at the Vulcan MLP Playoffs Orlando, held at the USTA National Campus. Their journey to the Championship included an impressive Semifinal series win against the No. 2 seed St. Louis Shock. The Dallas Flash continue to inspire fans with their cohesive teamwork, unwavering resilience, and dedication to growing pickleball.

‚Äç

About DUPR

DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) is the premier global pickleball rating system and technology platform, trusted by the world's leading clubs, tournaments, leagues, and players. DUPR's dynamic rating system unifies pickleball across age, gender, and location by analyzing match results to accurately evaluate all players across a 2.000 - 8.000 scale.
‚Äç

DUPR is the official pickleball rating of leagues, tournaments and clubs around the world, including United Pickleball Association (UPA), PPA, Major League Pickleball (MLP), Pickleball.com, Life Time, The Picklr, National Team Pickleball League, National Pickleball League. It also owns and operates Minor League Pickleball and Collegiate Pickleball, two of the biggest amateur leagues in the sport. Players and operators can visit www.dupr.com and follow us on Instagram to sign up and learn more.



About MiLP¬†

Minor League Pickleball (MLP), owned and operated by DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating), is the premier amateur pickleball tour and a one-of-a-kind platform offering players a ‚Äúplay like the pros‚Äù experience. Modeled after Major League Pickleball, MiLP has been empowering amateur teams to compete at the highest level for several years. Teams participate in a series of local events that culminate in the highly anticipated Nationals event each year, with $XXX prize money on the line.

‚Äç

With its unique team-based format, Minor League Pickleball has not only grown to become the largest amateur pickleball tour but has also served as a proving ground for future professional players. Notable alumni like Connor Garnett have made the leap to the pro ranks, showcasing the league‚Äôs ability to develop talent. Whether you‚Äôre aiming to sharpen your skills or compete for glory, Minor League Pickleball is the ultimate pathway for passionate players to elevate their game.

‚Äç

About Major League Pickleball

Major League Pickleball is the preeminent team-based professional pickleball league, featuring nearly 100 of the best athletes across 22 teams, a unique coed format, easy to understand scoring, iconic team owners, and the most electric live events and fan experience in the sport. For more information on Major League Pickleball, visit the official website and follow MLP on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, TikTok and YouTube.

‚Äç

For more information, please contact megan@dallasflashpb.com

title: CNPL and DUPR Join Forces to Standardize and Grow Pickleball Globally
summary: The Canadian National Pickleball League (CNPL) partners with DUPR pickleball rating to enhance competition, unify skill levels, and grow the sport worldwide.
content:
If you‚Äôve already explored Pro Pickleball Player, Bobbi Oshiro‚Äôs first post on singles drills, you‚Äôre off to a great start! Now, it‚Äôs time to build on those skills with another dynamic drill that will sharpen your shot placement, movement, and decision-making. If you haven't checked out Part 1, make sure to read that first!

‚Äç

ISO‚Äôs Drill: Take It to the Next Level

‚Äç

The ISO drill is already a great way to work on control and consistency, but adding variations can make it even more effective. In this version, you‚Äôll incorporate volleys and refine your movement at the kitchen, simulating the fast-paced exchanges of a real match.

‚Äç

Drill Setup:
Player A starts at the non-volley zone (either right or left side).
Player B begins at the baseline, positioned in the middle of the court.

‚Äç

How It Works:
Player A alternates shots cross-court and down the line.
Player B must return each shot with either a drive or a drop.
For the first 10 shots, Player B focuses on driving the ball.
The next 10 shots should be all drops.
After completing the set, switch roles and repeat.

‚Äç

Why This Drill Works

‚Äç

By mixing up your shots, you‚Äôre improving both offensive and defensive strategies. Driving the ball forces your opponent to react quickly, while dropping the ball helps develop touch and control under pressure. Plus, playing at the non-volley zone challenges your reaction speed and positioning, making you more prepared for real match scenarios.

‚Äç

Want even more ways to refine your singles game? Keep experimenting with different shot selections, movement patterns, and intensity levels. And if you missed Part 1, be sure to check it out for additional drills to round out your training.

‚Äç

Stay tuned for more ways to elevate your game!¬†

title: TTC & DUPR Partner to Launch Southern California‚Äôs First Official DUPR Assessment Center
summary: TTC and DUPR partner to offer accurate pickleball ratings, expert coaching, and player development at world-class facilities in Southern California.
content:
The Canadian National Pickleball League (CNPL) and Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating (DUPR) have officially signed a partnership, marking a significant step forward in the standardization and growth of the sport. As part of this collaboration, DUPR will become the official rating system of CNPL, reinforcing a commitment to competitive integrity and global expansion.

‚Äç

DUPR, with over a million users and a presence in more than 150 countries, is widely recognized as the most accurate and globally accepted rating system in pickleball. By integrating DUPR into CNPL‚Äôs competitive structure, the league is ensuring that players are rated on a fair and consistent scale, fostering a higher level of competition and transparency within the sport.

‚Äç

Pickleball is experiencing explosive growth worldwide, and this partnership aligns with both CNPL‚Äôs and DUPR‚Äôs shared vision of elevating the game to new heights. Standardized ratings help bridge gaps between different regions, making it easier for players from various skill levels and locations to compete on a level playing field. This move will also help facilitate international competition, bringing together the best players from around the world under a unified system.

‚Äç

For CNPL, adopting DUPR as the official rating system enhances player development and provides fans with a more insightful way to track performance and progress throughout the season. With DUPR‚Äôs data-driven approach, CNPL players will benefit from a system that continuously refines itself based on match outcomes, ensuring the most accurate assessment of skill levels.

‚Äç

This collaboration underscores the shared mission of CNPL and DUPR: to grow the game of pickleball in a structured, competitive, and global-minded way. As more organizations and leagues embrace a unified rating system, the sport‚Äôs legitimacy and reach will continue to expand, paving the way for a more connected and competitive pickleball community worldwide.

‚Äç

With CNPL and DUPR working together, the future of pickleball has never looked brighter. This partnership is not just about rankings‚Äîit‚Äôs about the growth, evolution, and unification of a sport that is capturing hearts across the globe.

title: Bringing Pickleball to Madagascar: A Journey of Sports and Community
summary: Hosea Randrianarivony is bringing pickleball to Madagascar, using DUPR‚Äôs pickleball ratings to foster community, leadership, and opportunity.
content:
The journey from college sports to the professional stage is often long and arduous. But for Mehvish Safdar and Ava Ignatowich, the path was accelerated thanks to the opportunities presented by the DUPR Collegiate Tour.¬†

‚Äç

Both rising stars have now made history by getting drafted into Major League Pickleball (MLP) via free agency, marking a pivotal moment not just for them but for the entire collegiate pickleball ecosystem.

‚Äç

The Impact of the DUPR Collegiate Tour

‚Äç

At its core, the DUPR Collegiate Tour is designed to bridge the gap between amateur and professional pickleball. By offering:

High-level pickleball competition for college players
A transparent and trusted pickleball rating system
National exposure for college pickleball players

‚Äç

DUPR is revolutionizing pickleball rankings and the way young talent gets discovered.

‚Äç

By competing in DUPR-sanctioned collegiate pickleball events, Mehvish and Ava gained valuable experience against the best college players in the nation. Their consistent performance in college pickleball tournaments led to boost their pickleball ratings and be directly selected in the MLP Free Agency Draft by professional scouts.¬†

‚Äç

Mehvish Safdar: A Steady Climb to the Top

‚Äç

Mehvish Safdar made waves in collegiate pickleball with her disciplined playstyle and strategic shot-making. Her journey through the DUPR Collegiate Tour saw her take on some of the best players in the nation, solidifying her reputation as a force to be reckoned with. As her DUPR rating climbed, so did her visibility among professional teams, culminating in her well-deserved selection in the MLP draft.

‚Äç

In our interview with her, Mehvish said:

‚ÄúEveryone's really friendly at these college tournaments, and DUPR does a great job of creating a very organized environment and also an environment that's just fun and friendly. DUPR also takes very good care of the athletes too.‚Äù

‚Äç

Her journey proves that:

The DUPR Pickleball Rating System is a true measure of skill.
College pickleball tournaments are now a direct pathway to professional pickleball leagues like MLP.
DUPR is shaping the next generation of MLP players

‚Äç

Her success underscores the importance of DUPR‚Äôs rating system, which ensures that talent does not go unnoticed. By competing in DUPR-sanctioned events, Mehvish demonstrated consistency and resilience, qualities that MLP teams look for in professional players.

‚Äç

Ava Ignatowich: Rising Through the Ranks

‚Äç

Ava Ignatowich, a name that has become synonymous with aggressive yet controlled play, also took full advantage of the opportunities provided by the DUPR Collegiate Tour. With a background in high-level college competition, Ava quickly adapted to the fast-paced nature of the tour, using it as a launchpad for her professional aspirations.

‚Äç

Her progression showcased her ability to perform under pressure, making her an ideal candidate for MLP teams.¬† By competing in DUPR-rated pickleball tournaments, she gained national recognition, which played a critical role in her transition to the professional circuit, reinforcing the effectiveness of the collegiate tour as a talent incubator.¬†

DUPR‚Äôs Role in Shaping the Future of Pickleball

As more college athletes engage with DUPR‚Äôs competitive framework, the transition from student-athlete to professional player will continue to become more seamless.

DUPR‚Äôs transparent rating system, nationwide competitions, and commitment to elevating collegiate players have proven to be invaluable assets for aspiring pros. As the sport of pickleball grows, the DUPR Collegiate Tour is set to remain a crucial stepping stone for young athletes aiming to make their mark at the highest level.

With Mehvish Safdar and Ava Ignatowich now stepping into the professional pickleball arena, their journey serves as an inspiration for all pickleball collegiate players who dream of reaching the pinnacle of the sport.¬†

title: 2025 MLP Updates
summary: "Get ready for an exciting 2025 MLP season with major rule changes, expanded rosters, and fresh talent. Discover key updates, including new player drafts, roster changes, and the shift to side-out scoring. With rising stars and seasoned pros, this season promises unpredictable action and fierce competition!
content:
Pickleball is a rapidly growing sport worldwide, but in Madagascar, it‚Äôs still an unknown game. However, thanks to the dedication of Hosea Randrianarivony, that is beginning to change.

‚Äç

Hosea, a pastor originally from Madagascar, has taken it upon himself to introduce the sport to his home country. His journey is not just about sports‚Äîit‚Äôs about community, leadership, and providing opportunities for a nation eager to embrace something new.

‚Äç

A Journey Rooted in Faith and Service

‚Äç

Hosea‚Äôs journey to bringing pickleball to Madagascar began long before he even picked up a paddle. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm originally from Madagascar. So, that‚Äôs where I am from. I was born and raised there. About nine years ago is when I came to America mostly to get married because I‚Äôm a pastor,‚Äù he shared. His service extended beyond the church, as he and his wife worked with Mercy Ships, a hospital organization that provides free surgeries to underserved communities.

‚Äç

Hosea‚Äôs work in Madagascar continued even after moving to the United States. He maintained his connection to his homeland by organizing annual pastor conferences. ‚ÄúFor the past five years, we‚Äôve been going to Madagascar every single year to do pastors‚Äô conferences and teach pastors to be better leaders,‚Äù he said.

‚Äç

Discovering Pickleball and Taking It Home

‚Äç

It wasn‚Äôt until March 2023 that Hosea first discovered pickleball, but he quickly saw its potential for Madagascar. ‚ÄúLast year was the first time that I thought, why don‚Äôt I bring pickleball to Madagascar?‚Äù he recalled. So, he did just that. With the support of his church and community, he gathered nets, paddles, and balls to take back home. ‚ÄúMostly, I‚Äôve been given nets and paddles and balls to bring to Madagascar,‚Äù he explained. ‚Äúright now in my studio, I possibly have up to 30 paddles.‚Äù

‚Äç

His goal is to not only introduce the sport but also organize structured leagues and tournaments. ‚ÄúThis year, I‚Äôm trying to bring medals and do a small league and a small tournament. I‚Äôm looking for 36 people for this year because I don‚Äôt have a lot of time in Madagascar. I‚Äôll have six weeks, but during those six weeks, that‚Äôs what I‚Äôm aiming for,‚Äù he said.

‚Äç

The Challenge and the Opportunity

‚Äç

One of the biggest obstacles to growing pickleball in Madagascar is the lack of resources. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure if Madagascar is the poorest country in the world right now, but it is at least in the top five poorest countries in the world,‚Äù Hosea pointed out. ‚ÄúSo I just tell them that Madagascar has been behind in most things, and there is this one opportunity in sports.‚Äù

‚Äç

For Hosea, pickleball isn‚Äôt just a game‚Äîit‚Äôs an avenue for growth and development. ‚ÄúThe people are so talented and smart, so I was like, there‚Äôs this opportunity that could help us to be equal or possibly be better at something with the world.‚Äù

‚Äç

Another challenge is the infrastructure. Madagascar lacks dedicated pickleball courts, so Hosea has had to get creative. ‚ÄúEven at my church, we‚Äôve been using painter‚Äôs tape for the lines. We went on a tennis court, which we do here in Arlington, and then we put the tapes on. That‚Äôs what I will be doing for now.‚Äù But he remains optimistic, believing that as interest grows, solutions will arise. ‚ÄúMadagascan people are very creative. They will be able to make something to be used as a net in Madagascar.‚Äù

‚Äç

Building a Pickleball Community in Madagascar

‚Äç

Hosea‚Äôs work in Madagascar extends beyond just sports. He is heavily involved in mentoring young people, particularly college students, through a group he helped create called It‚Äôs Time for Madagascar. ‚ÄúOne of the things It‚Äôs Time for Madagascar does is just take the initiative to do something,‚Äù he explained. The group has engaged in community service projects such as teaching languages, cleaning beaches, and even visiting prisons. Now, it‚Äôs also pioneering the introduction of pickleball to the island.

‚Äç

For Hosea, the key to pickleball‚Äôs success in Madagascar will be education and accessibility. ‚ÄúWe may think getting a phone like this is easy‚Äù, he says pointing at his phone, ‚Äúbut it costs a fortune in Madagascar. Most people pay the exact same price as Americans pay, but it‚Äôs a year of salary for most people in Madagascar.‚Äù This makes organizing a structured league with digital tracking a challenge. His plan? Have organizers manually keep track of scores and ratings to ensure fair competition with DUPR.

‚Äç

Looking to the Future

‚Äç

Despite the challenges, Hosea remains hopeful and committed to growing the sport in Madagascar. ‚ÄúI started learning pickleball and I went mostly from zero to a hundred. I was not really interested in pickleball‚ÄîI just wanted to be able to help the people that really love playing,‚Äù he said. But what started as a way to serve others has turned into a passion of its own.

‚Äç

As he prepares for his upcoming trip, Hosea envisions a bright future for pickleball in Madagascar. With ongoing support from his church, the pickleball community, and donors, Hosea believes Madagascar can become a stronghold for the sport. ‚ÄúI believe once people see it and get used to the game, it‚Äôs going to be awesome, and during these upcoming 6 weeks, I will be able to grow it.‚Äù

‚Äç

Through faith, perseverance, and a deep love for his home country, Hosea Randrianarivony is not just introducing a sport to Madagascar‚Äîhe‚Äôs creating a movement. A movement of inclusivity, opportunity, and hope, one paddle at a time.

‚Äç

title: Win a Fully Funded Trip to the Collegiate National Championship
summary: Enter to win a fully funded trip to the 2025 Collegiate National Championship! Reign Storm covers flights, hotel, meals, and entry for one winning pickleball team.
content:
New year, new MLP! With fresh rule changes, expanded rosters, and new talent, the 2025 season promises excitement. We‚Äôve just concluded the Premier and Challenger Free Agency Draft picks, so new faces will soon emerge in the pro pickleball space.

‚Äç

Let‚Äôs get into those updates.

‚Äç

Major Rule Changes
UPA Players Eligibility: Noncontracted UPA players are NOT eligible for the 2025 draft. Around 12 players (4 men, 8 women) from 2024 will not return.
Expanded Premier Team Rosters: Teams now have 6 players (3 men, 3 women) instead of 4, with 5th & 6th picks as subs who can also be picked up by another team into their starting lineup during the four waiver periods.
Scoring Change: No more rally scoring! Matches will now use side-out scoring, one game to 11.
Mandatory Player Drop: Each team must drop one player from their 2024 roster.

Alright, that‚Äôs enough rules. There are more rule changes to this season, but I‚Äôd say those are your biggest ones.¬†

‚Äç

MLP Roster Updates

Now for the fun part: I hope you were able to check in either March 2nd or 3rd for the Premier and Challenger draft picks because it was an interesting one! Of course I did because yes, pickleball is life. With the expansion of the roster sizes, we will be seeing new names.¬†

‚Äç

To the best of my knowledge, the Premier and Challenger drafts introduced 34 new players (27 Premier, 7 Challenger) who didn‚Äôt play in MLP 2024. Some are returning from injury, some have been dominant in PPA tournaments, and others are new to pickleball.

‚Äç

There is a great deal of talent at the 5th and 6th spot who could easily be a steal into a starting role within a Premier team. I am curious how they truly feel being in the 5th and 6th spot of a Premier team, where they could‚Äôve easily played on a Challenger team and received playing time at every event.¬†

‚Äç

Sure, it‚Äôs nice to be considered on a team with your Ben Johns and Anna Brights, but wouldn‚Äôt you just rather play instead?¬†

‚Äç

I know I would rather play, but I guess it‚Äôs a matter of preference ‚Äî and you really don't have a choice to say no if a team were to pick you up.

‚Äç

Key New Players in Starting Lineups
Atlanta Bouncers: Victoria Di Muzio ‚Äì A rising talent from Canada, but still needs time to prove herself.
Chicago Slice: Max Freeman ‚Äì PPA tour standout, strong addition.
Miami Pickleball Club: Mya Bui ‚Äì Former D1 tennis player with a competitive edge.
NY Hustlers: Helena Spiridis, Dominique Schaefer, Zane Ford ‚Äì Singles specialists working hard on doubles.
SoCal Hard Eights: Ivan Jakovljevic ‚Äì A well-trained competitor from Dallas.
Utah Black Diamonds: Mehvish Safdar ‚Äì Another D1 tennis standout and similar to Mya coming in. Both are potential dark horses here.

‚Äç

Notable Challenger Teams to Watch
Brooklyn Aces vs. Las Vegas Night Owls: Expect tight dreambreakers ‚Äì slight edge to the Night Owls due to singles talent.
Nashville Chefs: Strong pickups in the draft with Scarpa and Brown and a steal of an experienced player in Esquival to pair well with Radzikowska.
Bay Area Breakers: Wyatt Stone subbed in for the Chicago Slice in the MLP Finals last year. He's underrated, but dangerous.

‚Äç

Full Premier Team Rosters

(Sub/Bench Players in Italics; New 2025 Players in Bold)

‚Äç

Challenger Teams
‚Äç
‚ÄçFinal Thoughts

With new faces, bigger rosters, and fresh rules, 2025 is set to be an unpredictable season. Will the new players shine or struggle under pressure?¬†

Time will tell. Stay tuned!‚Äç

‚Äç

March 2025 ‚ÄúReporter on the Ground‚Äù - by Bobbi Oshiro

title: Six Zero Pickleball Partners with DUPR to Elevate the Collegiate and High School Pickleball Experience Nationwide

content:

Starting with the 2026 CNPL Draft, a player‚Äôs MiLP Canada participation will be a key factor in draft consideration, giving amateur players a clear route to the pro ranks. This partnership strengthens the connection between amateur and professional pickleball, ensuring that top talent has the opportunity to rise through the ranks.¬†

MiLP Canada Integration at CNPL III Showdowns

The upcoming CNPL III Showdowns in March will feature MiLP Canada integration, adding even more excitement for participants:¬†

Earn MiLP Canada Points ‚Äì Players will accumulate points that contribute to their overall MiLP Canada ranking.¬†
DUPR Rating Impact ‚Äì Matches will count toward players‚Äô DUPR ratings, allowing for accurate skill assessment.¬†

This integration ensures that every match played at CNPL III Showdowns carries real implications for players looking to advance in their competitive pickleball journey.¬†

title: Austin Pickle Ranch Becomes the First Official DUPR Assessment Center in Texas
summary: Austin Pickle Ranch is now Texas‚Äô first official DUPR Assessment Center, offering accurate pickleball ratings and expert coaching for players of all levels.
content:
DELRAY BEACH, Fla., Feb. 19, 2025 ‚Äî Six Zero Pickleball, a leading innovator in pickleball equipment, has partnered up with Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating (DUPR), the premier global rating system for pickleball. As part of this collaboration, Six Zero has been named the Official Paddle Sponsor of DUPR‚Äôs Collegiate and High School Verticals, solidifying its commitment to fostering the growth of pickleball at all levels of play.

‚Äç

DUPR, recognized as the gold standard in pickleball ratings, provides an accurate and comprehensive system to evaluate player skill levels. With over 1 million players rated worldwide, DUPR is trusted by top pickleball tours, professional athletes, and clubs across the globe. This partnership underscores Six Zero‚Äôs dedication to supporting the next generation of pickleball talent by providing high-quality equipment and resources to collegiate and high school athletes.

‚Äç

Expanding the Collegiate and High School Pickleball Landscape

As part of this partnership, Six Zero will be prominently featured in DUPR‚Äôs 2025 Collegiate and High School pickleball events, including:

Collegiate Tournaments: Six Zero will be the Official Paddle of ten DUPR Collegiate Events, including eight Super Regionals and the National Championships. Collegiate athletes will have the opportunity to compete using Six Zero‚Äôs top-tier paddles, designed to enhance performance on the court.
High School Tournaments: Six Zero will serve as the Title Sponsor and Official Paddle for DUPR‚Äôs High School Vertical, participating in sixteen events, including fifteen Super Regionals and the National Championships. This initiative aims to elevate the high school pickleball experience and provide young athletes with the tools they need to succeed.
Minor League Events: In addition to collegiate and high school tournaments, Six Zero will also be present at various DUPR Minor League events, from local competitions to regional and national championships. This broad presence ensures that players at all levels have access to Six Zero‚Äôs premium equipment.

‚Äç

On-Site Engagement and Community Building

At each event, Six Zero will host a dedicated booth where players, fans, and enthusiasts can explore the latest products, participate in interactive activities, and win exclusive prizes. This on-site presence will provide a unique opportunity for the pickleball community to connect with the brand and experience the quality of Six Zero‚Äôs equipment firsthand.

‚Äç

A Shared Vision for the Future of Pickleball

‚ÄúDUPR is proud to welcome Six Zero as the Official Paddle Sponsor of our Collegiate and High School Verticals,‚Äù said Ben van Hout, Head of Sponsorship & Partnership at DUPR. ‚ÄúSix Zero‚Äôs dedication to innovation and quality makes them the ideal partner to support young athletes as they compete and grow in the sport. We look forward to working together to expand the reach of pickleball and provide players with unparalleled opportunities to showcase their skills.‚Äù

‚Äç

‚ÄúWe are thrilled to partner with DUPR to support the growth of pickleball at the collegiate and high school levels,‚Äù said Dale Young, CEO of Six Zero Pickleball. ‚ÄúDUPR‚Äôs commitment to accurately rating players and fostering competitive play aligns perfectly with our mission to provide athletes with the best equipment to enhance their performance. Together, we are excited to elevate the sport and inspire the next generation of pickleball stars.‚Äù

‚Äç

Join the Movement

This partnership between Six Zero and DUPR represents a shared commitment to advancing the sport of pickleball and providing athletes with the resources they need to excel. Whether you‚Äôre a high school player aiming for the nationals, a college athlete competing in super regionals, or a Minor League hopeful, Six Zero and DUPR are here to support your journey.

‚Äç

For more information about Six Zero Pickleball, visit www.sixzeropickleball.com. To learn more about DUPR and its rating system, visit www.dupr.com

‚Äç

About Six Zero Pickleball

Six Zero Pickleball is a leading manufacturer of high-performance pickleball paddles and gear, designed to meet the needs of players at all skill levels. With a focus on innovation, quality, and player satisfaction, Six Zero is dedicated to enhancing the pickleball experience for athletes worldwide.

‚Äç

About DUPR

DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) is the premier global pickleball rating system and technology platform, trusted by the world's leading clubs, tournaments, leagues, and players. DUPR's dynamic rating system unifies pickleball across age, gender, and location by analyzing match results to accurately evaluate all players across a 2.000 - 8.000 scale.¬†

‚Äç

DUPR is the official pickleball rating of leagues, tournaments and clubs around the world, including United Pickleball Association (UPA), PPA, Major League Pickleball (MLP), Pickleball.com, Life Time, The Picklr, National Team Pickleball League, National Pickleball League. It also owns and operates Minor League Pickleball and Collegiate Pickleball, two of the biggest amateur leagues in the sport. Players and operators can visit www.dupr.com to sign up and learn more.

title: Elevate Your Coaching: Upcoming Certification Courses & International Expansion
summary: Join the DUPR X RPPk X Tyson McGuffin Level 1+2 course Feb 27‚Äì28 in NYC. Limited spots. Boost your pickleball coaching with elite training and drills.
content:
AUSTIN, TX ‚Äì Austin Pickle Ranch proudly announces its designation as the first official DUPR Assessment Center in Texas. With a steadfast commitment to excellence and innovation, Austin Pickle Ranch continues to set the standard for skill-based pickleball play, both in Texas and beyond.

‚Äç

In partnership with My DUPR Coach, DUPR Coach, and DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating)‚Äîthe world‚Äôs most accurate global pickleball rating system‚ÄîAustin Pickle Ranch is advancing its mission to offer players of all levels the opportunity for both challenging and rewarding play. This collaboration ensures players, whether new or seasoned, can track their progress with a globally recognized rating, laying the foundation for fair and competitive play at all levels.

‚Äç

DUPR is a dynamic rating system designed to help pickleball players better understand their skill level and create more competitive matches in a social play setting. Competitive play isn‚Äôt just more fun‚Äîit‚Äôs also an essential part of improving skills and building community. By offering players an accurate and globally recognized rating, DUPR enhances the quality of play and allows for level-appropriate competition. This approach helps players grow, not only in skill but also in the sense of camaraderie and community within the sport.

‚Äç

At the heart of Austin Pickle Ranch‚Äôs success is its coaching team, led by Jeff Rausch, Director of Pickleball at Austin Pickle Ranch. A highly respected figure in the pickleball coaching community, Jeff has assembled an elite team of credentialed DUPR coaches. Together, they are committed to providing accurate, globally recognized ratings, with Austin Pickle Ranch proudly boasting the largest concentration of DUPR Coaches in Texas. The facility‚Äôs unrivaled approach to coaching, combined with its unwavering dedication to delivering personalized, top-tier experiences for every player, distinguishes Austin Pickle Ranch as a leader in the sport.

‚Äç

Austin Pickle Ranch‚Äôs dedication to programming excellence is evident in its meticulous approach to coaching. Every assessment is conducted by multiple certified DUPR coaches to ensure consistency and accuracy while also providing players with the insights they need to improve.¬†

‚Äç

"As one of the hottest pickleball markets in the country, Austin is primed for continued growth in the sport, and Austin Pickle Ranch‚Äôs focus on elite coaching and high-quality programming will be a game-changer for players at every level," said Ryan Maher, DUPR‚Äôs Vice-President of Partnerships and Programs. "Their commitment to providing non-rated players with Coach-Assigned DUPR ratings and giving rated players access to world-class coaches is set to elevate the Austin pickleball scene, creating an unmatched player experience."¬†

‚Äç

This new initiative further reinforces Austin Pickle Ranch‚Äôs mission to foster a welcoming, skill-focused environment where players of all abilities can thrive. With a robust calendar of DUPR Assessments already underway, players now have the opportunity to receive a globally recognized rating that helps them find level-appropriate competition, whether at the Ranch or in regional tournaments.

‚Äç

‚ÄúBeing the first official DUPR Assessment Center in Texas is a huge honor, and we‚Äôre thrilled to be part of the ongoing growth of pickleball in our community,‚Äù said Tim Klitch, co-founder of Austin Pickle Ranch. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve always strived to offer world-class facilities and the highest-quality coaching, and our new partnership with DUPR further solidifies our commitment. Our goal is to equip every player with the tools they need to succeed and elevate their game.‚Äù

‚Äç

Katie Nimitz, President of MyJourney Pickleball, praised Austin Pickle Ranch‚Äôs efforts, saying, ‚ÄúWinners win‚Äîand Jeff Rausch is a winner. With him at the helm, this team of credentialed DUPR coaches is transforming the pickleball scene in Austin. The caliber of their programming and coaching is unmatched. Whether you‚Äôre a player, coach, or club member, what Jeff and the Ranch are doing is impossible to overlook. They‚Äôre setting a new benchmark for pickleball development in Austin, and their influence will be felt for years to come.‚Äù

‚Äç

How to Get Your Coach-Assigned DUPR Rating

Austin Pickle Ranch is now offering Coach-Assigned DUPR Assessments, where players can work with credentialed DUPR coaches to evaluate their skills and receive a globally recognized rating. These assessments are ideal for players looking to join level-appropriate games, participate in competitive events, or simply gain a clearer understanding of their pickleball abilities.

‚Äç

To schedule your Coach-Assigned DUPR assessment or learn more, visit https://austinpickleranch.podplay.app/community/events?tag=DUPR+Assessment.¬†

‚Äç

About DUPR

DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) is the premier global pickleball rating system and technology platform, trusted by the world's leading clubs, tournaments, leagues, and players. DUPR's dynamic rating system unifies pickleball across age, gender, and location by analyzing match results to accurately evaluate all players across a 2.000 - 8.000 scale.

‚Äç

DUPR is the official pickleball rating of leagues, tournaments and clubs around the world, including United Pickleball Association (UPA), Professional Pickleball Association (PPA), Major League Pickleball (MLP), Pickleball.com, Life Time, The Picklr, National Team Pickleball League, National Pickleball League. It also owns and operates Minor League Pickleball and Collegiate Pickleball, two of the biggest amateur leagues in the sport. Players and operators can visit www.dupr.com to sign up and learn more.

‚Äç

About DUPR Coach

DUPR Coach is a program designed to empower pickleball coaches to launch Coach-Assigned DUPR ratings for the 34 million non-rated players worldwide. Powered by MyJourney Pickleball, DUPR Coach helps coaches provide valuable insights into players' skill levels and supports the growth of pickleball through more competitive, enjoyable play. Coaches interested in becoming DUPR Coaches can visit duprcoach.com/coach-cert to sign up and learn more.

‚Äç

About Austin Pickle Ranch

Located in Austin, Texas, and co-founded by Tim Klitch and Dan Keelan, Austin Pickle Ranch keeps Austin weird, one pickleball match at a time! Home to Austin‚Äôs largest network of indoor courts, Austin Pickle Ranch prides itself on offering an inclusive environment for all players. Whether a player seeks professional instruction or a relaxed game, Austin Pickle Ranch‚Äôs facility is designed to accommodate players of all skill levels. The North Austin location can be found at 11000 Middle Fiskville Rd., Building B, Austin, TX 78753, and it houses 16 indoor courts. In addition to open play, Austin Pickle Ranch offers first-time player introduction classes, lessons, clinics, and more. For more information on Austin Pickle Ranch, please visit austinpickleranch.com and follow along on social media ‚Äî Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.¬†

title: Introducing the High School Pickleball National Championship
summary: Join the first-ever DUPR High School Pickleball National Championship from April 25-2 at Life Time Lakeville, MN! Compete against top high school pickleball players nationwide in singles and team divisions.
content:
Pickleball at the collegiate level is more than just a game‚Äîit‚Äôs a high-energy, passion-driven sport that fosters camaraderie, competition, and unforgettable moments. That‚Äôs exactly what the James Madison University (JMU) Pickleball Club set out to showcase in their new documentary, ‚ÄúFor the Love of the Game - The JMU Pickleball Nationals Experience.‚Äù Having premiered on January 22, 2025, this video offers an inside look at the trials, triumphs, and tenacity of JMU‚Äôs team as they took on the best in the nation at the 2024 DUPR¬†Collegiate National Championship.

‚Äç

More Than Just Singles and Doubles

‚Äç

Collegiate pickleball's format adds layers of strategy and teamwork. A team consists of four players‚Äîtwo men and two women‚Äîcompeting against each other. Each match begins with a women‚Äôs doubles, then follows a men‚Äôs doubles game, and by two mixed doubles matches

¬†

If the teams split 2-2, it all comes down to a ‚ÄúDreambreaker‚Äù, a high-stakes team singles match where players rotate every four points. As JMU's Team member, Ryan Morneau, put it,

‚Äç

‚ÄúEven if you have a really, really good player, you need the whole team to be there to really exchange these matches.‚Äù

‚Äç

‚Äç

JMU‚Äôs Unique Vibe: Energy, Passion, and a Little Bit of Chaos

‚Äç

JMU brings an energy that often sets them apart from the competition. Their players embrace a culture that thrives on excitement, passion, and an undeniable presence on the court. From the sidelines to the final point, they‚Äôre loud, engaged, and always supporting their teammates.¬†

‚Äç

For them, pickleball isn‚Äôt just about winning; it‚Äôs about creating an atmosphere where energy fuels performance and every match feels like an event. Their approach has helped build a team identity that stands out in collegiate pickleball, making them one of the most talked-about programs in the sport.

‚Äç

That same enthusiasm, however, can also make them a target. Their relentless support and high-energy approach aren‚Äôt always well-received by opponents who prefer a quieter, more traditional competitive environment. Some teams see JMU‚Äôs presence as overwhelming, even frustrating, leading to a natural rivalry dynamic.¬†

‚Äç

Whether loved or disliked, one thing is certain‚ÄîJMU leaves an impression, and their impact on the court is impossible to ignore.

‚Äç

‚Äç

JMU's Journey at The 2024 DUPR Collegiate National Championship

‚Äç

JMU started Nationals with nerves high, struggling early against Purdue. Costly mistakes in doubles and mixed doubles led to a tough loss.

‚Äç

‚ÄúWe lost that match, and it was on me,‚Äù said Morneau. Despite a strong fight in the Dreambreaker, they fell 21-18.

‚Äç

Regrouping, JMU bounced back with a win, using it to sharpen their game before the elimination rounds. The depth of their 20-player roster proved crucial, emphasizing team chemistry beyond just skill.

JMU‚Äôs final showdown was against their biggest rivals, Virginia Tech. With Tech‚Äôs new star player, the match carried extra intensity. JMU fell behind 20-8, but refused to quit, rallying to 20-19 in a stunning comeback. However, a missed serve on match point sealed the loss.

Though they fell short, JMU left Nationals knowing they could compete with the best‚Äîand with confidence that next time, they‚Äôd be ready to win.

‚Äç

The Future of Collegiate Pickleball

‚Äç

JMU‚Äôs experience at Nationals highlights the rapid growth of collegiate pickleball. The event also highlighted the rapid rise of collegiate pickleball, with 64 teams competing‚Äîa number set to double next year, thanks to growing support from DUPR and the PPA. As more schools join the competition, the sport is evolving beyond just a club activity. With its rising popularity, many believe it‚Äôs only a matter of time before scholarships and NIL deals become a reality. The increase in teams from year to year shows just how quickly the sport is expanding, outpacing traditional college tennis events in size and excitement.

‚Äç

For the Love of the Game ‚Äì The JMU Pickleball Nationals Experience" captures the dedication and resilience of a team pushing the limits of collegiate pickleball. More than just a tournament, it‚Äôs a look at a fast-growing sport and the players driving its momentum. Watch the full documentary here.

‚Äç

Who‚Äôs Competing?

Individual singles competitions will highlight the most elite high school athletes nationwide. Any high school can sign up, and all players are welcome.

The Competition Format

Coed teams will compete using the MLPlay format, a fast-paced, strategic style also featured in DUPR‚Äôs Minor League Pickleball and Collegiate Pickleball Pathway. This format has taken the pickleball world by storm and is designed to maximize excitement and competitive balance.

To accommodate all students, high schools with all-girl or all-boy teams can compete in a unique 3-person gender format, giving every team a chance to shine.

In addition to team competition, players can compete in a singles format designed to showcase individual talent and skill development. The singles division will follow a round-robin or pool play structure, ensuring multiple matches for every participant before advancing to a knockout stage.
