title: Experience the Future of Racquet Sports with DUPR at RacquetX
summary: Experience RacquetX 2025 with DUPR! Join us for youth development discussions, pickleball ratings, and exciting racquet sports events. Register today!
content:
Pickleball continues to soar in popularity, captivating players of all ages with its unique blend of tennis, badminton, and ping pong. If you‚Äôve been considering creating a portable pickleball court for your own home or recreational space, this guide is for you. From understanding pickleball court dimensions to selecting the best court equipment, we‚Äôll walk you through everything you need to know about setting up and maintaining a court that‚Äôs both functional and fun.

What is a Portable Pickleball Court?

A portable pickleball court is an adaptable, easily assembled setup that allows you to enjoy the game without the commitment of a permanent structure. Whether you have a small backyard, a park, or a community center at your disposal, a portable court provides flexibility for playing on the go. Its ease of setup and takedown makes it ideal for those who want to enjoy pickleball wherever they choose.

‚Äç

Understanding the Right Pickleball Court Dimensions

Before you begin your pickleball court construction, it's crucial to understand the appropriate pickleball court dimensions. A standard court measures 20 feet wide by 44 feet long for both singles and doubles play. However, if you‚Äôre working with limited space, it‚Äôs possible to adjust the size of your court using portable boundary lines that will allow for a more customized experience.

When designing your setup, ensure there is enough room for movement while still maintaining an enjoyable, competitive environment. A balance between size and usability is key to creating the perfect space for pickleball.

‚Äç

Key Elements of Pickleball Court Construction

The core components of a pickleball court revolve around creating a safe and enjoyable environment. One of the most important aspects is the pickleball court surface. While traditional courts are often made from concrete or asphalt, portable options may use materials such as synthetic turf or rubber tiles. These surfaces offer both durability and comfort, ensuring a smooth and safe experience for players of all skill levels.

In terms of construction, a pickleball court design generally incorporates lightweight materials like PVC for easy assembly. A removable pickleball court net, boundary lines, and markings replicate the feel of a traditional court, creating an authentic playing experience.

‚Äç

Choosing the Right Pickleball Court Net

A quality pickleball court net is a crucial component of your setup. Look for nets that are both adjustable and sturdy enough to withstand outdoor conditions. Nylon or polyester nets are commonly used because they stay taut during play and are resistant to weather damage. Official net height specifications are 36 inches at the sidelines and 34 inches at the center.

Whether you‚Äôre a competitive player or just looking to have fun, the right net ensures that your games stay on track and your setup remains functional.

‚Äç

Essential Pickleball Court Equipment

Beyond the net, there are a few other essential pieces of pickleball court equipment to complete your setup. Paddles, pickleballs, and proper footwear are key to an optimal game. Paddles come in various materials, such as wood, composite, and graphite, while pickleballs are specifically designed for either indoor or outdoor play.

Investing in high-quality equipment will not only improve your game but also ensure that your pickleball court stands the test of time, providing years of enjoyment.

‚Äç

The Process of Pickleball Court Installation

Setting up a portable pickleball court doesn‚Äôt need to be complicated. Start by selecting a flat, level area that‚Äôs free from debris. Use adjustable boundary markers to outline the dimensions of the court. The pickleball court net should be set up with adjustable height settings, and you can enhance the surface with materials like rubber tiles or artificial grass if needed.

If you‚Äôre unsure about the process, many companies that sell portable courts provide video tutorials or easy-to-follow guides for installation.

‚Äç

Maintaining Your Pickleball Court

Pickleball court maintenance is essential for keeping your court in top shape. Regularly check the pickleball court surface for wear and tear, particularly if you‚Äôre using synthetic materials or tiles. Clean your pickleball court net to prevent dirt buildup and ensure it remains taut throughout gameplay. Boundary markers should also be inspected periodically to make sure they‚Äôre still correctly positioned.

For outdoor courts, be mindful of the weather. When not in use, store your equipment in a safe, dry place to protect it from harsh conditions, extending the life of your court and accessories.

‚Äç

Must-Have Pickleball Court Accessories

To make your court even more functional, consider investing in a few pickleball court accessories. Boundary line markers are crucial for creating accurate court dimensions, especially in a portable setup. A portable scoreboard is another great addition, helping you keep track of scores during competitive play.

Other accessories, such as storage solutions for paddles and balls, or outdoor lighting for nighttime games, can significantly enhance your experience. These accessories ensure that you‚Äôre always ready for a fun and competitive match.

‚Äç

Conclusion

Creating a portable pickleball court at home is a great way to enjoy the sport without needing a permanent facility. By understanding the right pickleball court dimensions, using the proper court equipment, and maintaining the right pickleball court surface, you can build a setup that suits your needs. Adding essential pickleball court accessories and investing time in court maintenance will ensure that your court remains functional for years to come.

Whether you're just getting into pickleball or you're a seasoned player, a portable court gives you the flexibility to play wherever and whenever you want. Happy playing!

‚Äç

title: The Fort Becomes the Official DUPR Assessment Center in South Florida
summary: The Fort in Fort Lauderdale is South Florida's official DUPR Assessment Center, offering Coach-Assigned pickleball ratings and world-class facilities.
content:
Columbus, OH¬† ‚Äî February 19, 2025 ‚Äî Pickle & Chill is proud to announce its designation as the first official DUPR Certified Assessment Center in Ohio and the Midwest, marking a significant milestone in the region‚Äôs pickleball growth and commitment to skill-based, competitive play.

‚Äç

Since its inception, Pickle & Chill has been at the forefront of fostering a vibrant pickleball community in Columbus, offering top-tier programming, leagues, and events. Now, through an official partnership with My DUPR Coach, DUPR Coach, and DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating)‚Äîthe world‚Äôs leading rating system for pickleball‚ÄîPickle & Chill is elevating the playing experience by providing Coach-Assigned DUPR ratings. This new initiative ensures that players of all skill levels can receive an accurate rating to facilitate competitive and balanced matchups.

‚Äç

A Game-Changer for Pickleball in the Midwest

‚ÄúDUPR ratings are an essential tool in enhancing competitive play, allowing players to find appropriate matchups and improve their game,‚Äù said David Seckel, Director of Pickleball at Pickle & Chill. ‚ÄúAs the first and only official DUPR Certified Assessment Center in Columbus and the Midwest, we are excited to offer this opportunity to our community and set a new standard for competitive pickleball in the region.‚Äù

‚Äç

Through DUPR Assessment Sessions, players at Pickle & Chill can now work with credentialed coaches to receive an initial DUPR rating, making it easier to participate in level-based play. In addition to the assessments, Pickle & Chill will continue to host DUPR-rated events such as round-robin tournaments and leagues, offering ample opportunities for players to refine their ratings through match play.

‚Äç

What is DUPR and Why Does It Matter?

DUPR is the premier global rating system for pickleball, designed to unify competitive play across age, gender, and location. By leveraging DUPR Coach and the My DUPR Coach app, players receive expert assessments from trained coaches, ensuring more accurate skill ratings. This system helps players connect with opponents of similar skill levels, improving overall game quality and enjoyment.

‚Äç

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre thrilled to expand our network of DUPR Assessment Centers with Pickle & Chill leading the way in the Midwest,‚Äù said Ryan Maher, VP of Commercial Operations at DUPR. ‚ÄúPickle & Chill‚Äôs commitment to player development makes them a great partner to bring Coach-Assigned DUPR ratings. This is a huge step in growing pickleball in the region, and we look forward to supporting their efforts.‚Äù

‚Äç

How to Get Your Coach-Assigned DUPR Rating

Starting in March, Pickle & Chill will offer DUPR Assessment Sessions for players looking to establish their official rating. These sessions are ideal for those seeking to join level-based leagues, enter competitive tournaments, or gain a clearer understanding of their pickleball abilities.

‚Äç

To learn more about getting your DUPR rating at Pickle & Chill, visit www.pickleandchill.com download the Pickle & Chill app or the My DUPR Coach app to get started.

‚Äç

About Pickle & Chill
Pickle & Chill is Columbus‚Äô premier pickleball destination, offering twelve indoor courts, ten outdoor courts, a turf and gaming area, and a vibrant community of players. With a mission centered around community, fairness, learning, fun, and wellness, Pickle & Chill provides top-tier programming, leagues, and social events to players of all levels.

‚Äç

For more information, visit www.pickleandchill.com or follow Pickle & Chill on social media.

‚Äç

About DUPR Coach

DUPR Coach is a program designed to empower pickleball coaches to launch DUPR Coach-Assigned ratings for the 34 million non-rated players worldwide. Powered by MyJourney Pickleball, DUPR Coach helps coaches provide valuable insights into players' skill levels and supports the growth of pickleball through more competitive, enjoyable play. Coaches interested in becoming DUPR Coaches can visit duprcoach.com/coach-cert to sign up and learn more.

‚Äç

About DUPR
DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) is the leading global pickleball rating system, trusted by clubs, tournaments, and leagues worldwide. With its dynamic and inclusive rating scale, DUPR helps unify the sport by providing accurate skill assessments across all levels of play. Learn more at www.dupr.com.

title: The Dink Minor League Pickleball Expands to Canada with Yui See Lau Leading the Way
summary: Minor League Pickleball (MiLP) expands to Canada with Yui See Lau leading the way. Discover exciting tournaments and the competitive team format shaping Canadian pickleball.
content:
FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. ‚Äî February 13, 2025 ‚Äî The world of pickleball is set for a major transformation in South Florida as The Fort announces its official designation as the region‚Äôs DUPR Assessment Center. Known as the "Augusta of Pickleball" and the "Wimbledon of Pickleball," The Fort has quickly become one of the sport‚Äôs most prestigious and exciting venues. This landmark partnership with DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) ‚Äî the world‚Äôs most accurate global rating system ‚Äî and DUPR Coach will redefine how players of all levels are rated, compete, and improve their game.

‚Äç

The Fort, located in the heart of Fort Lauderdale, is more than just a pickleball facility; it‚Äôs an experience. Featuring 43 professional regulation courts, 14 weatherproof, including the world‚Äôs first dedicated pickleball stadium, The Fort has quickly become a world-class destination. With cutting-edge technologies like FORTv, powered by Playsight for live-streaming matches, instant replays, and coaching analysis, the facility offers a unique, dynamic experience. Its proprietary engine will allow viewers to access and sort content by skill level, age, and type of play, providing the flexibility to watch both live and previous matches. This innovative approach is setting a new standard in the sport.

‚Äç

But the excitement doesn‚Äôt stop at the courts. The Fort offers a unique blend of competitive play, social atmosphere, and South Florida lifestyle. Guests can enjoy made-from-scratch culinary delights at the Lakeside Kitchen and Bar, sip crafted beverages with friends, or dive into other amenities like golf simulators, a dart room, volleyball, beach tennis, paddleboarding, and even an onsite PT Center. Whether you‚Äôre at The Fort¬† to challenge your limits or simply soak in the vibe, The Fort delivers the perfect mix of social and athletic experiences. As a member, guest, or even a walk-in, you'll enjoy exclusive access to priority bookings, special events, and personalized opportunities to improve your game, ensuring the best possible experience.

‚Äç

As part of this groundbreaking partnership, The Fort becomes the official venue in South Florida to offer DUPR Coach-Assigned Ratings at scale, available to all members, guests, and walk-ins. Every coach at The Fort will be a credentialed DUPR Coach, equipped to provide players with accurate, professional assessments of their skill level. With this official designation, The Fort will host DUPR Rating Sessions, allowing players to earn their DUPR ratings, find balanced, level-appropriate matches, and support beginners on their journey toward competitive league and tournament play.

‚Äç

Additionally, PlaySight‚Äôs integration with DUPR and DUPR Coach elevates pickleball assessments, coaching, and player development to new heights. DUPR Coaches at The Fort will leverage this cutting-edge technology to rate players both in-person during DUPR Assessment Sessions and virtually through PlaySight‚Äôs cameras, ensuring an enhanced and more precise assessment experience.

‚Äç

Kicking off its inaugural event on March 8, 2025, The Fort will officially launch its DUPR programming, with an even larger event to follow on March 21, 2025. These events will feature DUPR Rating Sessions, DUPR Open Play, a comprehensive schedule of player development clinics‚Äîall led by credentialed DUPR coaches‚Äîalong with incredible vibes at the world‚Äôs premier pickleball destination. Be part of the inaugural event on March 8‚Äîsign up here, visit the PlayTheFort app for more details, and get ready for a game-changing experience!

‚Äç

Becoming a member of The Fort means gaining exclusive access to everything this game-changing venue has to offer. As a member, you‚Äôll enjoy priority booking for court time, leagues, lessons, events, early invitations to special events, and special perks across The Fort's world-class amenities. The Fort‚Äôs commitment to fostering a strong pickleball community ensures members will experience unparalleled opportunities to grow their game through structured programs and access to top-tier coaches. Plus, enjoy social gatherings, live music, and special events as part of the full South Florida lifestyle.

‚Äç

‚ÄúWe are beyond excited to partner with The Fort as the official DUPR Assessment Center in South Florida,‚Äù said Tito Machado, CEO of DUPR. ‚ÄúThe Fort is setting a new standard in pickleball, combining world-class facilities with a player-first approach that aligns perfectly with our mission to elevate the sport. By integrating DUPR Coach-Assigned Ratings and comprehensive programming, The Fort is not just enhancing how players are rated‚Äîit‚Äôs revolutionizing how they compete, improve, and grow, creating a dynamic and inclusive environment for all levels of players.‚Äù

‚Äç

This partnership represents a pivotal moment in the rapidly expanding pickleball community of South Florida. With the area already being a hotspot for sports and tourism, The Fort adds a powerful new layer of opportunity for players at all levels to engage, improve, and thrive. By offering DUPR Coach-Assigned ratings, players will have access to a more personalized and precise understanding of their skill level, making it easier to join games that are perfectly suited to their abilities.

‚Äç

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre incredibly excited to partner with DUPR and DUPR Coach to bring DUPR‚Äôs advanced player rating system to South Florida,‚Äù said Brad Tuckman, CEO of The Fort. ‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt just about providing top-notch facilities‚Äîit‚Äôs about fostering a community of players who can challenge and support each other. We understand the importance of ensuring that everyone enjoys the game at their own skill level, which is key to having the best experience at The Fort. Whether you‚Äôre here for fun social play or motivated to drive your DUPR rating higher with competitive play‚Äîwho knows, maybe even become a pro one day‚Äîwe‚Äôre strong supporters of all types of players. By becoming an official DUPR Assessment Center in South Florida, we‚Äôre giving players a pathway to success and a platform for their growth. This partnership helps create a space where players can measure their progress, refine their skills, and truly feel a sense of accomplishment in their pickleball journey. Whether it's fun or competitive, The Fort is the go-to place for all.‚Äù

‚Äç

‚ÄúAs the official DUPR Assessment Center in South Florida, The Fort is not only enhancing the pickleball experience but also driving economic growth in the region. By offering the opportunity to receive a DUPR Coach-Assigned Rating and participate in DUPR programming, The Fort is fostering a dynamic and thriving pickleball community. This designation will attract both local and international visitors, boost tourism, and further solidify South Florida's reputation as a premier destination for world-class sports and recreation. The combination of this prestigious facility with DUPR ratings will leave a lasting impact on both the local economy and the sport‚Äôs evolution,‚Äù said Katie Nimitz, President of MyJourney Pickleball.

‚Äç

About DUPR

DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) is the premier global pickleball rating system and technology platform, trusted by the world's leading clubs, tournaments, leagues, and players. DUPR's dynamic rating system unifies pickleball across age, gender, and location by analyzing match results to accurately evaluate all players across a 2.000 - 8.000 scale.

‚Äç

DUPR is the official pickleball rating of leagues, tournaments and clubs around the world, including United Pickleball Association (UPA), Professional Pickleball Association (PPA), Major League Pickleball (MLP), Pickleball.com, Life Time, The Picklr, National Team Pickleball League, National Pickleball League. It also owns and operates Minor League Pickleball and Collegiate Pickleball, two of the biggest amateur leagues in the sport. Players and operators can visit www.dupr.com to sign up and learn more.

‚Äç

About DUPR Coach

DUPR Coach is a program designed to empower pickleball coaches to launch DUPR Coach-Assigned ratings for the 34 million non-rated players worldwide. Powered by MyJourney Pickleball, DUPR Coach helps coaches provide valuable insights into players' skill levels and supports the growth of pickleball through more competitive, enjoyable play. Coaches interested in becoming DUPR Coaches can visit duprcoach.com/coach-cert to sign up and learn more.

‚Äç

About The Fort

The Fort is South Florida‚Äôs premier pickleball destination, featuring 43 state-of-the-art courts and the world‚Äôs first pickleball stadium. Designed for players of all levels, The Fort offers the perfect setting for social and competitive play, professional instruction, and corporate events. With a focus on high-energy experiences and inclusive programming, The Fort is redefining the way people engage with the fastest-growing sport in America.

To become a member, learn more about DUPR programming, explore The Fort‚Äôs amenities, and register for upcoming events, visit playthefort.com.

title: Pickleball Goes Global: A Look at the Sport‚Äôs Biggest International Stops
summary: 2025 marks pickleball's global growth with the PPA Tour, WPBL, PWR competitions, and pickleball ratings.
content:
The Dink Minor League Pickleball (MiLP) is making its way to Canada, bringing its innovative team-based competition format to a new and rapidly growing pickleball community. With successful expansions into multiple regions, MiLP is now set to introduce its unique team competition to players across Canada, offering guaranteed matches and an exciting, fast-paced format that has gained national attention in the U.S.

‚Äç

Leading this expansion is Yui See Lau, who has been appointed as the Director of Minor League Pickleball Canada. After his remarkable success in launching MiLP in China, Yui will now take on the challenge of growing the league across Canada, bringing the same energy, expertise, and passion to the Canadian pickleball community. As Director, he will oversee and coordinate all MiLP events in Canada, working closely with local clubs, players, and partners to create unforgettable tournaments and experiences.

‚Äç

‚ÄúPickleball‚Äôs growth in Canada has been phenomenal, and MiLP is thrilled to provide a competitive yet inclusive format that fosters community, teamwork, and high-level play,‚Äù said Lau. ‚ÄúWe are eager to create an unforgettable experience for Canadian players and set the foundation for a strong and thriving MiLP presence.‚Äù

‚Äç

The official launch will kick off with two highly anticipated events:

APR 5 - MiLP IPOP - Inclusive Place of Pickleball (IPOP)
9855 Austin Rd #2, Burnaby, BC V3J 1N4
APR 26 - MiLP HiSports Vaughan
8301 Keele St, Concord, ON L4K 1Z6

Each event will feature MiLP‚Äôs signature format: mixed teams of four players (two women, two men) competing in divisions based on their combined DUPR rating. Teams will face off in a round-robin competition, playing four 21-point games (two gendered, two mixed), ensuring an engaging and competitive experience for all participants.

‚Äç

‚ÄúI‚Äôm thrilled to bring Minor League Pickleball to Canada and help grow the game in a country with such a passionate sports community. After witnessing the excitement that Minor League Pickleball generated in China, I‚Äôm one hundred percent certain that Canadian players will also embrace this unique team format. Our goal is to create an inclusive, dynamic environment where athletes of all levels can compete, connect, and have fun. I can‚Äôt wait to see the energy on the courts this March,‚Äù added Lau.

‚Äç

The expansion into Canada marks a significant milestone for Minor League Pickleball, reinforcing its commitment to growing the sport and providing players with high-quality, team-based competition. As excitement builds, Canadian pickleball enthusiasts are encouraged to stay tuned for further details and registration opportunities.

‚Äç

For more information on MiLP Canada and upcoming events, visit www.dupr.com/minorleague or follow Minor League Pickleball on social media.

‚Äç

About Minor League Pickleball

Minor League Pickleball is an innovative team competition featuring guaranteed matches in a dynamic round-robin format. Designed to enhance the competitive experience while fostering community engagement, MiLP continues to expand its reach and bring exciting new opportunities to pickleball players worldwide.

title: The Pickleball Performance Blueprint: How to Build Your Individual Development Plan for Success
summary: Want to improve your pickleball game? Learn how to create an Individual Development Plan (IDP) to assess your level and train with purpose.
content:
In Meridian, Idaho, The Flying Pickle has built more than a pickleball club; it‚Äôs created a full ecosystem for players of every level. Between the quality of its facilities, the variety of its programs, and its focus on member experience, it has become a model DUPR Club other facilities are taking note of.¬†

‚Äç

And now, with their franchise model, they are ready to expand nationwide

‚Äç

Adding Value With DUPR+

‚Äç

When The Flying Pickle¬† decided to integrate DUPR+ into its Pro Membership package, it wasn‚Äôt about raising prices or chasing revenue. As Club Director Tristan Belue explains, it was about one thing: adding value for their most dedicated players.

‚Äç

‚ÄúOur goal is to be a one-stop shop for everything pickleball. DUPR+ is just another way we can give more to our members,‚Äù said Tristan Belue, Club Director at The Flying Pickle.¬†

‚Äç

The Flying Pickle‚Äôs Pro Members already enjoy perks like earlier schedule visibility, more concurrent reservations, and access to premium programs. Adding DUPR+ simply made the membership ‚Äúthat much more valuable‚Äù and set the club apart from local competitors.

Every detail is designed to make the club a place people want to spend time, not just a place to play a match.

Programming That Keeps Courts Full

Clinics & Drills: From ‚ÄúLearn to Play‚Äù for newcomers to skill-specific drills for advanced players.

Why Other Clubs Are Watching

The success of The Flying Pickle‚Äôs Meridian location has sparked plans for franchising the model. While expansion details are still being finalized, the approach of combining high-quality facilities, strong community programming, and integrated player tools like DUPR has proven effective in attracting and retaining members.

‚Äç

Interested in franchising with them? Learn more here.

‚Äç

For players, it‚Äôs a one-stop shop for everything pickleball. For club directors, it‚Äôs a case study in how thoughtful facility design and programming can build lasting engagement.

‚Äç

Interested in bringing the same value to your members? To learn how to become a DUPR+ Club, email clubs@mydupr.com.

title: Elevate Your Game with Singles Drills
summary: Struggling with singles pickleball? Master the ISOS drill to improve your pickleball game and boost your DUPR rating.
content:
‚ÄçWhy Every Competitive Pickleball Player Needs an IDP

Most players train hard but never reach their full potential.

‚Äç

They show up, play, and hope they improve. But hope isn‚Äôt a strategy.

‚Äç

To compete at the highest level, you need a structured plan‚Äîone that identifies your weaknesses, maximizes your strengths, and creates a clear path for growth.

‚Äç

That‚Äôs where an Individual Development Plan (IDP) comes in.

‚Äç

This article will show you how to build your own IDP to systematically improve, train with purpose, and elevate your performance on the court.

‚Äç

Understanding the Pickleball Performance Model

Many players focus on the wrong things. They drill the same shots over and over but neglect the bigger picture of what makes a complete athlete.

‚Äç

To compete at an elite level, you need to develop in five key areas:

‚Äç

Physical Performance ‚Äì Your endurance, strength, speed, and recovery determine whether you can play at a high level for an entire match, or even a multi-day tournament.
Psychological Performance ‚Äì The ability to handle pressure, stay focused, and bounce back after mistakes separates good players from great ones.
Intellectual Performance ‚Äì Your daily habits, nutrition, hydration, sleep, and ability to learn from mistakes directly impact your energy and decision-making.
Technical Performance ‚Äì Your strokes must be consistent, efficient, and effective under game conditions.
Tactical Performance ‚Äì It‚Äôs not just about hitting great shots; you need to choose the right shot at the right time, anticipate opponents‚Äô moves, and adapt on the fly.¬†

‚Äç

Why This Matters: Ignoring any of these areas creates weaknesses in your game. The best players recognize their gaps and have a plan to improve all five.

‚Äç

Next, let‚Äôs assess where you currently stand in each of these areas.

‚Äç

Assessing Yourself ‚Äì Where Do You Stand Today?

Most players think they know their strengths and weaknesses‚Äîbut without a structured self-assessment, they‚Äôre just guessing.

‚Äç

The problem? Blind spots.

‚Äç

To improve quickly, you need a clear picture of what‚Äôs holding you back. Here‚Äôs how to do it:

‚Äç

Step 1: Rate Yourself (1-4 Scale)

1 ‚Äì Needs Improvement | 2 ‚Äì Sufficient | 3 ‚Äì Excellent | 4 ‚Äì Outstanding
Score yourself on physical endurance, focus under pressure, shot consistency, positioning, and other key areas.

Step 2: Get a Coach or Skilled Third Party‚Äôs Input

They will see things you can‚Äôt.
A coach can confirm if your self-assessment is accurate or highlight areas you overlooked.

Step 3: Answer This Question:
‚ÄúIf I don‚Äôt achieve my potential, it will be because of ______.‚Äù

‚Äç

Why This Matters: This simple question forces you to confront your biggest limitations‚Äîso you can start fixing them.

Once you‚Äôve identified your weaknesses, it‚Äôs time to prioritize what matters most.

‚Äç

Setting Priorities ‚Äì What Areas Need the Most Work?

Trying to fix everything at once leads to frustration and slow progress.

‚Äç

The key? Laser-focus on 2-3 areas that will give you the biggest improvement.

‚Äç

Rule #1: Prioritize Development Based on Competitive Edge

What will most impact your game? Stamina? Shot consistency? Shot selection?

Rule #2: Never Neglect Your Strengths

Double down on what you‚Äôre best at. If your forehand drive is elite, make it unstoppable.

Rule #3: Set SMART Goals

Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound
Example: Instead of "get better at dinks," say, "Improve dink consistency to 80% in live drills within 4 weeks."

‚Äç

Why This Matters: Clear priorities = faster improvement. A scattered approach gets scattered results.

‚Äç

With your priorities set, let‚Äôs build your Individual Development Plan.

‚Äç

Section 4: Building Your Individual Development Plan (IDP)

A great plan is simple and actionable.

‚Äç

Here‚Äôs how to structure your IDP:

‚Äç

Step 1: Identify Specific Action Steps for Each Weakness

Physical ‚Äì Increase endurance ‚Üí Add structured conditioning drills
Mental ‚Äì Improve focus ‚Üí Develop pre-match mental routines
Technical ‚Äì More consistent third-shot drops ‚Üí Focused drill sessions
Tactical ‚Äì Better doubles positioning ‚Üí Film study & strategy work

Step 2: Implement a Feedback Loop

Regular check-ins with a coach or mentor
Tracking progress over weeks/months

Step 3: Adjust & Adapt Over Time

Performance isn‚Äôt linear‚Äîsome skills take longer to improve.
Be flexible but stay consistent.

‚Äç

Why This Matters: Having an IDP keeps you accountable and ensures you‚Äôre training with purpose instead of just playing more matches.

‚Äç

Now that you have a plan, how do you execute it consistently?

‚Äç

How to Execute & Stay Consistent

The best plan means nothing if you don‚Äôt stick to it.

‚Äç

Most players start strong but lose focus over time. Here‚Äôs how to stay on track:

‚Äç

Rule #1: Use the 80/20 Rule of Training

80% of your time should go toward your biggest growth areas.
20% should reinforce strengths.

Rule #2: Build Accountability into Your Plan

Check-in weekly with a coach or training partner.
Track progress in a training journal.

Rule #3: Use Competition as a Testing Ground

Apply training under real match conditions.
Watch game film to see progress and adjust strategy.

‚Äç

Why This Matters: Players who train with a system and accountability make massive progress. Those who just "play more" stay stuck.

Let‚Äôs wrap it up.

‚Äç

Elevate Your Game with a Proactive Approach

The difference between good and great players is not talent.

‚Äç

It‚Äôs intentional development.

‚Äç

Your IDP is your roadmap to success. Use it, refine it, and watch your game evolve.

‚Äç

Next Step: Start your assessment today. Identify your weaknesses, build your plan, and take control of your development.

‚Äç

‚Äç

Your success starts now. Let‚Äôs get to work.

‚Äç

Author:

Erik Korem, PhD

CEO at AIM7

‚Äç

title: UT Austin Pickleball Team Wins 2024 College Team of the Year from Dink Awards
summary: Discover how UT Austin's pickleball team earned the 2024 College Team of the Year title from the Dink Awards. Learn about their victories, team culture, and future goals in collegiate pickleball.
content:
Pickleball isn't just about doubles‚Äîsingles play is an entirely different challenge that pushes your stamina, footwork, and shot precision to new heights. While doubles drills help build teamwork and strategy, incorporating singles-specific drills into your training routine can give you a competitive edge. Listen to these tips from Pro player Bobbi Oshiro.

‚Äç

One of my go-to singles drills is called ISOS. This dynamic exercise requires two players and focuses on endurance, accuracy, and efficient movement around the court.

‚Äç

How to Perform the ISOS Drill

Starting Positions:

Player A begins on one side of the court, either the right or left.
Player B starts in the middle of the court.
Drill Execution:

Player A alternates between hitting cross-court and down-the-line shots.
Player B‚Äôs goal is to return each shot back to Player A‚Äôs side, focusing on controlled and balanced strokes.
The key is maintaining consistency, hitting accurate targets, and recovering quickly after each shot.
Drill Goal:

Player B must successfully return 10 balls before switching roles.

This drill is a fantastic way to simulate real singles play, as it trains you to stay balanced while hitting on the run and improves your ability to recover efficiently between shots. Plus, it‚Äôs an incredible workout that will boost your endurance and sharpen your groundstrokes.

‚Äç

Why Singles Drills Matter

Even if you primarily play doubles, working on singles-specific skills can improve every aspect of your game. Stronger footwork, faster reactions, and better shot placement will translate to success in all formats of pickleball.

‚Äç

So next time you hit the court, challenge yourself with the ISOS drill and watch your singles (and doubles) game reach new levels. Have fun, keep pushing your limits, and stay committed to improving your skills!

title: PKLYN Becomes the First Official DUPR Assessment Center in New York City
summary: PKLYN in Brooklyn is the first official DUPR Assessment Center in NYC, offering Coach-Assigned pickleball ratings and promoting competitive play for all levels.
content:
The University of Texas at Austin pickleball team has been voted the College Team of the Year from the 2024 Dink Awards. This honor not only recognizes the team‚Äôs competitive success but also celebrates the strong sense of community and commitment that drives the program.¬†

‚Äç

Over the past season, the UT Austin pickleball team has overcome challenges, celebrated memorable victories, and built a tight-knit community on and off the courts. Their achievements and engaging team culture have caught the attention of the broader pickleball community, making this award a significant marker of their success and impact on collegiate sports.

‚Äç

Dink Awards Vote Breakdown

The Dink Awards have become a revered benchmark for excellence in collegiate pickleball. This year, the College Team of the Year award was decided by a robust total of 5,985 votes, demonstrating the widespread enthusiasm for the sport and for UT Austin‚Äôs program.

‚Äç

University of Texas ‚Äî Austin: 1,152 votes (19.27%)
Ohio State University: 528 votes (8.83%)
University of Florida: 509 votes (8.51%)
UNC Chapel Hill: 493 votes (8.25%)
Utah Tech: 458 votes (7.66%)
University of Southern California: 418 votes (6.99%)
Florida Atlantic University: 394 votes (6.59%)
University of Virginia: 372 votes (6.22%)
Virginia Tech: 330 votes (5.52%)
Purdue University: 235 votes (3.93%)
Samford University: 230 votes (3.85%)
Indiana University: 215 votes (3.60%)
North Carolina State University: 156 votes (2.61%)
Utah State University: 154 votes (2.58%)
Clemson University: 148 votes (2.48%)
Utah Valley University: 144 votes (2.41%)

‚Äç

UT Austin clearly came out on top by capturing nearly 20% of all votes. That shows the program's big influence and the amazing support from its community.

‚Äç

A Culture Built on Loyalty and Fun

The secret to UT Austin‚Äôs success lies in the team‚Äôs unique culture and deep-rooted loyalty. The program has fostered an environment where every member‚Äîfrom students to alumni‚Äîfeels a profound connection to the team and the school. This enduring loyalty has been a cornerstone of their identity, both on and off the court.

‚Äç

"What sets us apart is the unwavering loyalty our students, alumni, and friends have for our school and our team, which truly means a lot to us,‚Äù said UT Austin team captain, Jack Munro.

‚Äç

This commitment goes beyond winning matches; it creates a family-like atmosphere where team dinners, social nights with DJs and food, and mandatory gatherings are all part of building lasting bonds. These events have helped solidify a culture that values both excellence in competition and camaraderie off the court.

‚Äç

Memorable Victories and the Role of Key Players

The UT Austin team has experienced several unforgettable moments during the season, with one particular victory standing out as a turning point. The win at the Collegiate Individual Nationals not only put the team on the map but also created a legacy that continues to inspire the program.¬†

"Timmy was vital to win collegiate thenationals last year. I owe everything to Timmy. He saved seven match points,‚Äù Munro emphasized.

‚Äç

This highlights the pivotal role that individual performances can play in lifting the entire team. Even as players graduate and move on to new opportunities, their contributions remain a lasting part of the team‚Äôs identity, symbolized by the banner proudly displayed at Urban Pickleball.¬†

Such victories not only boost the team's confidence but also cement their reputation as one of the premier collegiate pickleball programs in the nation.

Overcoming the Challenges of Collegiate Pickleball

Running a collegiate pickleball program comes with a unique set of challenges, and UT Austin‚Äôs journey has been a testament to learning through trial and error. Without a clear blueprint for managing everything from flight bookings to scheduling practices and hosting tryouts, the team has had to innovate on the fly.¬†

‚Äç

This learning process has involved seeking advice from other programs and adapting strategies to fit their unique needs.

‚Äç

Logistical challenges aside, the team has also faced the task of building a competitive structure from scratch. Smaller tournaments such as the Texas Super Regional and the Baylor Invitational have served as critical stepping stones.¬†

‚Äç

These events allow the team to gauge the level of regional competition and gain valuable experience, ensuring that they are fully prepared for the national stage.

‚Äç

Leadership and the Importance of Team Bonding

Strong leadership has been a vital component in navigating both the triumphs and trials of the season. The team‚Äôs leadership structure, which includes captains on both the men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs sides, has been instrumental in maintaining focus and morale. Alongside these leaders, Coach Terry McCarthy has played an indispensable role in organizing the team, managing logistics, and providing unwavering support.

‚Äç

"Leadership was huge‚Äîbeing the captain, having Zoeya Khan lead on the female side, and our coach Terry McCarthy who helped us with everything from setting up to booking flights. We owe so much to Terry; he even gave us our first jerseys when we had none,‚Äù Munro said.

‚Äç

This blend of strong leadership and team bonding has allowed UT Austin to maintain a balance between competitive intensity and a fun, inclusive environment. The regular team dinners, social nights, and other bonding activities have not only boosted morale but have also created an atmosphere where every member feels valued and driven to contribute to the collective success.

‚Äç

Building a Legacy for the Future

Winning the College Team of the Year award is more than just a recognition of past achievements‚Äîit is a stepping stone to future success. The award is expected to strengthen the program‚Äôs case for institutional support, such as the installation of permanent pickleball courts at the university.¬†

‚Äç

Such developments would ensure that the team continues to thrive and attract top-tier talent, further establishing UT Austin as a powerhouse in collegiate pickleball. In addition to seeking better facilities, the team has set its sights on ambitious goals for the coming seasons.¬†

‚Äç

They aim to secure back-to-back national titles, even as they navigate changes in player partnerships and adapt to new competitive challenges. The future of UT Austin pickleball is bright, with plans to expand the team‚Äôs social presence and continue building a legacy that will inspire future generations of student-athletes.

‚Äç

"[The] jobs not finished,‚Äù stressed Munro. ‚ÄúOur goal is to win another back-to-back title and keep growing our social side. It‚Äôs where you meet people, where we vibe. For kids coming to UT or getting into collegiate pickleball, it‚Äôs going to be one of the best decisions of your life."

‚Äç

This forward-looking vision encapsulates the team‚Äôs determination to remain at the forefront of collegiate pickleball while also nurturing a community that values both athletic excellence and personal growth.

‚Äç

The Future Impact of UT Austin‚Äôs Success

The recognition as College Team of the Year at the Dink Awards marks a pivotal moment for the UT Austin pickleball program. This accolade is a testament to the team‚Äôs hard work, strong leadership, and the supportive community that rallies behind them. As they continue to build on this success, the program is poised to influence the broader collegiate sports landscape and pave the way for future pickleball athletes.

‚Äç

With an eye on further national success and improved facilities, UT Austin is set to lead the evolution of collegiate pickleball. The program‚Äôs innovative approach, underpinned by a deep sense of loyalty and a vibrant team culture, will undoubtedly inspire new players to join and contribute to the sport.¬†

‚Äç

The UT Austin pickleball team‚Äôs journey is a great example of what can be achieved with passion, perseverance, and a commitment to the community. Their recent recognition at the Dink Awards is not just a win for the team‚Äîit is a win for every member of the UT Austin community and a beacon for future generations in collegiate pickleball.

summary: New to pickleball? Learn how to play pickleball, key pickleball rules, and essential pickleball tips for beginners to boost their DUPR pickleball ratings.
content:

About Reign Storm

Reign Storm contains zero sugar, just 10 calories, 200 mg of plant-based caffeine, is packed with B vitamins, Biotin and an immunity support blend containing Zinc, Vitamin A and C. The drinks help people Live Life Better as they have no added preservatives, no artificially sourced flavors or colors, and no high fructose corn syrup. Available in nine amazing flavors: the new Tropical as well as Guava Strawberry, Mango, Strawberry Apricot, Citrus Zest, Valencia Orange, Kiwi Blend, Peach Nectarine, and Harvest Grape.

Reign Storm is available in the US, Canada, Caribbean, Brazil, Chile, and across Europe; ingredients and flavors featured in the above description vary for countries outside of the US. For more information about Reign Storm, please visit its website www.reignstorm.com, or Instagram @drinkreignstorm

About DUPR

title: Introducing the Collegiate Pickleball Tour!
summary: Discover the Collegiate Pickleball Tour (CPT) launching in 2025 with new events, including the MLP Mid-Season Tournament and Collegiate World Championship.
content:
If you're new to pickleball, you're in for a fun ride! Whether you're looking to pick it up as a casual hobby or dive deeper into the competitive side, understanding the rules of pickleball is your first step. Let‚Äôs break down the pickleball basics, explain the pickleball game rules, and share pickleball tips for beginners to help you get started. Plus, we‚Äôll introduce you to DUPR‚Äîa great way to track your progress and connect with other players!

‚Äç

What is Pickleball?

Before jumping into the pickleball rules, let‚Äôs quickly explain what the game is. Pickleball is a fast-paced sport that combines elements of tennis, badminton, and table tennis. It‚Äôs played with a paddle and a perforated plastic ball, and the objective is to score points by getting the ball over the net and into the opponent's court. It can be played one-on-one or in teams of two.

‚Äç

How to Play Pickleball: A Beginner's Guide

If you're wondering how to play pickleball, it‚Äôs simple! The game is played on a rectangular court with a net in the middle. Here‚Äôs a quick rundown of the pickleball basics:

Serve: The game starts with the serve. To serve, stand behind the baseline, keep the paddle below your waist, and hit the ball diagonally into the opponent's service box. The serve must be underhand and clear the net.
Return: After the serve, the opponent must return the ball. This is done by hitting the ball back over the net, aiming to land it in the opponent‚Äôs court. The ball must clear the net and stay inbounds.
Rally: Once both players have hit the ball back and forth, it becomes a rally. You‚Äôll continue hitting the ball until one side fails to return it or hits it out of bounds.
The Kitchen: The non-volley zone near the net is called the kitchen. You can't step into the kitchen and hit the ball before it bounces unless you‚Äôre standing behind the line. This rule helps keep the game safe and strategic.

‚Äç

‚Äç

Pickleball Rules Explained

Now that you have a basic understanding, let‚Äôs dive into the pickleball game rules you need to know:

Scoring: Only the serving side can score points. A point is earned if the opponent faults (e.g., misses the ball, hits it out, or steps into the kitchen). Games are typically played to 11 points, and you must win by at least 2 points.
Pickleball Scoring Rules: In pickleball scoring rules, players must call out the score before each serve. The score is stated as: server score ‚Äì receiver score. For example, 3-2 means the server has 3 points, and the receiver has 2 points.
Double Bounce Rule: After the ball is served, it must bounce once on each side before players can volley (hit the ball in the air without a bounce). This rule makes the game more strategic.
Faults: A fault occurs when a player makes an error, like missing the ball, hitting it out of bounds, or stepping into the kitchen. Faults result in the loss of a point or serve.

‚Äç

Pickleball Tips for Beginners

If you‚Äôre just starting out, here are some pickleball tips for beginners to help you improve your game:

Practice your serve: Serving is key to starting the point off right. Make sure you get comfortable with underhand serves and aim for accuracy.
Stay patient: Pickleball can be fast but try to focus on making accurate shots instead of rushing to hit the ball.
Move your feet: Positioning yourself properly is essential. Keep your feet moving to get into the best spot for each shot.
Communicate in doubles: If you're playing doubles, communication with your partner is crucial. Make sure you both know who‚Äôs covering which side of the court.

‚Äç

Track Your Progress with DUPR

As you start mastering the pickleball game rules and improving your skills, tracking your progress becomes important. That‚Äôs where DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) comes in! DUPR is a player rating system that helps you measure your skills and compare your performance against others in the pickleball community. Whether you‚Äôre playing for fun or looking to compete, DUPR offers a fair and dynamic way to track your growth in the sport.

By using DUPR, you can find local players of similar skill levels and join competitive games that match your experience. It‚Äôs an excellent tool for pickleball for beginners and seasoned players alike. Download the DUPR app today on iOS and Android!

title: The Collegiate Pickleball Tour Set to Crown the Best College Pickleball Teams in the Country with $100,000 Prize Purse up for Grabs
summary: The 2025 Collegiate Pickleball Tour features $100K in prizes, showcasing top college pickleball teams and players, with competitive rankings and national exposure.
content:
DUPR and the UPA are joining forces to elevate collegiate pickleball even higher with the launch of the Collegiate Pickleball Tour (CPT)! Everything you‚Äôve loved about DUPR Collegiate Pickleball is now enhanced with opportunities to play and showcase college talent at PPA and MLP tournaments.

‚Äç

With new events, and more paths to pro, players will have every opportunity to grow in collegiate pickleball. Read below to see what the Collegiate Pickleball Tour has in store for 2025!

‚Äç

MLP Mid-Season Tournament

Your chance to prove yourself against the best pickleball teams in the world is here! The two finalist schools of the 2025 Collegiate National Championship will be invited to compete in the 2025 Major League Pickleball Mid-season Tournament in Grand Rapids, Michigan. There, they will play in the challenger bracket against MLP teams, and are eligible to win prize money and represent their school at the highest level.

‚Äç

Collegiate World Championship

Collegiate pickleball is going worldwide! Launching in Fall of 2025, collegiate players from all countries across the world will have the opportunity to represent their country at the Collegiate World Championships (CWC). This two day team event will be held the weekend before UPA Worlds and will showcase the top international talent to ultimately crown the first ever Collegiate World Champions.¬†

‚Äç

Here are the registration details to know:

All collegiate pickleball players from all countries are invited to compete
Your team must have 2-3 male and 2-3 female players on it
All players from your team must be representing the same country
You are allowed to team up with players from different universities
You can either represent the country your university is in, or the country you were born in

‚Äç

To determine the World Champion, we will have group play matches on Saturday that will feed into playoff brackets on Sunday. The top performing team from each country from group play will represent the country in the championship playoff bracket on Sunday. More details will be released as we get closer to the date!

‚Äç

Collegiate National Championship

After an electrifying Nationals tournament in 2024, we‚Äôre excited to announce that the 2025 Collegiate National Championship (CNC) will be held at Life Time Peachtree Corners in Atlanta, GA! We‚Äôll be using the same 64 team format as last year, plus introducing a 32 team bracket for 2nd teams and schools without a bid! Here is the link to register!

‚Äç

64 Schools - 1st Team Bracket

In order to compete in this bracket, your school must have earned a bid through one of these ways:

Earned at the 2024 Collegiate National Championship (24 given out)
Earned at a Super Regional (4 given out at each, 4 Super Regionals)
Earned at a Campus Regional (1 given out at each, 18 Campus Regionals)
Earned through Dual Matches (2 given out)
Given a Wildcard bid (4 given out)

‚Äç

The 64 schools that receive a bid will be sorted into 16 groups of 4 teams, with all groups having an equal amount of DUPR. After group play finishes, all 64 teams will then be sorted into the 64 team single elimination bracket (here is the 2024 bracket). In order to become the National Champion, you‚Äôll have to win 6 elimination matches in a row!

‚Äç

Scholarship Money Breakdown: (1st team bracket)
1st: $15,000
2nd: $5,000
3rd & 4th: $2,500
5th through 8th: $1,250

‚Äç

32 Schools - 2nd Team Bracket

This bracket is open to both 2nd teams from schools that have a bid, or the 1st team from schools that didn‚Äôt get a bid.¬†

If your school has a bid, you can sign up for the 2nd team bracket immediately
If your school doesn‚Äôt have a bid, you can sign up the 2nd team bracket after March 9th if there are still open spots

If your school earns their bid after you already signed up for the 2nd team bracket, you will be promoted into the 1st team bracket
The combined DUPR of your top 2 male and top 2 female players must be higher on your 1st team than your 2nd team
If you have a bid, you must play in the 1st team bracket, you cannot opt to only play in the 2nd team bracket

‚Äç

Scholarship Money Breakdown: (2nd team bracket)
1st: $3,000
2nd: $1,000
3rd & 4th: $500

‚Äç

Challenger Bracket

The Challenger Bracket will be split into Men‚Äôs Doubles, Mixed Doubles, and Women‚Äôs Doubles. Depending on the registrations, more splits will be made based on DUPR to create high-quality games for all Challenger Bracket players.¬†

‚Äç

Scholarship Money Breakdown: (Challenger bracket)
$1000: School that brings the most players to the tournament
$1000: School that brings the best performing challenger teams (min. 3 teams)
$500: For the winner of each challenger bracket

‚Äç

Super Regionals

The lifeblood of collegiate pickleball, Super Regionals provide regional opportunities for teams to earn a bid to the Collegiate National Championship, as well as some scholarship money! Each Super Regional gives out 4 bids to Nationals and $6000 in scholarship money to the top performing teams. The Georgia Super Regional on February 1st-2nd this year is the largest collegiate regional of all time, with 272 players from 25 schools! Here are the Super Regionals for the 2025 spring semester:

‚Äç

February 1st-2nd, Georgia Super Regional, Pickle & Social in Atlanta, GA
February 8th-9th, Ohio Super Regional, Paddle Taps in Columbus, OH
March 1st-2nd, New Jersey Super Regional, Robbinsville Pickle House in Robbinsville Twp, NJ
March 8th-9th, Arizona Super Regional, The Picklr in Scottsdale, AZ

‚Äç

Super Regionals for the 2025 fall semester to 2026 spring semester season are still being scheduled.¬†

‚Äç

Showcase Matches

We‚Äôre bringing the college action under the lights on championship court at PPA tour stops in 2025! Showcase Matches will feature college teams competing in dual matches against each other on PPA livestream. Certain stops will showcase top teams playing against and with PPA Pros and the top PPA Juniors talent. Matches played between schools will be counted as official dual matches. For more information about dual matches, read our blog post here.¬†

‚Äç

February 22nd, Carvana Mesa Cup, Arizona Athletic Grounds in Mesa, AZ
March 8th, Veolia Cape Coral Open, Lake Kennedy Racquet Center in Orlando, FL
March 15th, Texas Open, The Courts at McKinney in McKinney, TX
March 26th, Red Rock Open, Little Valley in St. George, UT
April 5th, North Carolina Open, Cary Tennis Park in Cary, NC

‚Äç

title: The Top Players in Pickleball: A Look at the Standouts

content:
PPR-Certified Coaches Lead Global Adoption of DUPR Coach, Unlocking Revenue and Driving Growth for Coaches and Clubs

‚Äç

Wesley Chapel, FL¬† ‚Äì The Professional Pickleball Registry (PPR), Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating (DUPR) and MyJourney Pickleball announced today that PPR will standardize on the Coach-Assigned DUPR Rating Program for its network of over 10,000 PPR-certified coaches. This move empowers PPR-certified coaches to generate DUPR ratings for the 34 million non-rated pickleball players, creating new revenue opportunities for coaches and clubs while driving the growth of the sport.

‚Äç

‚ÄúWith 95% of the world‚Äôs DUPR Coaches being PPR-certified, our coaches are leading the charge in adopting Coach-Assigned DUPRs because it creates immediate value for both coaches and clubs,‚Äù said Sarah Ansboury, Managing Director of PPR. ‚ÄúThis program provides coaches with two significant revenue streams: first, being featured on The Global Pickleball Coach Map connects them with players worldwide, allowing them to create ratings virtually using the DUPR Coach app. Second, coaches can run DUPR Rating Sessions at their local clubs or courts. With DUPR Coach, we‚Äôre not just empowering coaches; we‚Äôre setting the global standard for growing pickleball. The formula is simple: PPR + DUPR Coach = ROI for coaches and their clubs.‚Äù

‚Äç

Zach Lee, a PPR-certified DUPR Coach, highlighted the program‚Äôs value: ‚ÄúHosting weekly DUPR Rating Sessions have transformed the experience at my club. Players benefit from coach-assigned ratings, while I generate additional revenue and elevate the quality of open play and leagues. It‚Äôs a win-win for everyone involved.‚Äù

‚Äç

Brian Lloyd, PPR-certified DUPR Coach and Chief Pickleball Officer for Dill Dinkers, remarked: ‚ÄúI applaud PPR for setting the industry standard to ensure every player is DUPR-rated by equipping coaches with the essential tools and resources. By empowering coaches to provide accurate DUPR ratings, PPR is enhancing the player experience, fostering stronger competition, and unlocking meaningful income opportunities. Coaches are the backbone of this sport, and this program rewards their dedication with new revenue streams, creating a thriving ecosystem that benefits players, clubs, and the entire pickleball community.‚Äù

‚Äç

Katie Nimitz, President of MyJourney Pickleball, emphasized: ‚ÄúPPR‚Äôs decision to standardize the Coach-Assigned DUPR program across their global network of coaches is an important milestone for the pickleball industry. PPR coaches are at the forefront of driving pickleball‚Äôs economic growth by generating Coach-Assigned DUPR ratings for millions of players. PPR is ensuring players are accurately rated and matched to the right skill levels‚Äîall while creating new revenue streams for coaches and clubs. This decision lays the foundation for pickleball‚Äôs continued success, and we‚Äôre proud to be working alongside PPR and DUPR to help scale the sport and drive its GDP forward.‚Äù

‚Äç

Tito Machado, CEO of DUPR, stated: ‚ÄúThe partnership between PPR and DUPR Coach is a monumental step toward making universal ratings more accessible than ever. With PPR-certified coaches leading the way, we are ensuring that every pickleball player‚Äîwhether they‚Äôre stepping onto the court for the first time or training at an elite level‚Äîhas a clear starting point and pathway for improvement. This collaboration doesn‚Äôt just benefit players; it creates real revenue opportunities for coaches and clubs, helping to grow the sport in a sustainable way. Together, PPR and DUPR are setting the global standard for ratings, competition, and player development.‚Äù

‚Äç

PPR-certified coaches who join the DUPR Coach program receive comprehensive training on the Coach-Assigned DUPR process, along with access to DUPR-approved skills rating tools. These resources enable coaches to efficiently and effectively generate ratings at scale, helping to achieve the goal of getting all 34 million pickleball players DUPR-rated.

‚Äç

Coaches interested in becoming PPR-certified DUPR Coaches and being featured on the Global Pickleball Coach Map can find more information and sign up here.

‚Äç

About PPR

PPR is the premier standard in pickleball instructor certification, dedicated to educating, certifying, and supporting pickleball professionals in their mission to grow the game.

‚Äç

About DUPR

DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) is the premier global pickleball rating system and technology platform, trusted by the world‚Äôs leading clubs, tournaments, leagues, and players. DUPR‚Äôs dynamic rating system unifies pickleball across age, gender, and location by analyzing match results to accurately evaluate all players across a 2.000 - 8.000 scale. DUPR is the official pickleball rating of leagues, tournaments and clubs around the world, including United Pickleball Association (UPA), PPA, Major League Pickleball (MLP), Pickleball.com, Life Time, The Picklr, National Team Pickleball League, National Pickleball League. It also owns and operates Minor League Pickleball and Collegiate Pickleball, two of the biggest amateur leagues in the sport. Players and operators can visit www.dupr.com to sign up and learn more.

‚Äç

About DUPR Coach

DUPR Coach empowers coaches to launch Coach-Assigned DUPRs for the 34 million non-rated pickleball players, powered by MyJourney Pickleball.

title: Vietnam‚Äôs First Major DUPR Tournament: An International Pickleball Milestone
summary: Vietnam‚Äôs Championship 2025 marked their first DUPR-integrated tournament, setting a new standard for pickleball ratings and the pickleball community.
content:
Pickleball continues to soar in popularity. Today, we‚Äôre spotlighting the best pickleball players in the world, showcasing the top 5 men and women who dominate the courts based on their DUPR ratings in doubles.

Rankings last updated January 7th, 2025.

‚Äç

Men's Top 5 Players

‚Äç

1. Ben Johns
DUPR Rating: 7.341
Ben Johns remains the undisputed king of pickleball, excelling in singles, doubles, and mixed doubles. His precision, strategy, and unmatched consistency make him the top-rated male pickleball player in the world. Together with his brother, Collin Johns, they have been the top male players in the sport for a long time.¬†
2. JW Johnson
DUPR Rating: 7.142
JW Johnson has earned his spot among the elite with his calm demeanor and sharp, calculated gameplay. Known for his versatility, JW shines in both singles and doubles. Him and his sister, Jorja Johnson, are the only top 10 siblings in the world playing mixed doubles together. Their latest tournament being the PPA Masters in Mission Hills, CA.¬†

‚Äç

3. Christian Alshon
DUPR Rating: 7.072
Christian Alshon, widely known as ‚ÄúThe Tweener King,‚Äù is a player to watch this 2025. After a pause due to injury, he has made an impressive comeback, climbing back into the top 10. Alshon‚Äôs aggressive playstyle and boundless energy make him a formidable opponent on the court.

‚Äç

4. Andrei Daescu


DUPR Rating: 7.037
Andrei Daescu is renowned for his exceptional court presence and strategic doubles play. As a former tennis player, he brings powerful shots and stellar teamwork to his game. One of his latest achievements was clinching the title at the PPA Daytona alongside his doubles partner, CJ Klinger.

‚Äç

5. Federico Staksrud


DUPR Rating: 7.011
Federico Staksrud is a powerhouse in both singles and doubles. His speed, agility, and mental toughness have propelled him to the top. In 2024, he briefly overtook Ben Johns as the world #1 in singles after a standout performance at the PPA Las Vegas. Staksrud‚Äôs steady rise in the rankings is a testament to his dedication and talent.

‚Äç

Women's Top 5 Players

‚Äç

1. Anna Leigh Waters
DUPR Rating: 6.658
Anna Leigh Waters (ALW) is synonymous with pickleball in America. At just 18 years old, she continues to dominate the sport with her dynamic playstyle, quick reflexes, and relentless drive. As the top-rated female player in both singles and doubles, ALW remains the queen of the court.

‚Äç

2. Anna Bright
DUPR Rating: 6.371
Anna Bright has rapidly climbed the ranks with her fierce competitiveness and versatile gameplay. Excelling in both singles and doubles, she consistently delivers standout performances. Recently, she and Rachel Rohrbacher shone at the 2024 Lapiplasty Pickleball World Championships.

‚Äç

3. Jorja Johnson
DUPR Rating: 6.246
Jorja Johnson is one of the sport‚Äôs brightest young talents. At 18 years old, she has entered the top-5 world ranking in doubles. Jorja often competes on the pro tours in mixed doubles, together with her brother JW. Her latest achievement is earning 3rd place in Women‚Äôs Doubles at the PPA Masters in California, together with Tyra Hurricane Black.

‚Äç

4. Catherine Parenteau
DUPR Rating: 6.177
Catherine Parenteau brings grace and strategy to the game. A former tennis player, she excels in both singles and doubles. Often teaming up with Anna Leigh Waters in doubles, and playing against her in singles the duo has dominated the women‚Äôs doubles circuit.

‚Äç

5. Rachel Rohrbacher
DUPR Rating: 6.172
Rachel Rohrbacher has solidified her place among the elite with consistent performances and a keen sense of the game. Her strong doubles play, particularly alongside Anna Bright, makes this pairing a formidable force to watch on the pro circuit.

‚Äç

‚Äç

These top-rated pickleball players represent the pinnacle of the sport, showcasing unmatched talent, skill, and dedication. Whether you‚Äôre a fan or a player, these athletes inspire the pickleball community to strive for greatness. Check out these top players' 2024 DUPR End Of Year Stats!

Still want more? Check out the latest news from the pro tours at MLP‚Äôs and PPA‚Äôs official websites.

‚Äç

title: ‚ÄòUpset of the Year‚Äô: Anna Bright and Andrei Daescu Win The Dink Award
summary: Anna Bright & Andrei Daescu won the "Upset of the Year" at the Dink Awards 2024. Discover their victory and the impact they've made in the world of pickleball.
content:
Vietnam‚Äôs pickleball scene just reached a new level with the successful Facolos Champion 2025 tournament, held on January 19th. This event marked Vietnam's first large-scale tournament with all results submitted to DUPR, attracting over 300 players across multiple categories. Organizer Long Hoang Nguyen played a crucial role in bringing this event to life, introducing international standards to Vietnam's rapidly growing pickleball community.

‚Äç

DUPR‚Äôs Role in Shaping Vietnam‚Äôs Global Reputation

The adoption of the DUPR system, was one of the defining features of the Facolos Champion 2025. This was a landmark decision for Vietnam‚Äôs pickleball community, marking the country‚Äôs first fully DUPR integrated event.¬†

‚Äç

‚ÄúAdopting 100% DUPR was a significant milestone for competitive pickleball in Vietnam. DUPR brought transparency, fairness, and professionalism to our tournaments. With DUPR, players can compare their skills with athletes worldwide, driving them to improve,‚Äù Nguyen explains.

‚Äç

‚Äç

Challenges of Organizing a Large-Scale Event

Organizing an event of this size was no small feat, and Nguyen faced numerous challenges along the way. From securing the right venue to managing player registrations and sponsorships, every detail required careful planning. One of the most significant obstacles was integrating the DUPR system.

‚Äç

‚ÄúOrganizing such a large-scale tournament required meticulous planning,‚Äù Nguyen shares. ‚ÄúThe most significant challenge was collecting DUPR IDs due to the lack of a Vietnamese platform integrated with the DUPR API. To overcome this, we created a simplified online registration form, provided detailed instructions, and regularly updated information on our communication channels.‚Äù

‚Äç

Fostering a Competitive, Yet Supportive Environment

A core goal of the Facolos Champion 2025 was to create a competitive atmosphere that was also supportive, particularly for newcomers. By offering multiple categories, the tournament allowed participants to compete within their skill levels, ensuring that everyone had a fair chance.¬†

‚Äç

Nguyen‚Äôs strategy for fostering this balance between competitiveness and camaraderie was evident in the event‚Äôs organization. Players from all backgrounds had the opportunity to learn from each other while enjoying the thrill of competition.

‚Äç

‚ÄúWe aimed to create a healthy competitive environment by designing the tournament with various skill levels, allowing players to choose suitable categories,‚Äù Nguyen says. ‚ÄúCollaborating with pickleball clubs and sponsors expanded our reach and enhanced tournament quality.‚Äù

‚Äç

‚Äç

‚ÄçLooking to the Future

Vietnam‚Äôs pickleball community is rapidly growing, with immense potential for further expansion. Organizer Long Hoang Nguyen notes that, compared to other Southeast Asian countries, the Vietnamese pickleball scene is exceptionally passionate.

‚Äç

The success of the Facolos Champion 2025 sets a new standard for future pickleball events in Vietnam. Nguyen hopes this tournament will not only inspire future competitions but also attract sponsors and players from around the world.

‚Äç

‚Äç

title: Introducing PodPlay DUPR Challenge Matches
summary: PodPlay introduces DUPR Challenge Matches, simplifying score reporting and tournament management, to provide accurate pickleball ratings for players and clubs.
content:
Tomorrow marks a groundbreaking moment in the world of pickleball as the first official DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) event inside a prison takes place at the MacDougall-Walker Correctional Institution in Suffield, Connecticut. This historic occasion highlights the adaptability and inclusivity of pickleball, as well as the potential of the sport to inspire hope and transformation in unexpected places. At the forefront of this initiative is Angelo Rossetti, who has dedicated himself to sharing the game‚Äôs transformative power.

‚Äç

The First DUPR Prison Event

‚Äç

DUPR, the official global pickleball rating system, provides a fair and accurate measure of players‚Äô skill levels. It has been instrumental in uniting the pickleball community by offering a universal standard for competition and progress tracking. By bringing this system into prisons, Rossetti is breaking new ground, creating opportunities for incarcerated individuals to engage with the sport in a meaningful way.

‚Äç

‚ÄúPickleball is more than a game; it‚Äôs a way to inspire people and bring them hope,‚Äù said Rossetti, a certified pickleball coach.

‚Äç

During tomorrow‚Äôs event, he will document games with pen and paper, following strict prison regulations that prohibit electronic devices. These results will later be entered into a DUPR digital club, preserving the anonymity of players while allowing them to track their progress. This event is a significant milestone in showcasing how pickleball‚Äôs universal rating system can bridge gaps and create connections, even within the walls of a correctional facility.

‚Äç

Bringing Pickleball to Prisons

‚Äç

A year ago, Rossetti was introduced to Pickleball for the Incarcerated League (PICL), a program founded by Sarah Gerstein, one of his former students who brought PICL to the state of Connecticut. PICL‚Äôs mission is to introduce pickleball to incarcerated individuals, providing them with a constructive outlet and a sense of community. Although initially hesitant after a daunting orientation, Rossetti honored his promise to help. His first visit to a correctional facility proved transformative, solidifying his commitment to the program.

‚Äç

‚ÄúWhen I first stepped into a prison for this program, I was intimidated. But that first session was transformative,‚Äù Rossetti shared.

‚Äç

Rossetti now coaches at nearly all of Connecticut‚Äôs correctional institutions that can accommodate pickleball. His sessions emphasize more than just gameplay; they instill life lessons, resilience, and the power of controlling one‚Äôs attitude and effort. For many inmates, the program offers a rare source of hope and joy.

‚Äç

From Racket Sports to Pickleball Pioneer

‚Äç

Rossetti‚Äôs journey to this moment began with a lifelong love of racket sports, nurtured by his grandfather, who built a ping-pong table in his basement. Sundays after church were spent playing table tennis with his brother, Ettore, a partnership that would become the cornerstone of his athletic journey. Transitioning to tennis in high school, Angelo played competitively for the University of Connecticut‚Äôs Division 1 team.

‚Äç

‚ÄúPickleball clicked for me when I saw how easily different ages and levels could play together,‚Äù said Rossetti.

‚Äç

Pickleball entered his life six years ago, almost serendipitously. After giving tennis lessons to his daughter‚Äôs friends, Rossetti introduced them to pickleball in his driveway. The instant connection the young players felt to the sport ignited Rossetti‚Äôs curiosity. He recognized pickleball‚Äôs unique appeal‚Äîits accessibility for players of all ages and skill levels‚Äîand decided to shift his focus from tennis to pickleball full-time.

‚Äç

‚ÄúI‚Äôve completed every certification out there because I want to be the best for the people I coach,‚Äù said Rossetti.

‚Äç

Rossetti‚Äôs commitment to the sport has been extraordinary. This dedication also led to a Guinness World Record: on August 17, 2024, Rossetti and Ettore completed 10,532 consecutive volleys without a miss, raising funds for Save the Children. This accomplishment, alongside his earlier tennis world records, highlights the brothers‚Äô philosophy of blending sport with purpose.

‚Äç

A Family Bond Rooted in Sport

‚Äç

Angelo‚Äôs bond with Ettore has been instrumental in his journey. The duo‚Äôs approach to sports transcends competition. They‚Äôve always embraced the ‚Äúinfinite game‚Äù‚Äîplaying for joy, improvement, and connection rather than simply to win. Their shared experiences, from childhood table tennis matches to world record pursuits, have fostered a relationship that Rossetti describes as deeper than typical sibling ties.

‚Äç

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs my best friend, my confidant, my mentor,‚Äù Rossetti said, reflecting on his relationship with Ettore.

‚Äç

Their connection has fueled many of their shared milestones, including their Guinness World Records and charity work. Ettore's unwavering support and shared love for racket sports have been a constant source of strength and motivation for Angelo. Together, they continue to push the boundaries of what can be achieved through sport, both on and off the court.

‚Äç

For Angelo, having Ettore by his side also means having someone to hold him accountable and challenge him to be better. It‚Äôs a relationship built on trust, mutual respect, and the joy of shared successes, making their journey even more meaningful.

‚Äç

Inspiring Through EAGLES and Effort

‚Äç

Rossetti‚Äôs coaching philosophy is rooted in his acronym ‚ÄúEAGLES,‚Äù which stands for Effort, Attitude, Gratitude, Learning, Enjoyment, and Sportsmanship. He shares this mantra with inmates to encourage them to focus on controllable aspects of life and to play with freedom and joy. At one correctional facility, his teachings left such an impact that inmates painted a mural of two eagles alongside the acronym, symbolizing hope and inspiration.

‚Äç

‚ÄúFocus on your EAGLES: Effort, Attitude, Gratitude, Learning, Enjoyment, and Sportsmanship,‚Äù said Rossetti.

‚Äç

Photo Credit: Tyler Russell/Connecticut Public

‚Äç

The mural serves as a lasting testament to the impact Rossetti‚Äôs words and actions have had on the inmates. For many, the concept of EAGLES becomes more than just an acronym‚Äîit‚Äôs a framework for rebuilding their lives, even within the constraints of incarceration. It reminds them of their capacity to grow, adapt, and find joy in the small victories.

‚Äç

This philosophy also reflects Rossetti‚Äôs broader mission: to teach life lessons through pickleball. Whether on the court or in life, focusing on controllable factors helps players‚Äîand people‚Äîfind peace and purpose despite challenges.

‚Äç

Changing Lives with Pickleball

‚Äç

While many of the inmates Rossetti coaches may never be released, his efforts are making a tangible difference. One standout player, who is set to reenter society, represents the potential for programs like PICL to bridge the gap between incarceration and reintegration. Rossetti envisions a future where more inmates can use their pickleball skills to connect with communities outside prison walls.

‚Äç

‚ÄúThis is about more than pickleball‚Äîit‚Äôs about changing lives,‚Äù said Rossetti.

‚Äç

Tomorrow‚Äôs DUPR event marks a significant step forward. It not only highlights the adaptability and inclusivity of pickleball but also demonstrates how a universal rating system can foster connections in the most unexpected places. As Rossetti continues his work, his story serves as a powerful reminder of pickleball‚Äôs potential to change lives, one rally at a time.

‚Äç

Photo Credit: Tyler Russell/Connecticut Public

‚Äç
