title: Noe Khlif - Miami Pickleball Club's Newest Member from France
summary: Noe Khlif joins Miami Pickleball Club! From France to Major League Pickleball, discover his journey, career highlights, and current pickleball ratings as he takes on the pro circuit.
content:
The DUPR¬†Collegiate¬†Florida Super Regional was celebrated this past weekend of September 21-22 at The Pickleball Club in Port St. Lucie. Being the first Super Regional of the season, it included lots of new players, nerves, and a high dose of excitement!

‚Äç

This event was the 4th largest Super Regional, hosting¬†22 teams competing for a bid, including 88¬†student athletes participating, along with 11 teams and 22 players in the challenger bracket division (110 students in total). Check out the results below:

‚Äç

‚ÄçFlorida Atlantic University (FAU) vs University of Miami (UMiami)

Womens: FAU-21/UMiami-16

Men's: FAU-21/UMiami -18

Mixed 1: FAU-21/UMiami-11

‚Äç

Semi final #2: University of Florida (UF) vs Florida State University (FSU)

Women's: UF-21/FSU-17

Men's: UF-21/FSU-17

Mixed 1: UF-21/FSU-11

With UF¬†and FAU¬†advancing to the final, the level of excitement kept on rising!

‚Äç
Final Result

Florida Atlantic University vs University of Florida

Women's: FAU-21/UF-12

Men's: FAU-21/UF-14

Mixed: FAU-21/UF 17

‚Äç

With their win on Sunday, FAU became the first school to be a repeat winner of a collegiate tournament, as they won the Florida Regional in 2023. What‚Äôs even more impressive is they lost fewer doubles games on the way to the championship, going from 1 loss in 2023, to 0 losses in 2024. They have more Championship wins than doubles losses at the DUPR Florida events, a stat that shows why they‚Äôre one of the best teams in the country. If you‚Äôre an opposing school, what should be even more concerning is that their team of four players are all teenagers. What is an imposing force now, could turn into an absolute juggernaut by 2026 with two years of playing together and building chemistry. It will be exciting to see how FAU stacks up against the other titans of collegiate pickleball when they all face off at the Collegiate National Championship on November 1-3 in Dallas, Texas.

‚Äç

FAU will see some familiar faces in Dallas, as FSU, UMiami, and Kennesaw State all gained a bid to Nationals thanks to their performance at the Florida Super Regional. Broward College made a splash by winning the challenger bracket in their first tournament showing. In the Round of 16, the #14 seeded UGA team pulled off the biggest Regionals upset ever by beating #3 seeded UF 2 in a dreambreaker. UF will be able to get their revenge against UGA, as they both have bids to Nationals from previous tournaments.¬†

‚Äç

A special thanks goes to our DUPR Collegiate Pickleball partners: JOOLA, HEAD, GAMMA, Rally Republic, Osaka, No Apologies Hydration, Erne, Pickleball Superstore, and Total Pickleball. Another thanks goes to The Pickleball Club in Port St. Lucie, FL for hosting the 2nd annual Florida Super Regional!

‚Äç
---> In case you missed it, watch the FL Super Regionals and get caught up here!

‚Äç

What to expect for the Virginia Beach Super Regional this weekend

The 5 consecutive weeks of DUPR Collegiate Super Regionals continue, as Viriginia Beach Super Regional starts this Saturday, 28th of September. This DUPR tournament features 17 schools and 35 teams, with the University of Virginia (UVA) leading with five teams. This event is the 2nd largest Super Regional event in collegiate DUPR history, highlighting the growing enthusiasm for the Collegiate competition.

‚Äç

Saturday 28th Schedule

‚Äç

Of all the participating teams only North Carolina State, Duke, UNC Charlotte, High Point University, Liberty University, and UNC Chapel Hill are eligible to earn a bid as the rest of the teams either already have one or fall outside the top 16 teams (only top 16 can earn a bid). With just three more Super Regionals left to secure national bids (Nevada, Houston, and Arizona), the pressure is on.

‚Äç

Sunday 29th Schedule

‚Äç

Additionally, there are 11 wild card bids available for teams that don't qualify for a bid, giving them a chance later in the season. This weekend promises thrilling matchups and high stakes for players, coaches, and fans alike!
‚Äç

---> Don't miss any of the action this weekend - watch the semis and finals on our live stream HERE!

‚Äç

title: A Step-By-Step Guide To Dominate Tournament Season
summary: Learn how to prepare for tournaments, build match volume and optimize your training schedule. Stay at peak performance, avoid burnout, and improve your pickleball rating with this step-by-step guide!
content:
Dive in and get to know the newest member of the Miami Pickleball Club (MPC), Noe Khlif!

‚Äç

All the way from France, Noe recounts his journey from discovering the sport in a Chicago gym to pursuing a professional career. Initially attracted to pickleball's social vibe, Noe has become competitive, participating in tournaments and making strides in his career, including being drafted into Major League Pickleball (MLP).

Balancing a full-time job as an auditor, Noe looks forward to focusing solely on pickleball. He shares memorable experiences, admires tennis legend Rafael Nadal, discusses his training, and aspires to win bigger titles soon in his emerging pickleball career. Excited about the sport's growth, Noe is ready and eager to shape his future in pickleball!

‚Äç

Find out more about Noe on this Q&A:

‚Äç


How and where did you find pickleball?
I discovered pickleball at my local gym when I was living in Chicago. I saw people playing indoors on a basketball court and I was like " What the hell is this?". I tried it and loved it!

‚Äç

How has it changed your life?
At first I was just playing for fun. Then I was missing competing so I decided to start playing a couple tournaments. I was doing well and the sport started exploding so I became interested in trying to play the professional circuit. Now I can't imagine my life without pickleball whether with friends for fun or competitively. Fun Fact I also met my girlfriend at a pickleball tournament!

‚Äç

What is your favorite memory from your career so far?
Utah PPA was a great memory. I was sick and almost didnt play the tournament but I ended up beating Dylan Frazier and Jay Devilier making the quarterfinals. I also made the quarterfinals in doubles and played the Johns brothers on Center Court for the first time so it was pretty cool! I was also very excited when I got drafted by Miami for MLP. Finally, my girlfriend and I qualified for Mixed Pro Main Draw in our first PPA together!

‚Äç

What motivated you to become a pro pickleball player?
I love competing and the atmosphere in tournaments. I also enjoy traveling and discovering new places. Ideally I would love to make a living out of it.

‚Äç

Noe at PPA Tournament

‚Äç

What has been the most fun about joining Major League Pickleball? What has been a challenge?
Joining Major League Pickleball was very exciting. It's fun to compete as a team against the best players out there. Getting used to the format and atmosphere was the most challenging I would say.

‚Äç

What athlete or person inspires you the most?
My idol growing up was Rafael Nadal. I love the way he competes and fight on every point. He is one of the toughest athlete out there mentally and physically.

‚Äç

What does your current training regimen look like?
I have a full time job as an Auditor at Deloitte right now so I havent been able to train as much as I can unfortunately. I usually hit the gym early in the morning before work and try to drill after work. I will go full time pickleball starting July 20th so I am excited about the idea to be able to train more.

‚Äç

What is your greatest accomplishment in sports so far?
Won the French National Championship (tennis) in singles when I was 14 and in doubles when I was 12 and 16. Also won a Big Ten title playing for the University of Illinois.

‚Äç

What do you do outside of pickleball?
I have a full time Job as an Auditor at Deloitte. I also love playing golf whenever I have time and watching sport or tv shows.

‚Äç

What is your current DUPR?
Currently it is 6.333 in Doubles and 6.579 in Singles.

‚Äç

What is the biggest title you would like to achieve in your pickleball career?
Win gold medals in Singles and Doubles on different pro tour events, and of course Win MLP.
‚Äç
What did you feel like getting drafted to play for MPC?
I was very excited when I got the news I got drafted. That was one of my goal this season and I‚Äôm very happy to have the opportunity to compete as part of an MLP team.
Noe with doubles partner Bobbi Oshiro at MLP NYC

‚Äç

How was the first MLP event of the season for you in terms of nerves, atmosphere, and team chemistry?
I really enjoyed my first MLP event. We had some really close matches which was very exciting. It took me a little bit of time to get used to the new format and different atmosphere, but thankfully I have an amazing team that helped me with this transition and I feel better and better with every match I play.

‚Äç

How does the MLP format feel compared to playing PPA's or other non-team events?
MLP format makes things very interesting because anything can happen. Every point matters and each game is usually very close, so you have to be all-in from the first point to the last point. I like competing as part of a team, because you are playing for something bigger than yourself. It gives additional motivation.

‚Äç

What are your team and personal goals for this season?
Our goal as a team is to finish on top of the Challenger standings and get promoted to Premier. My personal goal is to help the team achieve its goal and to give myself the opportunity to compete in the premier league next year.

‚Äç

Anything else you want to add?
It's good to see pickleball growing the way it has been over the last couple of years, allowing professional players to focus full-time on their pickleball career. I can't wait to see how the sport keeps growing and evolving over the next years. It's really exciting!

‚Äç

Follow Noe's pickleball journey together with Miami PC on his Instagram!

‚Äç

title: Clearing Up the Confusion: Why DUPR is Pickleball‚Äôs Most Accurate Rating
summary: Learn why DUPR is the most accurate pickleball rating system, trusted by 4700+ clubs and pro tours. Join the community and improve your game with reliable player ratings.
content:
Pickleball tournament season can be grueling. Players often face fatigue, poor performance, and injury risk.¬†

‚Äç

But it doesn't have to be this way.¬†

‚Äç

With the right strategy, you can maintain peak performance throughout the season. This guide will show you how to prepare, train, and recover effectively. You'll learn the necessary skills to achieve your performance potential while staying healthy.

‚Äç

Step 1: Build Your Match Volume

Many players underestimate the demands of tournament play. This leads to inadequate preparation and subpar performance.

‚Äç

You must be well prepared for the worst-case scenario regarding the maximum pickleball you may need to play over a multi-day tournament. For example, if you play singles, doubles, and mixed doubles in a large field, you could play up to 5 (five) x 30-minute matches daily.

‚Äç

That‚Äôs almost 8 hours of matchplay.¬†

‚Äç

And these aren‚Äôt just normal matches. These maximum-intensity matches will drain your physical and mental energy, and that‚Äôs not even considering the challenges of playing on the road, away from your home court.

‚Äç

The first step to dominating the tournament season is increasing your match play volume.

‚Äç

Calculate the difference between your weekly match play volume and the projected tournament volume. If you currently play 4 hours of competitive match play per week, the difference is 4 hours.

‚Äç

Next, increase your weekly match play volume, in minutes, by 10-15% until you reach tournament volume.

Week 1: 276 min (+15%)

Week 2: 317 min (+15%)

Week 3: 365 min (+15%)

Week 4: 420 min (+15%)

Week 5: 460 min (+10%)

‚Äç

Following these steps to build the matchplay volume required for grueling tournaments.¬†

‚Äç

Step 2: Increase Intensity

Tournament match play will challenge you both physically and mentally, and if you aren‚Äôt prepared to sustain a high level of intensity, your play will deteriorate over time.

‚Äç

In addition to accumulating more volume of match play, you should deliberately intensify your on-court and off-court training leading up to a tournament season.

‚Äç

Here's how to push your limits and see real growth:

On-Court

Challenge yourself against superior opponents to increase physical and mental training stress.
Create scenarios where you are down several points at the end of a match and must overcome negative momentum to win.

Off-Court

Four to six weeks before the tournament season begins, incorporate lactic power training to enhance stamina for singles play and develop a mental edge.¬†

‚Äç

The primary goal of lactic power training is to improve the body's ability to produce energy quickly in the absence of oxygen (anaerobically) and increase tolerance to the accumulation of lactic acid, which can cause muscle fatigue and a burning sensation. This type of training is often incorporated into sports that require repeated bursts of high-intensity efforts, such as pickleball, soccer, basketball, or hockey.

‚Äç

Key components of lactic power training:
High Intensity: Exercises are performed at near-maximal effort (80-95% of your maximum heart rate).
Short Duration: Work intervals last between 30 seconds to 2 minutes.
Recovery Periods: Rest between sets is often 2-4 times the length of the work interval to allow partial recovery.
Repeated Efforts: Typically, multiple sets of these high-intensity efforts are performed with the goal of increasing tolerance to lactate.

‚Äç

I recommend removing lactic power training seven to ten days before your first tournament. In addition, consider performing the sessions off the court (e.g., biking, rowing, sprinting, etc.) to prevent injury.¬†

‚Äç

‚Äç

Step 3: Optimize Your Weekly Training Schedule

Many players fail to structure their training week effectively. This results in fatigue, inconsistent performance, and increased injury risk. During a competitive season, your goals during the training weeks are to:

Recover from the previous event
Refine your skills & enhance your tactics without inducing excessive fatigue
Prime your brain and body for the upcoming event¬†¬†

‚Äç

Here's a winning weekly schedule:

Monday: Focus on recovery with active and proper nutrition
Tuesday: High intensity/moderate volume court session + strength training
Wednesday: Low intensity/low volume court session
Thursday: Implement stimulatory practice to prime your body for competition
Friday-Sunday: Dominate tournament play with peak performance

‚Äç

Download our FREE AIM7 training calendar for more details on the optimal weekly training schedule to help you win more matches.

‚Äç

Step 4: Stimulate Don‚Äôt Annihilate!

The two mistakes I see players making before a tournament that leads to predictably poor performance are:

Overtraining the week before the tournament and failing to perform to their potential.
Mismanaging recovery and resting too much. In this case, they start slow and lose early in the tournament.

‚Äç

Here's how to prevent these mistakes and prime yourself for success:

Move your mid-week recovery day to Wednesday (T-2) for a Friday start date.
On Thursday (T-1), implement a short, intense court session to stimulate your nervous system for the tournament's first day.

‚Äç

This strategy ensures you prevent a sluggish start by priming your body for performance.

‚Äç

Step 5: Master Long-Term Tournament Season Management

Many players burn out during extended tournament seasons because they fail to account for the compounding effects of consecutive tournaments.

This leads to declining performance and increased injury risk.

‚Äç

Here's a strategy to maintain peak form during a long competitive season of back-to-back tournaments.

‚Äç

Maintain your weekly training structure for the first 1-3 consecutive weekends. Give your body time to adapt to the rigors of a competitive season. After a month of tournament competition, lower your weekly training volume (on-court time & strength training volume) but maintain a high level of intensity on key training days.

‚Äç

At this point of the season, fitness shouldn‚Äôt be an issue, and the goal should be to refine your skill, maximize recovery, and level up your play each weekend. Also, listen to your body! Just because you have a plan on paper doesn‚Äôt mean you need to follow it.

‚Äç

Wrap Up

Performing at your best during tournament season requires a strategic approach to training and recovery. By building match volume, increasing intensity, optimizing your weekly schedule, and mastering long-term management, you'll set yourself up for success.

Remember, the key is balance. Push yourself in training, but don't overtrain. Recover actively, but don't become sluggish. And always listen to your body ‚Äì it's your best guide throughout the season.

‚Äç

The RPPk Master Instructors and Luis Mediero, head of RPPk.

title: DUPR And SPORTIME Pickleball Partner To Drive Growth Of Game Through Level-Based Play
summary: SPORTIME Pickleball adopts DUPR pickleball ratings to enhance competitive, level-based play across its clubs.
content:
Mehvish Safdar, a collegiate pickleball player and former D1 tennis player, has become one of Collegiate Pickleball's top competitors. While studying sport psychology at Indiana University, she secured two first-place trophies at the 2024 College Individual National Championship (CINC).

‚Äç

Learn more about her insights and advice below! (Responses were transcribed from a video interview and edited by Charles Smith.)

‚Äç

Tell us about your background in tennis and what inspired you to pursue it at a higher level.
‚ÄçI started playing competitive tennis at a very young age ‚Äîsome might say I was born with a racket in hand. I'm the youngest of three girls, and they both played. I just picked it up in the park and then played with my sisters. Others recognized some potential in me, highlighting that it was something that was worth continuing to pursue.

‚Äç

What challenges did you face transitioning from collegiate tennis to life without competitive play?
I had a difficult time transitioning out of tennis because it was such a big part of my life. Then pretty soon after I found pickleball, which was great because it was something new, but familiar. I felt I was able to pick it up pretty quickly. The tennis background helps you be a decent pickleball player, but it‚Äôs not enough to be a great pickleball player. I actually think that my tennis background helped me and hurt me. It helped me with the basics, but I've had to unlearn a lot of tennis tendencies that have hurt me in pickleball.¬†

‚Äç

Which mental techniques or strategies have been effective for you or other athletes that you've worked with when competing at an elite level?
I've actually had the opportunity through my schooling and training to work with collegiate athletes on mental performance. I think a couple things that I would say have been helpful for me and have often been helpful for athletes include going into practice or even competition and looking at it as a positive opportunity. So an opportunity to compete, exercise, have fun, and implement the things that you've been working on. I think that it can be helpful to take a step back and have perspective. It is just a game and the sun will rise tomorrow. There are a lot of really difficult things going on in the world, and I think having that perspective can really help elite athletes perform at a higher level as well as just enjoy the sport more.¬†

‚Äç

‚Äç

Watch Mehv's full interview on our YouTube channel!

‚Äç

What advice would you give to current athletes who are approaching the end of their collegiate or sports professional career?¬†
I'm actually working on my dissertation research right now for my PhD program. My focus is helping athletes navigate the transition out of collegiate sports, so it's important to recognize who you are outside of just being an athlete.
The stronger adherence you have to your athletic identity can really hurt you mentally. So recognizing that there's more to you than just being an athlete or recognizing that even those traits or skills that you possess as an athlete can transfer to other aspects of your life can be really helpful when transitioning out of sports, whether it's at a collegiate or professional level.

‚Äç

Do you have any hopes for the impact your research could have?¬†
I think that the ultimate goal is that the research translates into practice in some way. In sport psychology, a lot of the research is based around how we optimize performance outcomes on various psychological or mental skills.¬†
I'm also trying to bring an emphasis to how we can help athletes transition out of sports. For my dissertation, I'm trying to look into programming specifically that will help athletes have an easier transition out of collegiate athletics. There's a lot of research on the challenges that student athletes will experience, but there's not a ton of research on how we take those results and then create programming that will actually help them with the issue.¬†

‚Äç

Were there any resources or support systems that helped you transition out of collegiate sports?¬†
I could have really used someone like my current self or any sport psychology consultant or mental performance coach when I was a college student athlete. I think even if you're not engaged in traditional programming or if programming isn't out there to help you transition out of sport, it's really important to lean on your social supports and talk to other former student athletes and normalize that difficult transition.¬†

‚Äç

You performed great at THE DUPR CINC 2024, getting first place twice in mixed doubles and women's singles! How did those wins feel and what was your experience with the overall competition?
I was playing for Indiana University (IU), and IU pickleball was born very recently, so we created a competitive team in the fall of 2022. This year was our first showing at the Collegiate Individual Nationals.¬†
I think we had a good showing all around for it being our first time there. It was in Cincinnati, Ohio, which is home for me, so it was extra special. My parents were there and we played at the facility that I started playing tennis at. That was extra cool, and it was a really fun experience.¬†
We got to play a lot of matches within a couple of days: I played 23 matches in two days, which is wild. I had a couple of very bruised toenails after the tournament. Also, I got to meet a lot of new people. Everyone's really friendly at these college tournaments, and DUPR does a great job of creating a very organized environment and also an environment that's just fun and friendly. DUPR also takes very good care of the athletes too.
Our team had a few coaches there: Timber Tucker, Courtney and Kirby Shedd. They all volunteered their time and energy to help grow the IU pickleball team and support collegiate pickleball. That was great having them there. I got two titles while I was there which was exciting, and I got to make some money along the way. It was a really great weekend overall!

‚Äç

Keep up with Mehvish's journey on Instagram, and check out her team Indiana University Pickleball Club!

‚Äç

Written By: Charles Smith

‚Äç

title: Osaka World Brings Fresh Flair to Pickleball
summary: Osaka World teams up with DUPR Collegiate Pickleball, blending style, performance, and community to shape the future of the fastest-growing sport in the U.S.
content:
Sponsorship Marks Popular European Brand‚Äôs First Entry into Racquet Sports in the United States¬†

‚Äç

‚ÄçDelray Beach, FL and New York, NY (September 3, 2024) - DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) presented by Delaware Life announced Osaka, the leading sports and lifestyle brand in padel, field hockey and other emerging sports, is making its first entry into pickleball as the official apparel sponsor of DUPR Collegiate Pickleball. Together, Osaka and DUPR will further advance the growth of collegiate pickleball and support more opportunities for collegiate athletes to compete regionally and nationwide.¬†

‚Äç

Osaka World was founded in 2011 in Antwerp, Belgium, with the commitment to fuse sports heritage with lifestyle. Named after one of the biggest cities in Japan because of our great admiration for Japanese culture and its design ethos, Osaka World operates on a design principle where less is more, striving for design inspired by versatility, functionality and durability. With a spirit of inclusivity and innovation, Osaka World embraces a diverse range of sports and activities. From the intensity of field hockey to the finesse of padel and pickleball, Osaka World‚Äôs offerings are meant to elevate a players game and enhance their lifestyle. The brand‚Äôs offerings extend beyond sports equipment, encompassing apparel for other racket sports, teamwear, fitness essentials, and the recently launched women‚Äôs focused fashion-conscious sport range.¬†

‚Äç

Tito Machado, CEO of DUPR, said: ‚ÄúCollegiate pickleball is the fastest growing segment of the game, and we‚Äôre honored to have the support of Osaka as we continue to create more opportunities and pathways for athletes to compete. This year will be our biggest slate of events yet, and it's an honor to have partners like Osaka to make the experience even better for the thousands of players who participate in the DUPR Collegiate tour.‚Äù¬†

‚Äç

Valentin Debouche, USA Executive Director of Osaka said: ‚ÄúDUPR is heavily invested in the growth and legitimacy of pickleball in the US. They are present on all fronts and are always looking for more initiatives to be involved with. For a brand like Osaka entering a new market and space with pickleball, this is what you look for in partners. We are honored to partner with DUPR and support the growth of collegiate pickleball.‚Äù¬†

¬†

Since holding its first event in 2022, DUPR‚Äôs college program has solidified its position as the premier tour in the world, establishing a circuit of over 250 collegiate pickleball programs and 1,300 athletes to compete and earn prize money. In 2024, the DUPR Collegiate Tour will run 27 regional and national events, with opportunities for collegiate players to compete at the same events as the professionals through its partnership with the United Pickleball Association.

‚Äç

To sign up for events and learn more, please visit www.dupr.com/collegiate.

‚Äç

About Osaka World‚Äç

Meet Osaka World, the epitome of vibrant athleticism and timeless style. Rooted in the heart of sports culture, we‚Äôve evolved from our humble beginnings in field hockey to become a dynamic sports lifestyle brand that transcends boundaries.¬†

‚Äç

At Osaka World, we believe in empowering athletes of all ages and backgrounds. Whether you‚Äôre a young enthusiast stepping onto the court for the first time or a seasoned pro seeking performance-enhancing gear, we‚Äôve got you covered.¬†

‚Äç

With Osaka World, it‚Äôs not just about the game‚Äîit‚Äôs about embracing the spirit of sportsmanship, camaraderie, and self-expression. Join us on this exhilarating journey as we redefine what it means to live life with passion and purpose.

‚Äç

About DUPR Presented by Delaware Life¬†

DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) presented by Delaware Life, is the premier global pickleball rating system and technology platform, trusted by the world's leading clubs, tournaments, leagues, and players. DUPR's dynamic rating system unifies pickleball across age, gender, and location by analyzing match results to accurately evaluate all players across a 2.000 - 8.000 scale.¬†

‚Äç

DUPR is the official pickleball rating of leagues, tournaments and clubs around the world, including UPA, PPA, MLP, Pickleball.com, LifeTime, The Picklr, National Team Pickleball League, National Pickleball League, Pickleball England and Asian Pickleball Association, among others. Players and operators can visit www.dupr.com to sign up and learn more.¬†

‚Äç

To learn more about Osaka's strategic partnership with DUPR, read the Q&A with Osaka here.

title: How Old Coast Pickleball Club Achieved 100% Member Retention and Enhanced Operational Efficiency through CourtReserve and DUPR
summary: Discover how Old Coast Pickleball Club boosted retention and efficiency with DUPR's rating system and CourtReserve, fostering fair play and member engagement.
content:
‚ÄçValentin Debouche, Executive Director at Osaka World USA, shares insights on the company's strategic partnership with DUPR and their exciting entry into the rapidly growing pickleball market, emphasizing community building and appealing to collegiate athletes.

‚Äç

Why did you decide to partner with DUPR? ¬†

There are two things that immediately connected DUPR and Osaka: a sense of passion and community.¬†¬†

¬†

Meeting Ben and Tito, we realized that DUPR was heavily invested in the growth and legitimacy of the sport in the US. They are present on all fronts and are always looking for more initiatives to be involved with. For a brand like Osaka entering a new space with pickleball, this is what you look for in partners.¬†¬†

¬†

The DUPR team‚Äôs excitement for what is to come in pickleball has been infectious. We hope that the collaboration between DUPR and Osaka brings many successes, building up from Collegiate Pickleball to more joint ventures in the future.¬†¬†

¬†

Why is Osaka looking to enter into the pickleball space? How do you view this sport and the opportunities within? ¬†

Since 2022, it has been clear that Osaka will eventually enter the pickleball market. With 38M players in the US and a 40% increase in new members YoY, it has become the fastest growing sport in the US by a mile.¬†¬†

¬†

For those who do not know Osaka, we can be considered as an up-and-coming brand for up-and-coming sports. We believe that passion for a sports brand comes from the right balance between fashion and function. People are not just looking for a high performing racquet or paddle anymore. They are always on the lookout for what is going to become the next cool thing. This is what we believe to be our edge at Osaka, where we have had a central focus on stylish, contemporary, and unique designs.¬†

¬†

With pickleball, we aim to have the same success as with other sports, by bringing a lifestyle approach paired with top-of-the-line equipment. We are ready to take on this great challenge.¬†¬†

¬†¬†

What do you hope to gain from this partnership? ¬†

With this partnership, we hope to bring brand awareness and gain more exposure to the pickleball market, reach a large audience, and connect with players at events nationwide.¬†¬†

¬†

The collegiate events part of this partnership is particularly important to us. A successful strategy for the Osaka team has been to focus on activations at events and connect with players by providing them with a distinct experience. First impressions matter. Being able to display your brand and what you stand for in front of thousands is an opportunity we could not pass on. There is no better way to get a positive momentum with the people you connect with.¬†¬†

‚Äç

Once we have established that first connection with the players, we accompany them throughout their development. We are there every step of the way and can give them access to high-performance equipment from entry-level to elite. And because of our lifestyle approach, we are constantly developing more collections to appeal to our young and older customers and give them that sense of community.¬†

‚Äç

We look forward to attending our first DUPR events. To all college players, you are in for a treat!¬†

¬†
What do you hope this partnership offers to collegiate pickleball players? ¬†
¬†‚ÄòWhy fit in when you were born to stand out?'

This has been at the core of everything we do at Osaka. On top of the unique design identity, one of our key strengths is to adopt a lifestyle approach to all our sports. We recognize that people are not just playing a sport for the health benefits of it. People have a need to be a part of a community. And that is exactly who we want to target in the marketing of our brand. Once you give an athlete a sense of belonging through your brand, they will stay loyal to you.¬†

We hope to bring this sense of community to all the collegiate players we will meet and interact with during our partnership with DUPR. We hope to bring them a new brand that will appeal to them and stand out from the masses.¬†¬†

¬†

What was particularly appealing to you about the collegiate pickleball space?¬†

Collegiate athletes represent the strongest segment of our customer base. They sit at the forefront when it comes to adopting unique brands, new products and embracing new innovations. They are the disruptors we hope to collaborate with to bring our brand to new heights.¬†¬†

As the sport grows in popularity and professionalizes itself, college players will become the next (inter)national athletes and ambassadors for our brand.¬†¬†

¬†¬†

To learn more about Okaka's partnership with DUPR, click here.

‚Äç

title: PickleballENGLAND Announces DUPR as Official and Exclusive Rating Partner
summary: PickleballENGLAND names DUPR as its official rating partner, integrating it into all tournaments and leagues, including the English Open and Nationals, to ensure fair, level-based play.
content:
For the third year in a row, Pickleball England has successfully hosted Europe's largest pickleball tournaments, furthering the growth of this exciting sport on a global scale. This year's event featured pro players from around the world, including notable names like Ryler Deheart, Max Jesus Manthou, Susannah Barr, and Thadea Lock. As always, DUPR was there to provide official ratings, ensuring an accurately measured competitive experience for all players.
‚Äç

About Pickleball England and The English Open


‚Äç

Pickleball England began its journey in January 2019 and has proudly hosted the English Open for the fourth time. Compared to last year, the English Open saw a remarkable jump in participation, growing from 1,059 players in 2023 to 1,998 in 2024‚Äînearly doubling in just one tournament! Notably, the English Open attracted an impressive 45 different nationalities (including the 4 countries forming the UK), showcasing the sport's international appeal.

‚Äç

Karen Mitchell, co-founder and chair of Pickleball England, highlights what makes the English Open a standout event. "It‚Äôs the friendliness of our players‚Äîabout 80% are from the UK‚Äîcombined with the allure of professional players and enriching experiences like clinics and 'play with a pro' sessions. Our reputation has been meticulously built over the years, enhanced by live-streaming from our Championship Court. It‚Äôs a unique combination of factors that create a special atmosphere."

‚Äç

The Road to Gold

‚Äç

This year, American player Jack Munro and British/German player Megan Fudge certainly made their mark at the Open. Jack clinched multiple medals, including silver in Men's Doubles and gold in Mixed Doubles.

‚Äç

‚ÄúThere was such an incredible atmosphere with winning gold alongside Megan, and seeing my international fans is definitely my favorite part‚Äù, Jack shared, ‚Äúbut I do think one of the most memorable moments for all of our players is playing against a completely different nationality, in which there were many fans and supporters that watched and rooted against us just because they wanted to support their home country. That is something that we were not used to, and definitely took some acclimating,‚Äù he adds.

‚Äç

Jack Munro and Megan Fudge claiming the title

‚Äç

Megan, who has been competing internationally for some time, echoed this sentiment.

‚Äç

"It feels great to add more international pro medals under my belt. I‚Äôve noticed that many international players bring a lot of bang-bang‚Äù she says, "fast-paced, aggressive style to the game, often stemming from their tennis backgrounds. I had hoped to medal in both mixed and doubles events, and I achieved that."

‚Äç

The Growth of Pickleball Data and Accurate Ratings

‚Äç

The DUPR system played a crucial role in ensuring fair competition throughout the tournament. ‚ÄúThe reliability of player ratings has significantly improved,‚Äù Karen notes, emphasizing that players will need to compete at the right skill level for upcoming events like the English Nationals.

‚Äç

Jack and Megan both see the benefits of growing the sport globally. Jack reflected,

‚Äç

‚ÄúThe multiple medals definitely help with validation, especially across the pond," Jack says. "Being able to play in a completely different environment, with a completely different play style and attitudes towards the game, is something that I was not used to. I'm glad I was able to live up to expectations at this tournament and look forward to continuing to do so.‚Äù¬†

‚Äç

Meanwhile, Megan expressed excitement about the sport‚Äôs future:

‚Äç

"I think we will continue to see an exponential growth globally as tours evolve and more international tournaments get bigger prize money and draws. It‚Äôs an exciting time to be part of pickleball!"

‚Äç

As the sport continues to flourish, Karen adds:

‚Äç

"The more data that goes into DUPR the more accurate our players' information will be, which will help us ensure that players enter the right skill level events which in turn will make brackets fairer for players."

‚Äç

Indeed it is an exciting time to be a part of pickleball, and we can‚Äôt wait to continue to provide accurate ratings across the globe throughout every player's pickleball journey!

‚Äç

Follow Jack and Megan's journey on their Instagram, and don't miss any upcoming events with Pickleball England.

title: FansPlay Named Official Fan Engagement Sponsor of The Dink Minor League Pickleball
summary: FansPlay partners with The Dink Minor League Pickleball as the official fan engagement sponsor, bringing fantasy sports-like gamification to pickleball tournaments.
content:
Governing Body Will Integrate DUPR Into All Tournaments and Events, Including English Open, English Nationals and pickleballEngland¬†¬†

‚Äç

PickleballENGLAND, the country‚Äôs governing body for pickleball, has adopted DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) Presented by Delaware Life as the official and exclusive ratings partner for the federation.¬†

‚Äç

DUPR evaluates players based on match results to provide a real-time, reliable assessment of their skill level. The rating system analyzes a player‚Äôs match results to provide a real-time assessment of their skill level across 2.000 - 8.000 scale. All players, regardless of their age, gender or location, are rated on the same scale, unifying the pickleball community with a common language through an accurate, global rating system.

‚Äç

PickleballENGLAND requires all players participating in the English Open, English Nationals and PickleballENGLAND leagues to have a DUPR account. PickleballENGLAND will also ensure that results from these events are submitted to DUPR to count for player ratings.¬†

‚Äç

‚ÄúDUPR‚Äôs system is used by thousands of clubs, leagues and tournaments to provide competitive, level-based play for the millions of pickleball players worldwide,‚Äù said Karen Mitchell, co-founder and Chair of PickleballENGLAND. ‚ÄúAdopting DUPR as the official and exclusive ratings partner will help create fair and open competition for players of all levels, from beginners to those playing in the country‚Äôs top events. Our mission is to create and support opportunities for everyone to enjoy and achieve in pickleball, and DUPR‚Äôs rating system and technology will help us in reaching these goals.‚Äù¬†

‚Äç

‚ÄúPickleballENGLAND is one of the sport's most innovative and influential governing bodies. They have been sharing the results from the English Open with DUPR for three years, which has been instrumental in driving the adoption of the rating at the club and grassroots level. We are honored to now become the official rating of the federation and further support¬† their efforts in advancing the growth and development of the sport in the UK and worldwide,‚Äù said Tito Machado, DUPR CEO.¬†

¬†

Players who do not currently have a DUPR account can go to www.dupr.com or download the app to create a free profile and begin logging their match results to establish their rating.¬†

‚Äç

About DUPR¬†

DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) presented by Delaware Life, is the premier global pickleball rating system and technology platform, trusted by the world's leading clubs, tournaments, leagues, and players. DUPR's dynamic rating system unifies pickleball across age, gender, and location by analyzing match results to accurately evaluate all players across a 2.000 - 8.000 scale.¬†

‚Äç

DUPR is the official pickleball rating of leagues, tournaments and clubs around the world, including UPA, PPA, MLP, Pickleball.com, Life Time, The Picklr, National Team Pickleball League, and National Pickleball League. Players and operators can visit www.dupr.com to sign up and learn more.¬†

‚Äç

About Pickleball England¬†

PickleballEngland is a non-profit set up to promote and encourage in every way at local, national and international level the sport of pickleball and to act as the sole governing or delegating body for the sport in England. In collaboration with other appropriate bodies in Northern Ireland, Scotland and Wales, it promotes the sport of pickleball throughout the UK.

‚Äç

title: DUPR Welcomes Pick‚Äôd Performance Plus as Official Hydration Sponsor of DUPR Collegiate Pickleball Powered by JOOLA
summary: Pick‚Äôd Performance Plus joins DUPR Collegiate Pickleball Powered by JOOLA as the official hydration sponsor, delivering cutting-edge hydration and cramp relief for collegiate athletes.
content:
AUSTIN, Texas (August 16, 2024) ‚Äì The Dink Minor League Pickleball (MiLP), powered by DUPR, the organization dedicated to creating more events and opportunities for amateur players in the US and worldwide, is excited to announce that FansPlay has been named official fan engagement sponsor.

‚Äç

This partnership is another way The Dink Minor League Pickleball is redefining the tournament experience for pickleball players and fans across the world.

‚Äç

What is FansPlay?

FansPlay is a first-of-its-kind platform dedicated to enhancing your pickleball experience by offering fantasy sports-like gamification to pickleball.

‚Äç

FansPlay promises a true immersive experience for the racquet sports Fantasy Gaming industry. Create your dream team of real players and compete for points based on their performances in live matches.

‚Äç

"I picked my dream team and had a ton of fun following along my players and seeing how they were doing ... I can't wait to see FansPlay grow pickleball engagement." - Megan Fudge, #1 player on APP Tour

‚Äç

Bringing Fantasy Teams to Pickleball

To create a team on FansPlay, simply install the application, navigate to the Create Team process under a specific Tournament/Event, and make player selections based on allocated points, etc.

‚Äç

FansPlay employs an innovative 100-point credit system, allowing users to strategically build their dream teams. Each player has a designated point value, and users can use their credits to select players and enhance their gameplay.

‚Äç

Through FansPlay, users can participate in multiple tournaments simultaneously. You can explore their comprehensive tournament overview to discover ongoing tournaments and join the ones that interest you.

‚Äç

Learn more about FansPlay and download the app from their website.

‚Äç

title: DUPR Officially Launches Provisional DUPR Rating Tool for Coaches
summary: DUPR Coach empowers pickleball coaches to generate Provisional DUPR ratings, helping 34M non-rated players assess their skills while creating new revenue streams for coaches and clubs.
content:
Partnerships Further DUPR‚Äôs Position as the Preferred Ratings Partner for Major International Pickleball Tours, Leagues and Governing Bodies

‚Äç

DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) presented by Delaware Life, today announced it has been named the official and exclusive ratings partner for Pickleball Peru, the country‚Äôs governing body for pickleball, and the Pickleball World Cup, the premier professional tournament for the top players of every country.¬†

‚Äç

Founded by professional players Hercilio Cabieses and Miranda Cabieses, the 2024 Pickleball World Cup will host 450 athletes from 25 delegations in Lima, Peru, on October 26th and 27th to compete for glory in pickleball‚Äôs biggest global event. The Pickleball World Cup will leverage DUPR to evaluate and seed players within the competition.¬†

‚Äç

Additionally, Pickleball Peru, the governing body for pickleball in the country, will adopt DUPR as its official rating for the III Official Pickleball Tournament - International. All sanctioned events run by Pickleball Peru will require participants to have a free DUPR account. Results from all Pickleball Peru matches will be shared to DUPR to count towards player ratings.¬†

‚Äç

‚ÄúDUPR‚Äôs system is accurate and reliable, and used by thousands of clubs, leagues and tournaments to provide competitive, level-based play for the millions of pickleball players worldwide,‚Äù said Hercilio Cabieses, founder of Pickleball World Cup and President of Pickleball Peru. ‚ÄúOur mission is to grow the game of pickleball nationally and internationally,¬† and DUPR provides a universal language to connect every pickleball player under one rating system. We are confident that DUPR will support our players in having even better pickleball experiences and our organizers in creating more engaging, level-based opportunities for players to compete.‚Äù

‚Äç

The partnerships with Pickleball Peru and Pickleball World Cup reinforce DUPR‚Äôs position as the preferred ratings partner for leagues, tournaments and governing bodies all across the world. DUPR works with over 50 governing bodies, including the Asian Pickleball Association (comprised of 36 countries), European Pickleball Association (TK countries) and Pickleball England, and is the official rating of the world‚Äôs most influential¬† pickleball leagues, events and tournaments including Major League Pickleball, World Pickleball Rankings, the US Open Championships presented by Margaritaville, among others.¬†

‚Äç

‚ÄúWe are honored to support Pickleball Peru and the Pickleball World Cup with a best-in-class rating system to further their efforts in creating the best possible pickleball experiences for players of all levels,‚Äù said Tito Machado, DUPR CEO. ‚ÄúOur goal at DUPR is to support everyone in pickleball with access to a simple and reliable rating system. Pickleball is still in its infancy, and the more we can work together to establish a universal language and standard for everyone in the game, the healthier the sport will be for generations to come.‚Äù¬†

‚Äç

DUPR evaluates players based on match results to provide a real-time, reliable assessment of their skill level. The rating system analyzes a player‚Äôs match results to provide a real-time assessment of their skill level across 2.000 - 8.000 scale. All players, regardless of their age, gender or location, are rated on the same scale, unifying the pickleball community with a common language through an accurate, global rating system.

¬†

Interested delegations of each country can learn more about the Pickleball World Cup on this link and for players interested in the open tournaments can visit this website. All players must have a DUPR account to participate in the event. To sign up for a free DUPR profile and get a pickleball rating, visit DUPR‚Äôs website or download the app.¬†

‚Äç

###

About DUPR¬†

DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) presented by Delaware Life, is the premier global pickleball rating system and technology platform, trusted by the world's leading clubs, tournaments, leagues, and players. DUPR's dynamic rating system unifies pickleball across age, gender, and location by analyzing match results to accurately evaluate all players across a 2.000 - 8.000 scale.¬†

‚Äç

DUPR is the official pickleball rating of leagues, tournaments and clubs around the world, including UPA, PPA, MLP, Pickleball.com, LifeTime, The Picklr, National Team Pickleball League, National Pickleball League, Pickleball England and Asian Pickleball Association, among others. Players and operators can visit www.dupr.com to sign up and learn more.¬†

‚Äç

About Pickleball Peru¬†

Pickleball Peru is the non-profit organization that is leading the promotion and development of the sport in the country since 2021. During these years, they have achieved agreements with government entities such as Special Project Legacy and the Peruvian Institute of Sports, which are in charge of the facilities and development of sports in the country. Currently, pickleball has spread at a regional level, it is played in 8 departments of the country and also has the first para pickleball club which promotes the participation of people with disabilities. In numbers, Pickleball Peru has done more than 300 exhibitions all over the country and in Latin America, thanks to this more than 50,000 people in the country have played the sport for the first time. To get to know about their work, you can visit their social networks as @pickleballperu on instagram and facebook.

‚Äç

About Pickleball World Cup

The Pickleball World Cup 2024 Bicentennial Edition is an international competition that will bring together the best representatives of the discipline.¬†

‚Äç

Pickleball is one of the fastest growing sports worldwide. As a result, Peru will host an unprecedented mega event, which will bring together the best exponents from more than 25 countries, in search of glory at the Legado de la Videna venue. In addition to that, with their participation, they will support the promotion and development of pickleball, since their registration fee is donated to Cabieses Foundation to keep spreading the love for the sport.

‚Äç

Likewise, this great event will count with the participation of 12 certified referees, guaranteeing the highest quality standards.¬†

‚Äç

The 2024 Pickleball World Cup also has a digital presence on Instagram. If you wish to see more content on our profile, you can find us as Pickleball World Cup.

‚Äç

This October 26th and 27th, Lima is waiting for you to live an unforgettable experience.

‚Äç

content:
DUPR Officially Launches Provisional DUPR Rating Tool for Coaches ‚Äì ‚ÄúDUPR Coach‚Äù Enables Coaches to Generate Provisional Ratings for Players & Create New Revenue for Themselves & Their Clubs

‚Äç

Rehoboth Beach, DE ‚Äì DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) presented by Delaware Life and My Pickleball Coach have launched ‚ÄúDUPR Coach,‚Äù a technology tool that enables coaches to provide every pickleball player with a full skills analysis and produce a Provisional DUPR for non-rated players. A Provisional DUPR can only be created by a certified DUPR Coach and rates 18 skill sets of a player‚Äôs game, including shot selection, court positioning, partner chemistry, and technical skills.

‚Äç

DUPR Coach empowers coaches to¬† generate Provisional DUPRs for the 34 million non-rated pickleball players in the U.S. using a simple technology tool.

‚Äç

Brian Lloyd, Chief Pickleball Officer of Dill Dinkers, remarked: ‚ÄúSince pickleball is primarily played in a doubles format, the enjoyment and growth of the game require parity of skills. If one player is lower (or higher) in skill level, it impacts the quality of the match for all four players. The Provisional DUPR tool is a high-fidelity way for a player to truly have their skills analyzed by certified DUPR Coaches. This allows players to start their individualized development plan while enabling coaches the ability to support them from anywhere. It allows clubs to run more enjoyable or competitive events, like open plays or round robins, and caters to those new to the sport with the knowledge to register for the ‚Äòright‚Äô event. As a coach, I simply open an app on my phone and produce a Provisional DUPR in a few minutes.‚Äù

‚Äç

Brian continues, ‚ÄúThe pickleball industry has a very rare opportunity to transform millions of non-rated players into active, engaged members. For coaches, DUPR Coach is the most important tool a coach can have; their phone is now a member engagement device.‚Äù

‚Äç

David Kempster, Director of Racquets at The Peninsula Golf and Country Club, a Troon Club, emphasized the importance of why Provisional DUPRs are needed for the growth of the game: "When you provide a non-rated player who‚Äôs relatively new to the game with a Provisional DUPR and grow their skills to a 3.5 DUPR, it creates a long-term member. DUPR Coach enables me to rapidly assess a player‚Äôs skills‚Äîlike nothing I‚Äôve ever seen. I now run the DUPR Assessment sessions monthly so players can see where they are and how good they can be.‚Äù

‚Äç

Gavin Leon, Director of Racquets at Baltimore Country Club (BCC), a private club with over 5,000 members, highlights the importance of the Provisional DUPR: ‚ÄúFor pickleball's growth to be sustainable and non-rated members to better engage and enjoy the sport, there must be a standard for matching players‚Äô skill levels. Similar to the GHIN Handicap in golf, DUPR provides players with an objective way to measure their skill level so they can have the most fun playing competitively. As a DUPR Coach, I can now rapidly generate Provisional DUPRs and develop skills for hundreds of newcomers. At The Baltimore Country Club, coaches now have a new program to welcome non-rated DUPR players. Already, we have seen this approach improve membership growth and retention.‚Äù

‚Äç

Jeff Rausch, Director of Pickleball at the Austin Pickle Ranch, expressed his enthusiasm for the impact of Provisional DUPRs for both players and facilities: ‚ÄúBefore DUPR Coach, our assessments helped players understand their skill level, but they lacked the formal recognition needed to take action. Now, with Provisional DUPRs, coaches at the Austin Pickle Ranch will be able to accurately assess players and provide them with a globally recognized rating to kick-start their DUPR journey. This not only helps our members better understand their abilities but enables all players to join skill-based play at their appropriate level. The introduction of Provisional DUPRs is a crucial step in ensuring the sport‚Äôs long-term success by creating fair, fun, and competitive play at our facility and beyond.‚Äù

‚Äç

The DUPR Coach provides coaches with a new revenue stream through DUPR Skills Assessment Events, which are designed for coaches and clubs to elevate their pickleball offerings and boost revenue. These events come with a robust revenue model. Attendees receive a Provisional DUPR, helping them understand their current skill level and set goals for improvement, and they receive long-term personalized coaching that keeps them engaged while they improve.

‚Äç

Tito Machado, CEO of DUPR stated: ‚ÄúCoaches are the lifeblood of pickleball, and the DUPR Coach tool is meant to empower coaches in their efforts to bring more players into the game and create even more engaging pickleball opportunities for all levels. Pickleball is still on a remarkable global growth trajectory and supporting coaches with the ability to assign players Provisional DUPRs will make their entry into pickleball even more enjoyable and ultimately keep them on the court for years to come. We are excited to partner with My Pickleball Coach to merge our tools, technology and expertise to support the growth of the game at all levels."

‚Äç

Coaches interested in becoming a DUPR Coach and providing Provisional DUPR Ratings Services can find more information HERE.

‚Äç

About DUPR

DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) presented by Delaware Life, is the premier global pickleball rating system and technology platform, trusted by the world's leading clubs, tournaments, leagues, and players. DUPR's dynamic rating system unifies pickleball across age, gender, and location by analyzing match results to accurately evaluate all players across a 2.000 - 8.000 scale.¬†

‚Äç

DUPR is the official pickleball rating of leagues, tournaments and clubs around the world, including UPA, PPA, MLP, Pickleball.com, Life Time, The Picklr, National Team Pickleball League, National Pickleball League, Pickleball England and Asian Pickleball Association, among others. Players and operators can visit www.dupr.com to sign up and learn more.¬†

‚Äç

About DUPR Coach

DUPR Coach enables coaches to launch DUPR Provisional ratings for the 34 million non-rated pickleball players, powered by My Pickleball Coach.

‚Äç

2024 Collegiate National Championship

This fall semester brings us the 3rd annual Collegiate National Championship! With 64 schools and 600+ players expected, it will surpass the 2023 Nationals as the largest collegiate pickleball tournament ever.¬†

Here is the schedule:

Any school that has attended at least 1 Super Regional or Campus Regional is eligible for a wildcard bid. title: Secure Your Dream Ticket: Compete in Regional Showdowns to Earn Guaranteed Spot at the 2024 National Championship!

content:
Partnership Will Launch DUPR High School Pickleball Scholarship Fund to Support High School Pickleball Programs¬†

‚Äç

Delray Beach, FL and TK, TK (August 17, 2024) ‚Äì In an effort to meet the increasing demand among young people for opportunities to participate in pickleball, DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) presented by Delaware Life and Pickleball Cares, a nonprofit striving to grow the game, today announced a new partnership to support local high school pickleball programs with scholarships, tools and technology to grow the game in their communities.¬†

‚Äç

A key part of the initiative is the launch of the DUPR High School Pickleball Scholarship Fund, a new program specifically designed to support high school players who want to get in the game. The fund will be used to support high school pickleball programs that use DUPR through scholarships provided by Pickleball Cares to help break down barriers to participation so that all students have the opportunity to get involved and experience the many positive physical and mental elements of the game.¬†

‚Äç

‚ÄúSports offer so many benefits for kids, from mental and physical health, to forging opportunities and connections that may not have existed before. We are honored to partner with Pickleball Cares to support their incredibly impactful efforts to grow the game and create more opportunities for young players to get involved,‚Äù said Tito Machado, CEO of DUPR.¬†

‚Äç

DUPR provides the sport‚Äôs leading tools and technology, including its global rating system which evaluates player skill level, enabling players to find more competitive, level-based matches and competition, set goals to track their progress and offer connectivity to the global pickleball community. Its organizational platform and technology are used by thousands of organizers, from local clubs to colleges, to major and minor leagues - including Major League Pickleball, LifeTime and The Picklr.¬†

‚Äç

‚ÄúDUPR‚Äôs free and unified rating system makes them the perfect partner to support our mission of developing a love of pickleball for players of all levels. When players are rated on DUPR, they are connected to a global pickleball community, and can not only find more opportunities to play, but can set goals, track their progress and identify competitive pathways in high school, college and even the pros. We are thrilled to partner with their team and continue to grow the game together,‚Äù said Geoffrey Nguyen, Executive Director at Pickleball Cares.¬†

‚Äç

Pickleball Cares is a leading nonprofit organization that strives to change lives through pickleball ‚Äì from players of all skill levels to the communities that support the game. By creating opportunities to participate, Pickleball Cares is working to improve outcomes for young people across education, health, self-confidence and the overall well-being of all those who are touched by the sport.¬†

‚Äç

DUPR is committed to supporting organizations of all sizes anywhere in the world that are driving positive growth in the game. To learn more about working with DUPR, please visit dupr.com/clubs.

‚Äç

‚Äç

About DUPR¬†

DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) is the premier global pickleball rating system and technology platform, trusted by the world's leading clubs, tournaments, leagues and players. DUPR's dynamic rating system unifies pickleball across age, gender and location by analyzing match results to accurately evaluate all players across a 2.000 - 8.000 scale. Players and operators can visit www.dupr.com to sign up and learn more.¬†

‚Äç

About Pickleball Cares

Pickleball Cares‚Äô mission is to impact lives through pickleball ‚Äì from players of all skill levels to the communities that support the game. Sports like pickleball have the potential to transform lives, but access to play isn't equal for everyone. Introducing this game and providing opportunities for youth, particularly those from underserved communities who might not have access to recreational activities to participate can offer life-changing benefits, enhancing their education, health, self-confidence, and overall well-being. Pickleball Cares aspires to promote accessibility and inclusivity in sports, especially for underserved communities.

title: DUPR and Pickleball Superstore Align to Support Clubs, Organizers and Collegiate Programs with Virtual ProShop Offerings and Super Affiliate Program
summary: DUPR teams up with Pickleball Superstore to offer clubs and collegiate programs Virtual ProShop access, streamlined pro shop solutions, and revenue opportunities‚Äîall while enhancing pickleball ratings and competitive play.
content:
Ben Hildreth has lived in Taiwan for over 10 years and works as an international school PE teacher and account manager for DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) presented by Delaware Life. An avid traveler, he has visited more than 75 countries. Ben enjoys all sports, with a particular passion for pickleball, running, scuba diving, and fitness. He has a small addiction to K-dramas, counting calories, and beach days. Whether exploring a new country or running a round-robin, Ben embraces life with enthusiasm and a zest for discovery.

How did you get involved with DUPR?

A colleague already involved in pickleball reached out when he heard I was playing internationally and teaching pickleball as a PE teacher. He made a few introductions to people in the industry, and now I work for DUPR. It‚Äôs been exciting to see pickleball and DUPR grow throughout Asia.

Can you explain what DUPR is and is it only for elite and competition players?

DUPR (Dynamic Universal Pickleball Rating) is pickleball‚Äôs most accurate and widely adopted global rating system. It gives players a rating based on match results and helps them find more opportunities to play. Everyone can use DUPR ‚Äì whether you‚Äôre a recreational player, club warrior, or a pro. It‚Äôs free to use and makes pickleball even more fun.

DUPR‚Äôs rating system is based on match results, so it provides the most reliable assessment of player level in an easy-to-understand way. All players, regardless of their age, gender, location, or skill, are rated on the same scale between 2.000-8.000. Here‚Äôs what the rating looks at: The algorithm considers four factors:

Points ‚Äì If you win 11-3, you go up more than if you win 11-9. Competing against similar-level players will have a greater impact on your rating.
Recency ‚Äì When entering matches, more recent matches will move you more than old matches.
Total Match Count ‚Äì If you‚Äôve played in a lot of matches, your rating will fluctuate less compared to a player with a lower match count.
Every Match Matters ‚Äì Every match counts toward your rating, even if you are playing against someone who is unrated or new to DUPR.

When players have a rating, it makes playing even more fun. Players can find more opportunities to play with others at their level and track their progress, and clubs and tournaments use DUPR to create better competition. It‚Äôs a language that unifies the game across age, gender, skill level, and location. If you have a rating on DUPR, you can find fun pickleball play wherever you are. ¬†

When people first signed up for DUPR, we saw some very strange ratings (e.g., a beginner with just one or two games getting a strangely high ranking). Why does that happen? And how long is it before a typical DUPR rating is ‚Äúaccurate?‚Äù

Just like any system, the more information (i.e. match results) that DUPR has, the better the system is at evaluating a player‚Äôs skill level because it has a bigger pool of results to analyze. A player who is just starting may see their rating fluctuate a bit before it levels out to offer a more reliable assessment of their skill level. DUPR recently introduced a Reliability Score, which is a percentage that indicates a player‚Äôs progress toward achieving a reliable rating to help players understand their rating.

Players who have more results in DUPR will have higher reliability scores because there are more match results to analyze, offering a more in-depth view of their ability. A player who is just starting will have a lower reliability score because DUPR does not have as many results to analyze. As players play more and share their results with DUPR, their ratings become more and more reliable, and their reliability scores will go up.

A player‚Äôs Reliability Score reflects a few things ‚Äì how many match results are in our system, how recently they‚Äôve played, and the variety of players they‚Äôve played against. A higher Reliability Score means the player is consistently uploading match results to the system, while a lower score indicates that there is some catching up (i.e., more playing!) to be done.

There isn‚Äôt necessarily a set time frame that a player can follow to achieve a reliable rating. Instead, DUPR recommends focusing on the following:

Play with various partners and opponents.
Play against similarly rated opponents.
Play club/tournament matches.
Play against highly reliable players.

These are the key factors in ensuring a player has a reliable rating. .

What are DUPR‚Äôs main aims/mission? And how are they playing out in Asia?

DUPR‚Äôs mission is to unify pickleball across age, gender, and location with a simple rating system while fostering a sense of fairness and competition for pickleball players across the globe. The players in Asia are fantastic, and the numbers are growing. ¬†Pickleball clubs are sprouting up at an amazing rate. You can find a club to play in almost every country in Asia. Tourists from all over the globe have added pickleball to their travel itinerary as a fun way to meet locals and log some games in different countries (like a digital souvenir!). ¬†Asia also has many high-level players playing in the PPA, MLP, & Major League Pickleball Australia.

Which are the most active DUPR countries around Asia right now?

The Philippines, China, Vietnam, Malaysia and Chinese Taipei have been very active lately. ¬†These countries are uploading scores through tournaments, leagues, team formats, and open play. ¬†

If you meet a player and they say, ‚ÄúWhy should I bother signing up for DUPR?‚Äù what are the main reasons you give them?

DUPR makes sure that games are fair, which leads to more interesting matches and gameplay.
You can keep track of your progress and see where you‚Äôre doing well and where you need to improve, which is very important for getting better at the game.
The ratings help event organizers set the seeds, which makes tournaments more competitive and well-organized.
DUPR‚Äôs universal method promotes inclusion by not caring about age or gender, making the facility a friendly place for all pickleball fans.
It is an international benchmark for assessing pickleball skills as the sport gains global popularity, crucial for international tournaments and monitoring players‚Äô proficiency worldwide.
When players are rated on DUPR, they can find fun, competitive opportunities to play wherever they are in the world.

Outside of ratings is there anything DUPR and the DUPR app can be used for?

Yes! ¬†You can use the platform to find players of similar skill levels in your area so that you can play with them! ¬†You can also see where you rank inside the digital club that you have joined this helps fan the flames of friendly competition. You can also DM players directly through the app to stay connected! ¬†The app also can be used for DUPR Feeds, which allow you to:

Follow Friends: Stay in the loop with your pickleball pals! With the new Feeds feature, you can now follow your friends and catch up on their latest pickleball adventures, victories, and more.

Post Text or Images to Feed: Share your pickleball journey with the community! Whether it‚Äôs a stunning action shot or a post-game reflection, you can now post text or images directly to your feed for everyone to enjoy.

Highlight Top Matches: Showcase your best plays and give fellow players a front-row seat to your pickleball progress.

Comment on Players‚Äô Matches: Celebrate victories, share tips, or simply cheer on your fellow players. Feeds allows you to engage in lively discussions by commenting on the matches posted by others.

Comment on Players‚Äô Posts: Connect with players through comments on their posts and keep the post-match buzz alive off the court.

Tag Players: With Feeds, you can tag your friends and fellow players in your posts, ensuring they never miss a moment of the action.

Tag Clubs and Events: Stay connected with the broader pickleball community. Tag your favorite clubs and events that you‚Äôre registered for in your posts to share the excitement.

‚Äç

‚Äç

Published from Pickleball News Asia and written by Andrew:¬†Group Publisher at Asia Online Publishing Group & IPTPA Level 1 certified pickleball coach
